loans.name: Sreykol

texts.en:
Sreykol is 35 years old and a villager from Ponhea Leur district of Kandal province.  She is married and has five dependent children to cater for as they are still in school.  For her kids’ sake, she does rice cropping on two hectares as the main source of income.  She has been involved in the current business for ages and is able to earn about 40,000 KHR per day.  

This is the second microloan for Sreykol with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She has fully repaid back her past loan with success and it has enabled her to provide daily decent food for her kids.  Now, her son wants to learn the Korean Language for a career opportunity.  Therefore, she is applying for an education loan to pay for her son’s tuition fee.  She hopes that her son will complete this short training course with a positive outcome and get a good job to earn more income to help the family.

loans.use: To pay for her son’s tuition fee

loans.name: Sengkun

texts.en:
Residing in Bakan district of Pursat Province, Sengkun is a 46-year-old mother of four kids who are students in the local state school.  To provide the daily decent food for her kids, she sells grocery items and raises pigs.  The current business has returned her about 38,000 KHR per day in income.  

This is not the first loan for Senghun with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She can support her pig raising business on time from the past loan that she has completely repaid back. Now, she is seeking for a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy pig feed and vaccinations for her pigs.  She hopes that she can raise healthy pigs and sell it at a high price so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and vaccinations for her pigs

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: Sergio a sus 21 años de edad se dedica a trabajar la agricultura, como actividad económica. Actualmente, tiene cultivos de maíz en un terreno alquilado en una  finca familiar. Debido al invierno los cultivos han venido presentando inconvenientes, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de semillas, abonos y riegos agrícolas que le permitan mejorar sus cultivos y obtener una producir de mayor calidad, Lo que le permitirá vendarlas a un mejor precio y generar mejores ingresos para su núcleo familiar.
texts.en: Sergio, who is 21, earns his living working in agriculture.  He currently grows corn on a rented plot of land at a local farm.   As the winter has badly affected his crops, he is seeking a loan to buy seeds, manure and agricultural sprinklers, which should enable him to improve his yield and obtain a higher quality product.  This will mean that he can sell his crops at a better price and generate a higher income for his household.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure and agricultural sprinklers

loans.name: Chanroeun

texts.en:
A mother of four kids who are in school and living in Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province, Chanroeun is 33 years old and one of many villagers in the local area who raises ducks and grows rice as the main source of income.  She has involved in this business for ages. Including this loan.  

She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past three loan cycles.  These loan have sustained her business and returned her a decent income, up to 40,400 KHR per day.  Now, she is seeking for a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR.  She will spend her loan portion to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer and to pay for transplanting fees for her cash crop.  She has high hopes that she will increase her income from her business and expand greatly expand it.

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of fertilizer and to pay for transplanting fees

loans.name: Leap's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Leap is a 32-year-old married mother of two children who are dependents, one of whom is in school.  Rice farming and cassava growing have been the main sources of her family’s income for 14 years.  To better support the family and help to earn more income, her husband works as a paid worker.  Together, they can earn about 20,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs and manage to save about 8,000 KHR each day for the future needs. 

Leap’s group consists of three members who are just with VisionFund for this cycle.  Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan.  Leap, who is the leader, wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her rice and cassava.  With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice and cassava fruitfully and healthily and also hopes to make more income to improve her standard of living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her rice and cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Don's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Don is 58 years old and married.  She has seven children.  To support the family, she and her husband have been farming rice and growing cassava for 39 years.  They supplement the income by working for others for a fee. 

The current business earns her family about 18,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs.  Don’s group consists of two members who are just with VisionFund this cycle.  Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each.  As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to use a portion of it to spend on labor fees.  She hopes to increase her income from the current business so as to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en: Irshad is 52 years old woman.  She lives in Lahore, Pakistan.  She is a responsible mother of 6 children.  Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. From the past many days his rickshaw is not working properly, because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income.  He wants to repair it as soon as possible.  However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw.  Therefore Irshad has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw.  This will help him to continue his business.  Irshad is so thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To cover the cost of repairing rickshaw

loans.name: Sergio Alberto

texts.es:
Sergio, se dedica a la jardinería, actividad que aprendió desde hace más de 14 años. Trabajó toda su vida como empleado en diferentes fincas de su localidad.
Desde hace un año tomó la determinación de independizarse y dedicarse  a prestar el servicio de mantenimiento de jardines. Asegura que hasta la fecha a tenidos buenos resultados, por lo cual desea continuar con el desarrollo de la actividad y para ello se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una guadaña con el fin  de mejorar la calidad en el servicio y aumentar sus ingresos.
Su mayor anhelo es  compartir grandes momentos con sus tres hijos y garantizarles una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Sergio makes a living as a gardener, having learned his trade over 14 years ago.  Sergio had worked all his life as an employer in various local farms.

However, a year ago, Sergio was determined to become independent and offer gardening services on his own.  He tells us that, for now, he has had only good results and so Sergio wants to continue with this work.  To do this, he is applying for a loan in order to buy a scythe.  This will allow him to improve the quality of service he offers and to increase his income.

Sergio's biggest desire is to spend good times with his three children and to guarantee them a quality education.

loans.use: to buy a scythe.

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
Kunthea is 29 years old and married.  She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province.  She has two dependent children to take care of and one of them is in school.  Rice farming and cassava planting is the primary source of her family’s income and she has been in this business for 11 years. 

They supplement the income by working for others for a fee.  With the current business, she can earn approximately 20,000 KHR per day and save about 9,000KHR each day for the future needs.  Kunthea is just with VisionFund this loan cycle.  Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan.  As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland.  She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a better living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida is 41 years old woman.  She lives in Lahore, Pakistan.  She is a responsible mother of five children.  Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession.  For the past many days his rickshaw is not working properly, because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income.  He wants to repair it as soon as possible.  However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw.  Therefore Zahida has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw.  This will help him to continue his business.  Zahida is so thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw

loans.name: Edwin Andrés

texts.es:
Edwin a sus 21 años de edad, conserva la actividad que heredó de su padre. Se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando tomate de árbol y papa criolla en una vereda del municipio de Sonsón, al oriente de Antioquia. Su cosecha es comercializada en la plaza de mercado del municipio. Sueña ampliar su capacidad de producción, y mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Y para ello se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono y riegos para su cultivo, así generará una mejor producción e incrementará las ventas.
Sueña con ingresar a al universidad y convertirse en un gran empresario.
texts.en: Edwin, who is 21, continues the business which he inherited from his father.  He works in agriculture, growing tree tomatoes and papas criollas (yellow potatoes) in a district of the municipality of Sonsón, in the west of Antioquia department.  He sells his produce in the municipality's marketplace.  He dreams of expanding his production capacity and improving his quality of life and so he is seeking a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as manure and sprinklers for his crop.  This will enable him to boost his yield and improve his sales.  He dreams of going to university and becoming a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (manure and sprinklers)

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz, de 57 años de dad, es una mujer viuda a la que le tocó educar y sacar adelante con esfuerzo y mucho sacrificio a sus cuatro hijos. Ha laborado en oficios varios por más de 20 años, pero en la actualidad desea trabajar como independiente  dedicada a la venta de toda clase de fritos en  su sector de residencia. 
Con el propósito de gozar de una vejez tranquila. Luz se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en  la compra de una estufa, vitrina y materia prima, lo que le permitirá iniciar su con su proyecto de negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz is 57 years old and a widow.  With a lot of effort and sacrifice, Luz now has to bring up her four children and help them get ahead in life.  She has worked in various position over the last twenty years but she now wants to work independently selling fried foods in her local town.

In order to enjoy her old age peacefully, Luz is applying for a loan to invest in buying a heater, display and case and basic materials.  This will allow her to start up her business and improve her quality of living.

loans.use: to buy a heater, display case and basic materials.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Edgar es un hombre soñador y trabajador, cuenta que desde los ocho años de edad inició vendiendo periódicos locales, con el fin de colaborar con los gastos del hogar, debido a que por condiciones adversas se convirtió en madre soltera. 
Desde hace más de 10 años viene trabajando en oficios varios, pero hoy desea comenzar con su proyecto de negocio y para ello se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido como acolchados, cobijas, manteles entre otros, los cuales comercializará en su localidad y en los municipios cercanos.
Sueña con mejorar su calidad de vida y garantizarles a sus cuatro hijos una buena educación.
texts.en:
Edgar is hard-working and dreams big.  He tells us that at the age of eight years old he began selling local newspapers in order to help with household bills.  Due to adverse conditions, Edgar was brought up by only his mother, who was single.

Edgar has been working in various positions over the last ten years but now he would like to start his own business.  To do this, Edgar is applying for a loan in order to buy stock (quilting, blankets, tablecloths and more).  He will sell this items in his local area and in nearby towns.

Edgar dreams of improving his quality of living and of guaranteeing his children a good education.

loans.use: to buy stock (quilting, blankets and tablecloths).

loans.name: Yrene

texts.es:
Yrene, de 33 años de edad, está casada con Félix y vive en compañía de sus 02 hijos de 16 y 04 años de edad respectivamente en su casa propia. Yrene se dedica a la agricultura, por está razón siembra cacao, plátano y otros productos regionales pues lo ha visto como un negocio sumamente rentable, para realizar está actividad cuenta con un terreno de 15 hectáreas, de las cuales 03 estan en producción, dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace 06 años gracias al incentivo del gobierno regional quien les proporcionó las semillas, además del apoyo de su esposo y su hijo en las labores de mantenimiento. Le gusta esta actividad por ha visto que le da muy buenas ganancias, pues sus productos tienen un buen precio en le mercado actual. Este será su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 2500 nuevos soles comprará abono orgánico para la cosecha de cacao, plátano y otros productos.
texts.en: 33-year-old Yrene is married to Félix and lives in her own home with her two children of 16and 4 years of age.  Yrene works in agriculture, growing cocoa, bananas and other local products, as she recognised this as a highly profitable business.  She has a 15-hectare plot, 3 hectares of which are in production, and has been farming it for 6 years, helped by a regional government incentive which enabled her to obtain seeds and the support of her husband and son who do the maintenance work.  She likes her work; it generates a very good income, as her produce currently has a good market price.  This will be her first Kiva loan and she is very grateful for the financial help which will enable her to make progress.  She is committed, therefore, to make her repayments punctually.  She will use the 2500 nuevos soles requested to buy organic compost for her cocoa, bananas and other produce.

loans.use: to buy organic compost.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: La Sra. Verónica tiene 29 años, tiene un hijo de la edad de 2 años, ella se dedica al servicio de todo tipo de impresiones y diseño grafico, en su imprenta que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Toledo, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Verónica va a usar este préstamo para  la compra de vitrinas para muestra de sus productos terminados  para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo,  La Sra. Verónica enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen muchas imprentas por la zona y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando equipos y materiales que necesita y su deseo es tener  equipos modernos para brindar a su clientela un servicio de calidad.
texts.en: Verónica is 29 years old and has a 2 year old child. She works providing a all kinds of printing and graphic design services. Her printing press is located in the Toledo area. This loan is her first cycle in the institution. Verónica is going to use this loan to buy display cases to show her finished work for her business. Her reason for asking for this loan is a lack of cash. Verónica faces challenges in her business such as the competition, since there are a lot of printing presses in the area. She is going to use the profits to keep buying equipment and materials that she needs and her wish is to have modern equipment to offer her customers a quality service.

loans.use: to buy display cases.

loans.name: Azamat

texts.ru: Азамат житель района Кубадиён. Ему 33 года. У него есть жена, двое сыновей и двое дочерей. Азамат имеет высшее образование. Он работает инженером на телефонной станции. Азамат одновременно хочет заняться животноводческим бизнесом. Его интересует купля и продажа крупного рогатого скота. У него при дворе дома имеется коровник. Азамат планирует закупать по 5 голов бычков, откармливать их в течение одного месяца и затем продавать их на местном рынке с наценкой. Это довольно прибыльное дело и Азамат таким образом хочет улучшить финансовое положение семьи. Азамат просит кредит для закупа крупнорогатого скота и его корма.
texts.en: Azamat lives in Kubadiyon. He is 33, married, and has two sons and two daughters. He has a college degree, and works as an engineer at the telephone office. He would like to launch a livestock business on the side, buying and selling cattle. He has a cattle shed in his yard. He plans to buy five bulls, fatten them for a month, and then sell them on the local market for a profit. This is a rather profitable business, and Azamat wants to use it to improve his family's finances. He is requesting a loan to buy cattle and feed.

loans.use: to buy cattle and feed

loans.name: Maria Gabriela

texts.es: La Sra. Gabriela sigue con la misma actividad del tejido de mantas y  cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de lana por mayor,   en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de lana también, ya que esta época de invierno tiene mucha demanda y ya tiene pedidos que entregar, la Sra. Gabriela se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Gabriela stills works weaving blankets.  She says that her previous loan was a success as she used it to buy wool in bulk.  She is now applying for a loan to buy more wool as it is winter; demand is high and she has orders to fulfil.  Gabriela is happy and grateful for this opportunity to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Eduardo Antonio

texts.es:
Eduardo tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero. Es una persona que tiene varios años de dedicarse a la agricultura. Oficio que aprendió de su madre ya que se crío sin padre. Se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. Junto a su madre para prepararse para irse a la parcela que alquila; pasa todo el día trabajando en la noche cuida una finca. Él compra el abono, la semilla, el veneno, etc en la ciudad, camina 2 kilómetros para llegar a la carretera principal para luego subir al bus que lo lleva a la ciudad en donde compra mas barato los insumos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abono, semilla, pesticidas y herbicidas, para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y para pagar el alquiler de la tierra. Con la cosecha, poseerá un buen ingreso para el sustento de su madre y de él. Planea comprar un terreno para hacer su casa y poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su madre
texts.en:
Eduardo is 26 years old and single. He has been working in agriculture for several years. He learned this trade from his mother, since he grew up without a father. He gets up at 4:00 a.m. with his mother to get ready to go to the land parcel he rents. He spends the whole day working and at night is a caretaker at a farm. He buys fertilizer, seeds, poison, etc. in the city, walking 2 km to get to the main road to catch the bus that takes him to town where he buys the materials at a cheaper price. 

The loan he is asking for from Fundación Campo is to buy fertilizer, seeds, pesticide and herbicide to plant 7,000 square meters and pay to rent the land. With the harvest, he will have good income to support his mother and himself. He plans on buying some land to build his house and give his mother a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, pesticide, and herbicide to plant 7,000 square meters of corn and to pay to rent the land.

loans.name: Bubuaisha

texts.ru:
Бубуайше 44 года, имеет 3 детей. Бубуайша в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и выращиванием сельхозкультур, стартовав в 1994 году с суммы в (KGS) 10,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Бубуайша в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  1 корова с приплодом, 10 овец, 2,40 га поливной земли  с фасолью.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бубуайша обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку мелкого скота и удобрения.  Доходы от кредита Бубуайша вложит в приумножение поголовья скота, и мечтает построить новый дом для семьи.
texts.en: Bubuaisha is 44, and has three children. To support her family she raises livestock and farms; she started her business in 1994 with 10,000 som (KGS). Thansk to her hard work, her farm now has one cow with offspring, 10 sheep,and 2.4 hectares of land planted in beans. WIth the goal of expanding her business, Bubuaisha has turned to the Microlending Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock and fertilizer. Bubuaisha plans to invest the proceeds obtained with the loan into expanding her herd livestock herd, and dreams of building a new home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and fertilizers

loans.name: Nigar

texts.ru:
Нигар 36 лет, имеет 5 детей. Нигар в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и выращиванием сельхозкультур, стартовав с суммы в (KGS) 2,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Нигар в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 коровы с приплодом,  1,40 га поливной земли кукурузой и свеклой.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нигар обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS)  на увеличение поголовья скота.  Доходы от кредита Нигар в ближайшее время планирует вложить в ремонт дома.
texts.en: Nigar is 36, and has five children. She supports her family by raising livestock and farming. After starting with 2000 som (KGS), Nigar's business, thanks to her hard work, now includes 2 cows with offspring, and 1.4 hectres of land planted in corn and beets. With the goal of expanding her business, Nigar has come to the Microlending Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan in the amount of 40,000 soms (KGS) to  expand her cattle herd. She plans to invest the proceeds obtained with the loan into repairing her house.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan tiene 37 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos. Desde niño junto a sus hermanos se dedico a la agricultura y la crianza de ganado y en sus ratos libres le ayudaba a su padre en el taller de carpintería, a sus 15 años empezó a aprender de lleno la carpintería siempre al lado de su padre quien lo adiestraba y aprendió bien  este oficio. A sus 20 años se acompaño y empezó a trabajar de manera independiente a comprar poco a poco herramientas para trabajar, e instalo su propio taller de carpintería.  

La materia prima, las compra en las cerraderas más cercanas que esta a 5 kilómetros de su casa. Luego paga un medio de transporte para que le lleve la madera al taller; pero en algunas ocasiones tiene que trasladarse a lugares más lejanos para comprar la materia prima, cuando no encuentra en el mismo lugar.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar maquinaria para la carpintería, materia prima e insumos necesarios para la misma. Así, Prestara un mejor servicio de carpintería realizando con mas rapidez y de mejor calidad la producción aumentando sus clientes y mejorando la economía de su familia.

Los planes que tiene para su futuro, es ampliar con mas maquinaria y empleados su carpintería.
texts.en:
Juan is 37 years old. He has a spouse and three children. Since he was a child, he worked with his brothers in farming and raising cattle. In his free time, he helped his father in the carpentry workshop. When he was 15 he started to really learn carpentry with his father, who trained him. He learned the trade well. At 20 years old, he married and started to work independently to buy tools little by little, and then he set up his own carpentry workshop.

He buys the raw materials in the closest lumberyards which are 5 kilometers from his house. Later he pays for transport of the wood to the workshop, but on some occasions he has to go further away to buy the raw materials when he can't find it in the same place.

The loan he is asking Fundación Campo for is to buy machinery for carpentry, as well as raw materials and other materials he needs. This way, he will offer a better service, increasing his customers and improving his family's finances.

His plans for the future are to expand with more machinery and employees in his carpentry shop.

loans.use: to buy machinery for carpentry, raw materials, and other materials he needs.

loans.name: Robert

texts.es:
Robert, de 32 años de edad, está casado con Emilia quien es ama de casa y madre de sus hijos, juntos viven en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Robert  es el transporte para eso cuenta con un mototaxi, el cual  compró con su propio capital , lleva tres años realizando este oficio y le gusta su actividad pues le brinda los ingresos económicos necesarios para solventar los gastos de su familia. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda de transporte en la ciudad y las buenas ganancias que le deja. Por tanto tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y crecer, para esto desea comprarse otra unidad de transporte y así generar más ingresos económicos. Este será su primer préstamo con Kiva, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos , razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles comprará repuestos para el mantenimiento de su mototaxi, así como el pago del servicio a un mecánico.
texts.en:
Robert, 32, is married to Emilia, who is the mother of his children and is a stay-at-home mother. They live in a house of their own. Robert works in transportation and he has an auto rickshaw that he bought with his own money. He has had this line of work for three years and enjoys doing it, since it gives him the necessary income to cover his family’s expenses. He believes his business is profitable because there is good demand for transport services in the city and because it leaves good profits. This is why he has plans to expand his business and grow. For this, he is thinking of buying an additional vehicle to generate more income.

This is Robert’s first loan with Kiva, so he hopes to receive your help in order to continue with his plans. He promises to pay the installments on time. With the requested amount (1,500 PEN) he will buy spare parts and pay a mechanic for the maintenance of his auto rickshaw.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of his rickshaw.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en: Yusuf is a 48-year-old married man with six school going children living in Kasese, Uganda. For eight years he has been serving as a nurse and practices farming as additional income. Yusuf hopes to educate his children to University level. However, natural calamities and poor accommodation facilities are his major challenges that he faces. Yusuf will use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im, 60, is married, and living with her family in a village of the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has four children. For the last 40 years Im and her husband have been growing rice on a two-hectare farmland as the main source of family’s income. Together, they can earn about 20,000 KHR per day from the current business.

Im is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 KHR to buy fertilizer, rice seeds and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to timely grow her rice so as to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seeds and pesticides for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover expenses for training in the preparation of desserts

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace used her previous loan to purchase clothes to sell. She is a hardworking woman who has passion for fashion and has very good customer care. In her business, she faces the hardships of customers not paying on time and ever-changing customer preferences, as well as inadequate capital. She dreams of educating her children, building a permanent house to live in, expanding her business into new markets and moving the business to a more permanent location. Grace intends to use this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Nubia

texts.es:
Nubia, de 42 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos, labora de manera independiente realizando pulpas de frutas desde su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y de sus hijos. En la actualidad tiene un gran sueño expandir su negocio y tecnificar los procesos de producción con el fin de mejorar la calidad de su producto y aumentar sus ingresos. Razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el que espera capacitarse en conserva de frutas. 
Nubia está convencida que después de capacitarse sus ventas aumentarán y comenzará a crecer dentro del mercado local.
texts.en:
Nubia, 42 years old, is the mother of three children. She works independently making fruit pulp from her home, and has the support of her husband and children.

Currently she has a big dream of expanding her business and modernizing the production process with the purpose of improving the quality of her product and increasing her profits.

She is asking for a loan so that she can train in the conservation of fruits.

Nubia is convinced that after training her sales will increase and she will begin to thrive in the local market.

loans.use: to cover the training costs of learning techniques to conserve fruits so she can modernize the production process in her business

loans.name: Raquel Yasmin

texts.es:
Raquel de 18 años de edad, es una joven emprendedora, tiene claro que en la vida es necesario luchar por lo sueños así parezcan utopías. Con pocos recursos económicos pero con grandes ilusiones de formarse y tener su propio negocio, esta joven recurre a un crédito para capacitarse en la preparación de postres e iniciar con esta actividad productiva. Asegura que la repostería es una de sus grandes pasiones, por lo cual le apuesta todo a la materialización de su proyecto de emprendimiento.
Sueña con establecerse en el mercado e ir creciendo, hasta convertirse en una empresa reconocida con sucursales a nivel nacional.
texts.en:
Raquel is eighteen years old and is an enterprising young woman.  She knows that in life, is it necessary to fight for those dreams that seem like utopias.  With few economic resources but with great ideas as to how to grow and have her own business, this young person is requesting a loan in order to pay for her training in preparing desserts and to begin with this productive activity.  She is sure that confectionary is one of her greatest passions, and she bets everything on making this entrepreneurial project a reality.  

She dreams of establishing herself in the market and of growing until she has made herself into a known company with branches nationwide.

loans.use: to pay for her training in dessert preparation.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 57-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of seven children. 

Irshad's husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For a while now, his rickshaw has not been working properly and, as a result, he has been unable to generate any income. 

Irshad's husband wants to repair the rickshaw as soon as possible. Due to the lack of money, however, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairs. Therefore, Irshad has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This loan will help him to continue his business. Irshad is very much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a hardworking, married man living in Masindi, Uganda. Focused as he is, Lawrence decided to supplement his salary with farming so he could provide for the basic needs of his family. 

Despite the efforts, Lawrence is faced with a theft problem and a low salary, which both hinder his development plans. His dream is to venture into modern farming and educate his children through to university. 

Lawrence is requesting a loan to pay workers who are weeding his plantation and to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to pay workers who are weeding his plantation and to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros, de 36 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa. Está divorciada del padre de sus hijos y vive en compañía de sus 02 hijos de 06 y 02 años de edad respectivamente en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Milagros es la venta de gas, para esto cuenta con un local en el interior de su  vivienda, donde provee de gas a todo su vecindario quienes son amigos, familiares, entre otros. Lleva en este negocio un promedio de 06 años y le gusta su actividad pues le genera  un ingreso económico regular para pagar los gastos de su hogar y poder brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos. Este será su primer préstamo con Kiva, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles comprará gas doméstico al por mayor de esta manera incrementará sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Milagros is thirty-six years old and is a hardworking and determined woman.  She is divorced from the father of her children.  She lives in the company of her two children, who are 6 and 2 respectively, in her own home.  She sells gas tanks and has a shop in the interior of her home where she provides gas to all of her neighbors, who are her friends, relatives, and other individuals.  She has been involved in this business for about six years and likes it because it gives her a regular economic income.  This allows her to cover the home expenses and to be able to offer the best to her children.

This will be her first loan with Kiva, and she therefore waits for your collaboration in order to continue with her objectives.  She promises to pay her installments in a punctual manner.

With the amounted she has requested (3000 soles), she will buy domestic gas tanks wholesale.  Doing this allows her to grow her profits.

loans.use: to buy domestic gas tanks.

loans.name: Busgari

texts.en:
Busgari is a 39-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of six children. 

Busgari's husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For a while now, his rickshaw has not been working properly. As a result, Busgari's husband is unable to generate any income. 

Busgari's husband wants to repair the rickshaw as soon as possible. Due to a lack of money, however, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairs. 

Therefore, Busgari has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Busgari is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is the training ground for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. She has 2 children and has been farming for 3 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal business.

She stated that milking her cows is her favorite activity on the her farm. Her biggest challenge is feeding her cow. An animal on the farm has been given the names of Cheboit.

Ruth was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "credit management."  During Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, she learned that the organization has agricultural products.

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. She said that the loan will help her family by helping her generate profit to pay school fees for her children.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Ruth owns a cow and some poultry, but does not own a pig, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net and a TV in her house, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, or a DVD player.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers in order to prepare 14,000 square meters of corn and 875 square meters of squash

loans.name: Abida's Group

texts.en:
Abida, who lives in Lahore, Pakistan, is a responsible mother of five children. She has four daughters and is tense about their marriages as she doesn't have enough savings to meet their expenses.

Her husband, who owns a butcher shop, the family's only source of income, wants to purchase a calf and cow for his business; Abida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for that purpose. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to purchase a motor bike for his son.

Abida hopes that the loan will be useful for her husband's work. She thanks BRAC staff and Kiva lenders for their help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchse a calf and a cow for her husband's butcher shop.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouma est constitué de quatre  femmes dont 2 mariées et 2 veuves résidant dans les grandes familles traditionnelles élargies à Banconi-Farada, un des quartiers périphérique de la Commune I du district de Bamako. Elles ont en moyenne 49 ans et 6 enfants. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Banconi-Farada. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de Charbon de bois, des Habits (Pagne Wax) et Poissons fumés en provenance de Mopti. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariam (1ère femme assise à l’extrême droite) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habillements dans le quartier et au marché de Banconi-Farada. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 25 pièces de pagnes wax. Elle se ravitaille au grand marché de Bamako. La revente se fait  au comptant  au marché de Banconi-Farada à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Elle compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouma group is comprised of four women - two married and two widowed - who live in traditional extended families in Banconi-Farada, one of the outlying districts of the Bamako 'Commune I' district. They are, on average, 49 years old and have, on average, six children each.
They know one another as they live close together and also all have income generating activities in the Banconi-Farada market. The group members are traders of charcoal, traditional outfits made from waxed cloth, and smoked fish from Mopti.
With the goal of increasing their working capital, the members of the group have decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and this is the first cycle of their group loan.
Miriam (the woman seated on the right of the photo) has a strong reputation locally and at the Banconi-Farada market, for selling clothing. She intends to utilise her loan to purchase 25 traditional waxed cloth outfits. She buys her supplies in the 'Grand Marché' in Bamako, and sells the products for cash in the market at Banconi-Farada - mostly to women.
With this loan she intends to generate an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA which will be used both to invest in her business, and to meet the family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase high quality traditional outfits.

loans.name: Satya Sai Group

texts.en:
This group is called Satya Sai. Its four members are all women belonging to Balangir town of Odisha, India. 

Among the four members, one of the group members is Padmini. The lady sitting in extreme right raising her hand is Padmini. She is 45 years old and lives with her husband, two sons, two daughters, daughter in-law and two grandchildren. 

Padmini is running a multifarious business with the help of her husband and sons. Her son is running a snacks, sweets, gram, popcorn making/processing and supply business at her house. He also supplies dry foods like biscuits, chocolate, chips etc., to the traders of the town on a daily basis. Apart from this, he also covers 50 shops outside the town. Her husband takes order of assembling CFL (compact florescent light) bulbs from electrical goods wholesellers. She has also a tailoring machine for stitching ladies' garments. Padmini initially started her business in a low profile with two or three items. With the support from Mahashakti foundation, the business slowly expanded in to many activities. 

Her families spends almost 12 hours a day making snacks and making packets for selling and assembling electrical bulbs. In this process her family earns a monthly profit of 6,000 INR. According to Padmini this amount is not sufficient to manage her business as well as the family expenses. Therefore, she wants to buy a stock of raw materials like cooking oil, sugar, dough and dry food items so that they have enough stock to carry on their business regularly without any intervention and earn some extra profit. So Padmini has planned to use the present loan to buy cooking oil, sugar, dough and dry food items in bulk. Thereby she will save transportation cost and get the cash discount. She hopes to purchase a leaf plate pressing machine in the near future to start another business. She also dreams to construct a house building and provide better education to her grandchildren.
 
The other three members of the group named Tapaswini, Urmila and Jayanti are involved in businesses like wholesale fruits, general grocery shop and milk.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing of cooking oil, sugar, dough and dry food items.

loans.name: Tukolerewamu Farmers &traders Grp Group

texts.en:
Stephen, a single father of five children, is an agriculturalist growing crops on a small farm and also raising pigs, goats, chickens and fish. He supplements his small income with stone quarrying so that he can meet his family's needs. Stephen will use his loan portion to purchase some goats, pigs, and quarrying tools.

The group was formed to help the residents have access to funding in the form of loans.They are grateful that Kiva, through Ugafode, is willing to fund them despite their small incomes. They believe they will do better with this partnership. They are hardworking people.

loans.use: To buy some goats, pigs and quarrying tools.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 22-year-old married lady with one child. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. Irene's main business is selling second-hand clothes. She also runs a video hall. 

Weather changes and the seasonal nature of her business are Irene's major challenges. Irene's dream is to buy land and venture into commercialized agriculture. Irene intends to use the loan to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.use: purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Leisel

texts.en:
Leisel, also known simply as Q, has always had a love and passion for fashion. For over 13 years now, Q has worked as a stylist and personal shopper for celebrities Tara Banks, Angela Bassett, and Forest Whitaker. Q has also helped design and style popular shows such as America’s Next Top Model, The Tyra Banks Show, Who Are you Wearing? and Off the Legs.

Q stumbled upon StarMakers in the summer of 2007 when she walked into the shop to purchase a costume. She quickly built a strong relationship with Beverly Bishop, then owner of StarMakers, and became her apprentice. Not too long after, Beverly became too sick to run StarMarkers. Beverly left her costume shop to Q, and gave Q her blessing to continue her work.

Q is now the owner of StarMakers Costumes and Parties. She is currently asking for a $10,000 loan to purchase a POS system to better track her inventory as well as improve customer service. In the last five years, Q has revived StarMakers in the community. 

“It is the go to place for all costume and make-up needs all year round!” she says.

Q has worked fervently to transform StarMakers into a costume shop that embodies all areas of theater, TV, film, fashion and image. A Kiva loan will help Q run her business more efficiently and allow her to continue her passion for fashion.

loans.use: To purchase a POS system to better track her inventory as well as improve customer service.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 32-year-old married lady with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.

Her main business is running a beauty salon, the business she started with a hope of generating income to support her family. She is facing hardships of business seasonality and inadequate capital while her dream is to diversify and venture into decoration services after assessing the market and the low cost of operation. 

Jackline is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Geneva

texts.en:
Geneva is a 40-year-old divorced woman. She has four children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. Geneva operates a clothing business so she can have a  better life and provide for her children. The burden rests on her, after her husband declined to take responsibility.

Geneva hopes to educate all her children to a high level. She also hopes to have a modern boutique, despite inadequate capital. Geneva is requesting a loan to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.use: purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rodriga

texts.en:
Rodriga works hard to support her family. Rodriga is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Rodriga has been in this business for three years now.

Rodriga requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy additional vegetables to sell.

Rodriga would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.en:
Feliciano is a 61-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has seven grown children. 

He engages in fishing. He catches and sells fish to earn for a living.

He requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy fishing net and fuel for the motorboat to increase his catch. 

In the future, Feliciano would like to expand his fishing business to improve their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and fuel for the motorboat.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 50-year-old married woman with four children living in Kasese, Uganda.

She has been selling cassava flour for 12 years and also practices farming for additional income. With the proceeds, she has been able to pay school fees for her children and buy more land for farming.

Unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuation are her major challenges. Her dream is to own a food store that can supply her customers all year round.

Joyce will use the loan requested to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Marissa

texts.en:
Rosa Marissa is 42 years old, married and has three children.

She earns a living by raising hogs in the Philippines. Rosa Marissa has been in this business for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Rosa Marissa is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marie Madeleine

texts.fr: Madeleine est une femme de 54 ans, mariée mère de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 4 et 34 ans. Elle est commerçante et a ouvert une petite alimentation qu'elle gère elle même depuis 10 ans.Grâce à son accueil chaleureux et ses relations de bon voisinage, elle a conquis et fidélisé une clientèle qui s'accroit au fil du temps, et là, il ne parvient plus à la satisfaire totale d'où la nécessité de ce crédit dans son activité en ce moment parce qu'elle lui permettra d'augmenter le stock des produits de première nécessité. Ceci augmentera ses ventes et donc sa marge bénéficiaire. Bénéfice qui sera en partie réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madeleine is a 54-year-old woman who is a married mother of four children, from 4 to 34 years old. She is a merchant and has opened a small grocery store, which she has been running for ten years. Thanks to her warm welcomes and good neighborliness, she has won over a loyal customer base, which is growing over the course of time. 

Unfortunately, she can no longer totally satisfy her customers, thus the necessity for this business loan at this time. The loan will enable her to increase her stock of essential products. And this will increase her sales and therefore her profit margin. The profits will in part be reinvested in her business to expand it, and the rest will allow her to provide for her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of essentially products

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est constitué de vingt et une femmes qui sont parentes, amies et voisines qui s'entendent bien; elles ont comme activités principales l'agriculture et le petit commerce.


Fatou la représentante, est âgée de 32 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 3 filles. Elle vend des tissus,de l'encens, des fruits, de la bouillie, des beignets, et fait de l'agriculture d'arachide et de haricot. Elle mène ces activités depuis plusieurs années.Sur la photo elle est debout à l'extrême droit et a levé la main 

Avec son prêt elle voudrait acheter un panier de mangues, 5 tissus légers, 20000 F d'encens et du mil pour la bouillie et les beignets afin d'augmenter ses revenus.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle épargne dans le Banc Villageois, cotise dans les tontines et achète de la nourriture pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group comprises 21 women who are relatives, friends, and neighbors who get along well together. Their main work involves farming and small-scale commerce. 

Fatou, the group's representative, is 32 years old, married, and a mother of five children, of whom three are girls. She sells cloth, incense, fruit, porridge, and beignets, and she grows peanuts and beans. She has been running these businesses for several years. In the photo, she is standing at the far right with her hand raised. 

With her loan, she would like to purchase a basket of mangoes, 5 of thin fabrics, 20,000 francs of incenses, and some millet for making porridge and beignets, so as to increase her income.

She puts her profits into savings at the 'banc villageois', and she also uses her profits to pay her tontine dues and to buy food for her children.

loans.use: to purchase mangoes, cloth, incenses, and millet

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, de 62 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso con muchas ganas de progresar, esta casado con Leonarda, sus hijos ya son mayores e independientes , por está razón solo vive junto a su esposa en su casa propia . Jorge se dedica a cultivar cacao, café y plátanos para luego colocarlos a la venta en los mercados de su localidad, actualmente cuenta con un terreno de 10 hectáreas, el cual lo adquirió hace 30 años, tiempo que viene ejerciendo este oficio, además cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos en las cosechas compartiendo con ellos las ganancias. Le gusta su negocio pues lo conoce muy bien ya que lleva muchos años dedicándose a ese oficio, y dicha experiencia se la ha pasado a sus hijos. Este será su primer préstamo con Kiva, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos , por ello se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles comprará abono orgánico para su próxima producción .
texts.en: Jorge is 62 years old.  He is hard-working, diligent and wants to progress.  He has a wife, Leonarda, and their children are now independent.  Jorge and Leonarda live together in their privately owned house.  Jorge makes a living growing cocoa, coffee and bananas that he then puts up for sale in the town's market.  He currently has a ten-hectare plot of land, which he bought thirty years ago.  In this time he has been plying his trade.  Jorge receives help from his children during the harvest and he shares his profits with them.  Jorge likes his business as, with many years in the trade, he knows the business very well and has passed his experience onto his children.  This will be Jorge's first loan with Kiva and he hopes to have your support so that he can continue with his objectives.  Jorge promises to make his repayments on time.  Jorge will buy organic manure for his next production with this loan of 1000 Nuevo Soles.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 42 years old, married and has four children, all currently in school. Salvacion works very hard to provide for them.

Salvacion runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, snack foods, noodles, biscuits, laundry soap and other groceries.  

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like soft-drinks, snack foods, noodles, biscuits, laundry soap and other groceries to sell in her general store.

In the future, Salvacion would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soft-drinks, snack foods, noodles, biscuits, laundry soap and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is a youth client of 23 years of age who lives with his parents and his three brothers.

Ali and his brothers provide for the family living together. Ali is a barber. He is the only barber in the neighborhood. He established his business in 2010 and now he has a hired employee. Ali became well known in the area and has gained an excellent reputation.

Ali is requesting a youth loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to renovate his barber shop and install a rolling shutter and a display window. This loan will help Ali in attracting more customers and will help him enhance his current financial condition.

loans.use: to renovate his barber shop and install a rolling shutter and a display window.

loans.name: Furahini Group

texts.fr: La cliente Birindwa est leader du groupe de crédit « Furahini », jeune entrepreneur courageuse, âgée de 34 ans et mère de 6 enfants, qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un commerçant de divers. La cliente est vendeuse des unités cellulaires et SIM card. Elle commença cette activité avec le fonds reçu de son mari, il y a environ 7 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter  30 cartes d’unités Vodacom, 20 cartes MTNl, 20 Cartes Orages, 30 cartes Airtel. La crise économique généralisée suite aux effets de la guerre, les perturbations de réseaux de communication, les pertes divers sont des obstacles majeurs pour le développement de son activité. Dans le futur, elle souhaite agrandir son entreprise et scolariser ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien en micro crédit aux femmes entrepreneurs.Il sied de signaler une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Birindwa is the leader of the "Furahini" credit co-operative. She is a plucky 34 year old entrepreneur, and the mother of six children - all studying in school. Her husband is a general trader. She sells phone credit and SIM cards; she began the business with funding from her husband, about seven years ago. This new loan will allow her to purchase 30 Vodacom cards, 20 MTNI cards, 20 Orange cards, and 30 Airtel cards. Her business faces some significant obstacles to its development - such as the widespread economic crisis following the war and its impact, disruptions in the communication networks, and various losses. 
In the future, she wants to grow her business and educate her children. Thus, she thanks Hekima for its micro-credit support for women entrepreneurs.

It should be noted that one client is holding her baby in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase 100 prepaid telephone credit vouchers.

loans.name: Karrar

texts.en:
Karrar is a youth client from Iraq. He is 20 years old and lives with his big family of 10 members. Karrar, his parents and two of his brothers, together, provide the family income.

Karrar owns a small shop where he sells speakers and surround systems. He also provides his neighborhood with internet services. Karrar established his business in 2012, and has gained his experience in this field while helping his friend who had a similar shop in another city. Thanks to his granted services, Karrar gained an excellent reputation in the surrounding area.

Karrar is requesting a youth loan of $1,800 USD to pay the annual rent of his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he may help his parents, not only in providing the family living, but also to help them in paying the school fees for his other brothers and sisters.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop.

loans.name: Rasheeda's Group

texts.en:
Rasheeda is the leader of this group. She is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's business. He has an embroidery shop. He sells a variety of threads, precious stones, needles, beads, buttons, and laces in his shop. His customers really like the variety of his shop. His products have a great demand in the area. 

Currently, he needs to purchase threads and laces, but due to lack of finance, he is facing problem. Therefore, his wife, Rasheeda, has asked for a loan to help her husband. 

With the profits expected from this loan, her husband intends to expand his business. Rasheeda thanks the BRAC staff and Kiva lenders for their kindness and mercy.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of laces and threads.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana, age 26, is a housewife. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband has a small betel shop, which is the only source of income for the family. His monthly income is inadequate to cover the household expenses. He is facing so many financial issues and difficulties to sustain his family life.

Farzana is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase products for his shop. Farzana hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To improve her husband's betel shop.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 46 years old and married. They are farmers living in Amulung, Cagayan, and together they work hard in order to have a good harvest. They usually grow rice and harvest twice a year, with an approximate income of 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) per harvest season.  

Salome would like to increase their crop production but lacks capital. This encouraged her to borrow a loan of 25,000 PHP from the lenders to buy fertilizers and insecticides for her farm.  

In the future, Salome hopes to keep developing a healthy farming business to gain more income for the improvement of their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra, age 41, is the leader of this borrower group. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is a scrap dealer. This business is the only source of income for the family. 

Bushra is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase scrap iron, aluminum and plastic bottles for his business. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to start savings for his family. Bushra hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase scrap iron, aluminum and plastic bottles.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 53 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Teresita has a fruits and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetable to sell to her customers.

Teresita has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetable to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Akhter's Group

texts.en:
Akhter  is a 35-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly; because of this, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. 

Therefore, Akhter has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Akhter is so much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw.

loans.name: Nienta Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Nienta est constitué de six   femmes mariées  équitablement dans les ménages monogamiques et polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 46 ans et 6 enfants; Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Sabalibougou en commune V du district de Bamako; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Sabalibougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, légumes (aubergines, piments, tomates, selleries), poissons frais, charbons et pagnes wax. Pour augmenter leur fonds de commerce les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ier cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Maimouna (la 1ère femme assise à extrême droite) est une grande vendeuse de chaussures plastiques de tous les âges et de plusieurs modèles dans le marché de Sabalibougou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de 200 paires de chaussures. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Bamako. La revente se fait  au comptant à une clientèle composée  majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Maimouna espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA,  qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans son activité. Elle a pour objectif d’ouvrir une boutique de vente de chaussures dans cette relation avec soro yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The group Nienta is composed of six married women equally in either a monogamous or a polygamous household. The women average 46 years of age and six children each; they all live in the Sabalibougou neighborhood, in Commune V, in the Bamako District. They know one another through ties of community and their revenue-generating businesses at the Sabalibougou market. The group members work in the small-scale commerce of vegetables (eggplant, chili peppers, tomatoes, celery), fresh fish, charcoal, and 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa). To increase their working capital the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Maimouna (the first woman sitting at the far right) is a major vendor of plastic footwear for all ages and of several models at the Sabalibougou market. She intends to use her loan to purchase 200 pairs of footwear. She gets her supplies at the big market in Bamako. Sales are made in cash to a customer base composed mostly of women. 

With this loan, Ms. Maimouna hopes to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business. Her goal is to open a store selling footwear through this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase footwear to sell

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: Safina is a hardworking married woman living in Bundibugyo, Uganda.She has been running a butcher shop a long side cocoa growing to boost her income. Her dream is to build a permanent house for residence and add two more butcher shops although long distance to her business premises is a major set back.Safina is requesting for a loan to buy more cows to sell in her butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy more cows to sell in her butcher shop.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson is a fifty year old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. For three years he has been dealing in cloth business and with the proceeds, he has been able to pay fees for his children. His dream is to educate his children to higher levels of education and set up a boutique although he is faced with challenges of high competition and transport costs.Johnson will use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Joram

texts.en:
Joram is a 43-year-old married man living in Kagadi, Uganda.

He operates a local brew business but also trades in produce and has been in business for twelve years now. He also has a piggery project to supplement his income.

He dreams of building a permanent house for his family and refining his local brew to add value, although he is hindered by inadequate capital.Joram intends to use the loan to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
Adam is a 62-year-old married man with two children, aged 17 and 14. He deals in brick-making to earn a living, and with the proceeds, he has been able to pay school fees for his children. Apart from that, he also owns house rentals, from which he earns money to support his family.

He hopes that in the future, he will own a factory that makes bricks, though he faces a challenge of inadequate capital to meet the high demand. Adam intends to use the loan to pay workers who are making bricks for him.

loans.use: to pay workers who are making bricks for him.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 46 year-old single mother of a child and she lives in Kamwenge,Uganda. She deals in spare parts business where she earns a living and her clients are motorcycle cyclists. She has inadequate capital to meet the high demand while her dream is to diversify her business to include car spare parts. Mary intends to use the loan to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Lázaro

texts.es:
Lázaro tiene 21 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado en compañía de su padre, siempre en su adolescencia se empeño a trabajar como jornalero en una hacienda cercana con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo de él y sus padres logro sacar su 9º grado y por la condición económica tuvo que retirarse y trabajar por su cuenta luego se acompaño siempre trabajaba la agricultura y también se dedico a trabajar en un moto taxi ruleteando en la misma zona.

  Los insumos agrícolas, los compra en una ciudad a 2 kilómetros de su casa; luego tiene que pagar para que se lo lleven para su casa; posteriormente su padre con quien trabaja le ayuda a trasladarlo a donde trabajan. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación campo, es para comprar insumos agrícolas: como lo son fertilizantes, abonos,  preparación de la tierra y el pago de mano de obra, para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Con los resultados obtenidos de la producción se tendrá mejores ingresos para él y su familia
 

Para un futuro piensa comprar una moto taxi; ya que con ello incrementaran los ingresos para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Lázaro is 21 years old, married and has a son. He has been working in agriculture since he was very young, together with his father. As a teenager, he worked as a day laborer in a nearby farm. Thanks to his and his parents’ hard work, he was able to study up to the ninth grade, but due to the economic situation he had to quit school and work on his own. He then got married. He has always worked in agriculture, but he has also worked as a taxi driver in the same region.

He buys the agricultural supplies he needs in a city located 2 km [1.2 miles] from his house. He has to pay for the delivery. His father, with whom he works, helps him to bring them to the piece of land where they work.

Lázaro is requesting a loan to Fundación Campo to buy agricultural supplies, such as fertilizer and compost and to pay for the labor needed to prepare the soil. He will sow corn in a 7,000 m2 [1.7 acres] piece of land. The profits will result in an increase of his family’s income.

In the future, he plans to buy an auto rickshaw with the intention to improve his family’s income.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizer and compost and to pay for the labor needed to prepare 7,000 m2 of land to sow corn.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a forty-four year old married man with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in produce to earn a living. He hopes to have a modern produce store in the future, although he faces the challenges of a lack of enough capital and price fluctuation. Lawrence is requesting a loan to buy more produce such as maize and beans to sell. The person at the back is a credit officer with Hofokam.

loans.use: to buy more produce such as maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel, a married man aged 26, has four children, three of them in school. Having attained just minimal formal education, he resorted to casual labouring and actually got a job trimming the compound grass at the district premises in Ibanda. The income from the mowing was not enough so he resorted to rearing pigs and goats for additional income.

He now wants UGX 1,000,000 to buy a grass-cutting machine so that he can expedite the process and also use less labour. He is confident the machine will bring him more customers and therefore increase his income. He is a hard-working young man who aspires to provide his family with the best.

loans.use: To buy a grass-cutting machine

loans.name: La Sorpresa Group

texts.es:
"La Sorpresa" es el nombre de un grupo formado por mujeres alegres y emprendedoras, cada una de ellas desarrolla una actividad económica con el propósito de brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias. Este grupo esta ubicado en una comunidad ubicada a la orilla de carretera y su gente se dedica al cuidado y cultivos en sus fincas de Mangos.

Doña Francisca es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella tiene 45 años de edad, solo estudio la primaria, esta casada con el señor Marcelino y tiene una hija de 10 años.
Doña Francisca platica que junto a su esposo  por mas de 15 años se han dedicado a la venta de carne de cerdo y masa. Sus ventas las realizan en su comunidad con sus amigos y vecinos, la venta  de masa es todos los días un día antes pone a hervir el maíz al día siguiente lo muele y sale a vender su producto. 
La venta de carne de cerdo la realiza una vez por semana ofrece la carne, levantando pedidos y al día siguiente limpia su cerdo, sale a entregar la carne y otros derivados como chicharrones, asadura y carnitas, así le gana un poco más.

Ella ha solicitado este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de cerdo, maíz y darle mantenimiento a su molino para continuar con sus ventas.

Ella espera que su negocio continúe prosperando y a futuro le gustaría construir unos corrales para criar a sus cerdos.

Los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Simona-Venta de ropa Interior
Mayte venta de refrescos
Felipa taller mecanico
Demetria Bordados 
Ana Bertha venta de cosmeticos
Susana venta de cosmticos
Catalina venta de ropa
Yolanda venta de refrescos
texts.en:
“La Sorpresa” or “the surprise” is the name of the group formed by cheerful and entrepreneurial women. Each one of them develops a line of work with the goal of providing a better quality of life to their family. This group is located in a community located on the edge of a highway and its people work in the care and cultivation of its mango groves

Francisca is one of the members of the group. She is 45 and only studied through primary school. She is married to Marcelino and they have a ten-year-old. Francisca says that for over 15 years she and her husband have sold pork and corn flour together. They make their sales in their community with their friends and neighbors. They sell corn flour every day. One day ahead of time they put the corn to boil, and the next day they mill it, then go out to sell their product. They sell pork once a week.  They take orders, then the next day the clean the pig. Then they deliver the meat and other derivatives such as chicharrones [pork rind], offal, and carnitas [barbequed pork]. This way they can earn a little bit more. 

She has requested this loan to invest in pigs and corn, and do maintenance on their mill to continue with their sales. She hopes that her business can continue prospering, and in the future, she would like to construct some corrals to raise their pigs. 

The other members of the group are:

Simona – underwear sales
Mayte – soft drink sales
Felipa – auto repair shop
Demetria – embroidery
Ana Bertha – cosmetics sales
Susana – cosmetics sales
Catalina – clothing sales
Yolanda – soft drink sales

loans.use: perform maintenance on a mill and purchase pigs and corn

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
Amjad is a 26-year-old, youth client from Iraq. Amjad, his father, and his two brothers provide the family income while his mother takes care of their house. Amjad owns a small shop where he sells all types of accessories. He also sells stationary and has a machine used for binding books. He established his business in 2007 and has gained good experience in this field. Thanks to the wide variety of offered services, Amjad gained an excellent reputation and is well-known in the neighborhood.

Amjad is requesting a youth loan of 3,000 USD. The aim of this loan is to buy a photocopying machine and a computer. He will also use the loan to connect his computer to the internet in order to keep track of his inventory and research new items on the market. Ajmad is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that one day, he may open a bigger shop and provide himself a stable career.

loans.use: to buy a photocopying machine and a computer and to connect his computer to the internet

loans.name: Adji Fily's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 3 femmes fait partie du Banc Villageois créé le 1er juillet 2011. Elles habitent le même village et développent de très bonnes relations amicales. 

Mme Adji, la représentante, est une femme de 37 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 garçons et 3 filles. Elle fait du petit commerce de poissons et légumes frais au marché de la localité depuis plus de 10 ans.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 10 kg de carottes, 10 kg de choux, 10 kg de navets, 3 paniers de poissons frais et 20 litres d'huile végétale. Elle vend au détail chaque jour au marché.

Les bénéfices générés par son activité commerciale sont destinés à soutenir son époux dans la prise en charge des enfants et aussi à augmenter son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
This group of three women is part of the 'banc villageois' created on July 1, 2011. They live in the same village and are developing good friendly relationships. 

Ms. Adji, the group's representative, is a 37-year-old woman who is married and the mother of two boys and three girls. For over ten years, she has had a small business selling fresh fish and vegetables in her town. 

With this loan, she intends to purchase 10 kg of carrots, 10 kg of cabbage, 10 kg of turnips, 3 baskets of fresh fish, and 20 liters of vegetable oil. She sells at the retail level each day at the market.

The profits generated by her business are for supporting her husband to cover the children's expenses and also for increasing her savings.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fish to resell in her town

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana is a 40-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly. Because of this, he is unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to a lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. 

Therefore Rehana, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him continue his business. Rehana is so thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw

loans.name: Ramata's Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois existe depuis le 7 avril 2011, ce groupe PC2 est constitué de vingt quatre femmes qui sont parentes et habitent le même village; elles ont comme activités principales le commerce et l'embouche ovine.

Madame Ramata la représentante, est âgée de 35 ans, elle est célibataire sans enfant; elle s'active dans le petit commerce de produits cosmétiques;elle a une expérience de 2 ans; elle fait aussi de l'embouche ovine.Elle est debout à droite vêtue en bleu et a plié son bras dans son dos.


Elle vend des parfums, lait, crème de corps dans son quartier en faisant du porte à porte. 

Son prêt lui servira à acheter des produits cosmétiques d'une valeur de 150000 F.Elle n'est pas la seule à mener cette activité mais elle espère se faire beaucoup de revenus.

Ses bénéfices lui ont permit d'acheter 2 béliers pour faire de l'embouche ovine.
texts.en:
