The 'banc villageois' has existed since April 7, 2011. And this group "PC2" comprises 24 women who are related and living in the same village. Their main work involves commerce and fattening sheep.

Ms. Ramata, the group's representative, is 35 years old, unmarried, and without children. She has been active in the small-scale commerce of cosmetic products with two years of experience. She is the one in the photo standing at the right and dressed in blue. Her arms are folded behind her back. 

She sells perfumes, lotions, and body creams in her district by going door to door. 

Her loan will be used to purchase some cosmetics valued at 150,000 francs. She is not the only one with a business like this, but she hopes to make much more income. 

Her profits will enable her to purchase two rams for fattening.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products to resell

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La cliente Ana vive en la ciudad de Playas,  es un mujer emprendedora ya que comenzó su negocio hacia 9 años. Con la venta de un solar que tenida pudo comprar artículos de uso personal para asi tener su propio negocio. Poco a poco levantándose a las 06:30 a trabajar en su negocio pudo obtener los ingresos suficientes para tener su propio local. 

En la actualidad sigue con su negocio donde vende ropa, bisutería, zapatos. No esta casada pero tiene tres hijos menores de edad que tienen 17, 15, 9 años de edad. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere comprar ropa, bisutería, zapatos para poder incrementar su mercadería y tener así mas ingresos para darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana lives in the city of Playas.  She is an enterprising woman because she started her business nine years ago.  With the sale of a plot of land that she had, she was able to buy personal use items in order to have her own business.  By getting up at 6:30 to work in her business, she was able to, little by little, get enough income to have her own place.

She currently continues with her business where she sells clothes, costume jewelry, and shoes.  She is not married, but she has three minor children, ages 17, 15, and 9.

She has a lot of aspirations for her business.  Therefore, she wants to buy clothes, costume jewelry, and shoes in order to be able to have more merchandise.  This way she will have more income in order to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy clothes, costume jewelry, and shoes.

loans.name: Fidèle Bougeoise

texts.fr: Fidèle est une dame âgée de 31 ans commerçante.  elle dispose d'une vente à emporter dans un quartier de la ville de 02 ans environ. Elle bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine. Elle voudrait avec ce crédit pour augmenter les casiers de boisson . Cela va également augmenter son chiffre d'affaire ainsi que son bénéfice et lui permettra aussi d'être en règle dans son commerce. Les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Elle a comme ambitions pour son activité de faire dans la vente en gros des boissons.
texts.en: Fidèle is a 31-year-old woman merchant who has had a take-out place for about two years in her district in the city. She benefits from good experience in this domain. She would like to use this loan to have more cases of beverages. This will also increase her sales, and thus her profits, enabling her business to be in order. The revenues generated will allow her to do better in providing for her family. Her business ambitions include wholesale trade in beverages.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of beverages

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia, age 57, is a housewife. She adores her family and her husband works very hard, so that his family can have a good and respectable life. 

Her husband is a scrap dealer. This business is the only source of income for the family. Safia is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase scrap iron, aluminum, and plastic bottles for his business. 

With the profits expected from this loan, Safia's husband intends to invest in household needs. Safia hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase scrap iron, aluminum, and plastic bottles for her husband's business.

loans.name: Edison Daniel

texts.es:
El cliente Edison vive en la ciudad de Portoviejo, comenzó su negocio cuando salio de su trabajo donde realizada fabricación de trofeos, placas, reconocimientos metálico. Comenzó su negocio con un crédito que obtuvo e invirtió en su propio negocio, donde comenzó con la experiencia que tenia de su trabajo anterior. 

Actualmente fabrica trofeos a un valor de $ 60.00, placas a $ 50.00, reconocimientos a $ 50, medallas a $ 1.50. Trabaja desde las 08:30 hasta las 17:30 todos los días. Esta casado y tiene una niña de 2 años 7 meses. 

El tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio ya que es el sustento de su familia por eso quiere invertir en materiales para hacer trofeos, medallas. Con el préstamo quiere comprar laminas metálicas, pergaminos, materiales.
texts.en:
Edison lives in the city of Portoviejo.  He started his business when he left his job where he made trophies, plaques, and awards made from metal.  He started his business with a loan that he got, and he invested in his own business.  He began with the experience that he had from his previous job.

He currently makes trophies for $60.00, plaques for $50.00, awards for $50, and medals for $1.50.  He works from 8:30 a.m. until 5:30 every day.  He is married and has a daughter, age two years and seven months.

He has a lot of aspirations for his business because he supports his family.  Therefore, he wants to buy materials for trophies and medals.  He wants to buy sheet metal, parchment, and materials.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, parchment, and materials.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is 42 years old and married to a simple farmer, Albert. She sells different products in their community. Evangeline is a very hardworking mother. She make sure that she can meet all the needs of her children. She is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy lotion, shampoo, soap and other products for her business. She hopes that her business expands so that she can continue to meet all the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy lotion, shampoo, soap and other products for her business

loans.name: Atiya

texts.en:
Atiya, age 34, is a housewife. She adores her family and her husband works very hard, so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband offers tailoring services. He stitches men's pants, shirts, and trousers on order.

Atiya is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to buy a joki (sewing) machine for his business. 

With the profits expected from this loan, Atiya's husband intends to expand his business, so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. Atiya hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a joki (sewing) machine for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Enith

texts.es:
Enith, de 58 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida, está divorciada pero vive cómodamente en casa 
propia junto a su último hijo de 21 años de edad . Enith se dedica a la venta de repuestos para vehículos, para lo cual cuenta con un almacén en la casa de su ex esposo y padre de su hijo con quien mantiene una sociedad comercial, adquiere los fierros desde otra ciudad para luego venderlos a los talleres locales o clientes directos propietarios de vehículos. Trabaja en esta actividad hace 07 años y lo hace con ayuda de otra persona. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el ingreso económico que recibe con el que logra solventar los gastos de su hogar y pagar los estudios universitarios de su hijo al que quiere mucho, además que con las ganancias a logrado comprarse algunos artefactos y a podido hacer algunos arreglos a su casa. Por otro lado, ya que tiene una edad avanzada, solo tiene planes de mantener su negocio o dedicarse a una actividad menos intensa. Este es su sexto préstamo con Kiva y está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan para seguir adelante razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de S/.2500 nuevos soles, comprará repuestos hechos con fierros para su negocio.
texts.en:
Enith, age 58, is a hard-working and committed woman.  She is divorced, but she lives comfortably in her own house with her last son, age 21.  Enith sells replacement parts for vehicles.  In order to do so, she has a warehouse at her ex-husband’s house.  He is the father of her son, and she maintains a commercial relationship with him.  She gets the tools from another city in order to later sell them to the local shops or directly to customers who have vehicles.  

She has been working in this business activity for seven years, and she does so with help from another person.  What she likes about her business activity is the income she gets, which she uses to pay the household expenses.  She also pays the university expenses for her son, whom she loves very much.  Additionally, she has managed to use the income to buy some appliances, and she has been able to make repairs to her house.  Now that she is older, she only plans to maintain her business or devote herself to a business activity that is less intense.

This is her sixth loan with Kiva.  She is very grateful for the loan opportunity being provided to her in order to get ahead.  Therefore, she pledges to make her payments punctually.  She will use the requested 2,500 soles to buy metal replacement parts for her business.

loans.use: to buy metal replacement parts for her business.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 47 years old and a hard-working mother, who supports her husband in managing their rice farming business.  Despite the hardships of living, they were very determined to uplift their standard of living and give their children a better life.  In this regard, she and her husband planned to expand their rice plantation and increase their production. 

Angelita is now asking for loan capital of PHP 20,000 to buy the needed fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay the labor cost incurred during the harvest season.  She is hoping that her loan will be granted for the improvement of their business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay the labor cost incurred during the planting season

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites has always been interested in the pharmaceutical industry and she has taken a special interest in the prevention of skin cancer. 

Born in the Philippines, she began her career in her early 20s, selling products to help her meet her daily needs. In 2008, she developed her own line of products to sell. She now needs capital to help market her product. 

This loan will help Marites build a website in order to advertise and promote her products.

loans.use: to build a website to promote her skin products.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is a responsible house wife and mother who runs a small variety store in her village. She aims to improve her business and make it profitable in order to provide for the daily needs of her family, as well as the education of her children. Wanting to offer more products to her customers, she has decided to take out an additional loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy a greater variety of goods for her store such as soft drinks, snack foods, canned goods and toiletries. She believes that someday, she will make more improvements to her business through her patience and strong determination.

loans.use: to buy different goods for her store

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en: Saumu earns a living by operating a retail shop, selling food to neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the form of competition from other retail shops that operate in her area. She is requesting a loan for Kshs 45,000 to buy bundles of wheat and maize flour, sugar and beans to sell to her customers. She dreams of expanding her business so that she can earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to buy bundles of wheat and maize flour, sugar and beans to sell.

loans.name: Mwanamvua

texts.en: Mwanamvua is married and the mother of three school-age children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children. For the last 10 years, she has earned a living by selling fish to neighbors and people who live in her town. Her main challenges are the high cost of fish, especially when the deep sea is running cold and not many fish are caught. She is requesting a loan to buy bundles of fish to sell, along with cooking oil and firewood. She decided to join Yehu to access loans at a lower cost so that she can improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood.

loans.name: Ameena

texts.en:
Ameena is a housewife. She is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband who has a embroidery shop business. In his shop, he sells a variety of threads, precious stones, needles, beads, buttons, and laces. His customers really like the variety of his shop. His products are in great demand in the area. 

Presently, Ameena's husband needs to purchase threads and laces. However, due to lack of finances, he is facing a problem. Therefore, Ameena has asked for a loan to help her husband. 

With the profits expected from this loan, her husband intends to expand his business. Ameena gives thanks to the BRAC Pakistan staff and Kiva lenders for their kindness and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase threads and laces for her husband's embroidery business.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en: Jovelyn started selling snacks house to house. When she realized that she could earn more money by working in one place, she opened a stall in front of her village's school. In addition to cooking snacks, she also supplements her income by running a sari-sari store. To increase her income, Jovelyn has requested a loan from Kiva for PHP 15,000 to buy drinks and raw ingredients for making snacks to sell. In the future, she dreams of opening up a grocery store where she could make her business even more profitable.

loans.use: to buy drinks and ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Ndeye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 6 personnes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été créé le 20 février 2000.Il est composé de femmes qui habitent le même village et ceux des environnants. Elles vivent une parfaite harmonie.
La représentante du groupe, Ndéye, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 2 filles. Elle a en charge aussi une petite fille. Elle envisage de faire du commerce, elle s'approvisionne dans les grandes villes de sa localité pour revendre au sein de son village.
Avec le prêt elle va acheter 2 douzaines de prêt à porter, pour femmes et hommes et enfants. Elle va acheter aussi des sandales en cuir, des bijoux et de l'encens pour une valeur de 10000f.
Les bénéfices servent à renforcer ses épargnes et prendre en charge les besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group of six persons is part of the 'banc villageois' that was created on February 20, 2000. It is composed of women living in the same village and from nearby. They live in perfect harmony.

The group's representative, Ndéye, is the one standing in the photo with her hand raised. She is 35 years old, married, and the mother of five children, including three girls. She also has a granddaughter in her care. 

Ndéye envisions working in commerce. She gets her supplies from the big cities of her area to sell in her village. With this loan, she is going to purchase two dozen of ready-to-wear for women, men, and children. She will also purchase leather sandals, jewelry, and incense valued at 10,000 francs. The profits will be used to bolster her savings and provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, clothing, incenses, and perfume to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 42 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for herself. Anita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like biscuits, snack foods, soft drinks, bath soap, etc. to sell in her general store.

Anita has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, snack foods, soft drinks, bath soap, etc. In the future, Anita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like biscuits, snack foods, soft drinks, bath soap, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Kijole

texts.en:
Kijole has operated a food stall business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators in her business. 

Here again she comes to you requesting another loan of KES 40,000 to purchase cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour and rice for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future and she appreciates the support given.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour and rice for resale

loans.name: Saye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 6 personnes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été créé le 20 février 2000.Il est composé par de femmes qui habitent le même village et les environs. Elles vivent une parfaite harmonie.
Fatou, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est la représentante du groupe. Elle est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont 4 filles, elle a aussi en charge 2 autres enfants. Elle fait comme activité le commerce de détail. 
Avec le prêt elle compte acheter du poisson fumé et séché pour revendre. Elle va aussi acheter 50 kg d'arachide pour la transformer en huile. 
Les bénéfices lui servent à faire de l'embouche ovine et aussi de soutenir ses enfants dans leurs besoins, de renforcer ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This group of six persons is part of the 'banc villageois' created on February 20, 2000. It is composed of women who live in and around the same village. They live in perfect harmony.

Fatou, who is standing at the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is 47 years old, married, and the mother of seven children, including three girls. She also has two other children to support. Her work is in retail commerce. 

With this loan, Fatou intends to purchase smoked fish and dried fish to resell. She is also going to purchase 50 kg of peanuts to process into oil. The profits will go to fattening sheep, to providing for their children, and also to bolstering her savings.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts, smoked fish, and dried fish

loans.name: Coumba's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de 06 femmes qui habitent le même quartier.il est a son 10 éme prêt ,les femmes font toutes le commerce. Coumba est la représentante du groupe ,elle est âgée de 48 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont quatre garçons.Son ainé a 30ans et son cadet 19 ans.
Elle fait du commerce de poisson .Elle habite tout prés de la mère et fait cette activité depuis plus de 20 ans.Avec son prêt elle compte acheter une caisse de poisson à 250000f et 20000f de glace.Elle achète le poisson au quai de pèche et part a la capital pour vendre.Elle n'a pas de problème pour écouler ses produits car elle est très réputer dans la vente de qualité de ses poissons et elle a beaucoup de clients dans les autres villes.
Avec ses bénéfices elle a réussit à acheter un terrain,elle soutient aussi son marie dans la prise en charge de la famille(nourriture,scolarité, ect...)Elle soutient aussi ses enfants qui s’investit dans la couture en leur achetant des machine a coudre.
texts.en:
This group is composed of six women who live in the same district. The group is on its tenth loan. The women all work in commerce. Coumba is the group's representative. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of eight, including four boys. The oldest is 30 years old, and the youngest is 19.

Coumba does commerce in fish. She lives very close to her mother and has been in this business for over twenty years. With her loan, she intends to purchase a case of fish at 250,000 francs and 20,000 francs of ice. She purchases her fish at the fishing pier and goes to the capital to sell it. She has no problem turning over her merchandise because she has a good reputation for selling quality fish, and she has many customers in other cities. 

With her profits, she was successful in purchasing a plot of land. She also supports her husband in covering family expenses (food, schooling costs, etc.) She also supports her children investing in the clothing trade by buying them a sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase fish and ice

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen manages her retail store and motorcycle transport. She has been engaged in her motorcycle transport for three years now. She is happily married with three children.

Aileen seeks a loan of PHP 10,000 which will allow her to repair and maintain her motorcycle transport. She hopes that she can keep her businesses profitable so she can send her children to school and sustain her family's basic necessities. Aileen believes that her requested loan amount will be of great help in generating greater income.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of her motorcycle transport and to buy grocery items

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena works hard to support her family by selling fruit in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 14,000 from the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy more items to sell to her customers. Elena has been in this business for 15 years and would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is now 57 years old and has been blessed with three children. She lives with her children in a rural community. Despite being a widow, she has the determination to improve their standard of living and give her children a better life. In this regard, she runs a small variety store in her community, to generate income.

She plans to increase her product offerings, to satisfy her customers' demands. But she has inadequate capital, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000. She will use the loan to buy more inventory to sell at her general store, including canned goods, gasoline, soft drinks, salt, noodles and rice. She believes that her loan will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more inventory to resell, including gasoline, canned goods, noodles and rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for food preparation equipment including a larger oven and fridge

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra, age 48, is a hardworking, decent housewife. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband offers dyeing services, which is the only source of income for the family. 

Azra is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase dyeing material for the shop. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to save money for household needs. Azra hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase dyeing material for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Chimba - 32 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento CHIMBA - 32, Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes cinco mujeres y tres  varones, los integrantes del grupo se dedican a distintas actividades  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Brígida en la foto es la que tiene un pañoleta blanca en su cabeza y cargada de bebe, ella tiene 34 años, casada  con cuatro hijos  de las edades de 15, 13, 5 años y un bebe,  ella se dedica  a la venta de comida, ella vende es su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona Héroes del Chaco de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  la Sra. Brígida una persona muy trabajadora  que con dedicación poco a poco va adquiriendo estabilidad y solvencia y también popularidad por que es muy conocida por sus clientes ya que la Sra. Brígida les atiende muy amablemente,  con el dinero del crédito comprara insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas como papa y aceite por mayor, la cliente cuenta que con mucho esfuerzo se puede crecer más y así seguir haciéndose de patrimonio para el bienestar de su familia y también personal, el deseo de la Sra. Brígida es poder mejorar su puesto fijo ya que esto le haría crecer más en su negocio y por ende mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
The Chimba – 32 communal bank is composed of 8 members, 5 women and 3 men. Each member is devoted to a distinct activity. The president of the bank is Brigida (in the picture she is wearing a white head covering and carrying a baby). She is 34 years old, married, and has 4 children, ages 15, 13, 5, and a baby. She sells meals at her market stall located in the Heroes del Chaco zone of the city of Cochabanba.

Brigida is a very hard-working person who with dedication, little by little, is acquiring stability and solvency and, also, popularity, since she is very well known to her customers, attending to them in a kindly manner.

The loan will be used to purchase supplies at wholesale for the elaboration of meals, including potatoes and oil. She believes that with great effort, her business can expand and, thus, continue to become a source of wellbeing for her and her family. Brigida's desire is to be able to improve her market stall, allowing it to grow more and, in the end, to improve her economic income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing meals to sell.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is 45 years old, married, and has two children. She sells vegetables, fruits, and fish in her community. She is patiently selling every day to earn and save money for the education of her children. 

Visitacion is now asking for additional capital of PHP 13,000 to buy camote (sweet potatoes), bananas, bitter melons, cabbages, tomatoes, and spices to sell. She would like to offer more varieties of merchandise to meet the demands of her customers and to create a good relationship with them. She also hopes to have good sales, so she can further provide for the growing needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy camote, bananas, bitter melons, cabbages, tomatoes, and spices to sell.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia, age 41, is a housewife. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband offers tailoring services. He stitches gents' pants, shirts and trousers, on order.

Fozia is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to buy a Juki industrial sewing machine for his business. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. Fozia hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a Juki industrial sewing machine, for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Ivan Fabricio

texts.es:
El cliente Ivan vive en la ciudad de Portoviejo. Comenzó su negocio cuando falleció el papa, donde comenzo a vender víveres de primera necesidad. 

Actualmente tiene una tienda pequeña donde vende arroz la libra a $ 0.50, cafe el sobre $ 0.25, bebidas desde $ 0.20. Trabaja de lunes a domingo desde muy temprano. Esta casado y tiene dos hijos uno de 6 años y otro de 3 años. 

El tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio ya que es el sustento de su familia por eso quiere invertir en víveres y así tener mercadería suficiente para mejorar su negocio Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas, arroz, lacteos.
texts.en:
Ivan lives in the city of Portoviejo.  He started his business when his father died; he began selling basic staples.  He currently has a small store where he sells rice for $0.50 a pound, coffee for $0.25 per envelope and beverages starting at $0.20.   He works Monday to Sunday from very early on.  He’s married and has two children, a six-year-old and a 3-year-old.

He has many hopes for his business since it’s his family’s source of support which is why he wants to invest in food items so that his store will be better stocked.  He will use the loan to buy soft-drinks, rice and dairy products.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, rice and dairy products.

loans.name: Chocolate Group

texts.es:
Chocolate es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 9 personas amables, alegres y trabajadoras. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en un lugar muy conocido porque cerca se encuentra la presa de Cerro de Oro y a la orilla de la la laguna hay una serie de pequeñas palapas que trabajan como restaurantes donde el platillo principal es la mojarra en diferentes presentaciones.

Fabiola es uno de los integrantes de este grupo, tiene la edad de 36 años, solo estudio la  preparatoria y es madre soltera de un pequeño de nombre Niels que estudia la primaria. Ella se dedica al comercio de venta de ropa desde hace mas de 15 años, con la intención de brindar a su hijo una mejor vida y crear su  propia fuente de empleo, ella realiza sus ventas desde un local que tiene en el mercado de su comunidad en sus inicios solo vendía ropa pero ya que tenia un establecimiento empezó a surtirlo de mas productos como zapatos, accesorios y regalos. 

Lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es que gana su propio dinero y sus ganancias las puede usar para cubrir los gastos de escuela, vestido y alimentación de su hijo. Ella solicito este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de variedad de zapatos, camisas, blusas, playeras, pantalones, shorts, faldas, vestidos y accesorios.

Ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio continue progresando y pueda aumentar sus ganancias par a en un futuro poder ofrecer a su hijo la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera profesional. 

Este grupo Agradece a viSion fund por el préstamo que se les brindo.

Los de mas integrantes del grupo son:

Maria venta de refrescos
Zoila venta de dulces
Cecilia venta de zapatos
Daniel servicio de carpinteria 
Isabel venta de ropa y zapatos
Leonor papeleria
Oscar venta de carne 
Cinthia venta de zapatos
texts.en:
“Chocolate” is the name of a group of nine kind, cheerful and hardworking people. This group is located in a very well-known spot located near the Cerro de Oro dam.  Along the shores of the lake there is a series of small thatch roof stands that operate as restaurants where the main dish is bream cooked in various ways.

Fabiola is one of the group members.  She’s 36-years-old and only completed high school.  She’s a single mother of a little boy whose name is Niels and who attends primary school.  She’s been a clothes merchant for more than 15 years aiming at providing a better life for her son and to create her own source of employment.  She sells from a stand she has in her community market.  At the beginning she only sold clothes but since she had an establishment she started to stock it with other products like shoes, accessories and gifts.

What she likes best about her business is that she earns her own money and she can use profits to cover her son’s school, clothes and food costs.  She requested this loan to invest in the purchase of a variety of shoes, shirts, blouses, t-shirts, pants, shorts, skirts, dresses and accessories.  She hopes that her business will continue making progress with this investment so that she can increase profits to offer her son in future the opportunity to study a professional career.  The group thanks VisionFund for the loan granted.

The other group members are:

Maria - soft-drink sales
Zoila - candy sales
Cecilia - shoes sales
Daniel - carpentry services 
Isabel - clothes and shoes sales
Leonor - stationery
Oscar - meat sales
Cinthia - shoes sales

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothes and accessories.

loans.name: Akil

texts.en:
Akil is an Iraqi client, who is 46 years old, married and has 5 children.  Akil and 3 of his children work together to provide the income for the family, while the other 2 continue their studies.

Akil owns a grocery store where he sells all the basic needs of a family like dairy products, snacks, canned food and detergent.  He established his business in 2009 and gained much experience in this field.  Thanks to his special customer service, Akil reputation increased and became well known in the neighborhood.

Akil is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD to renovate his grocery store, buy a generator and increase his sales inventory.  Akil is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may continue providing for his family’s needs and to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to renovate his grocery store, buy a generator and increase his inventory of goods

loans.name: Givi

texts.en:
Givi is 51 years old.  He lives in the small village of Sagarejo District with his parents, who are provided with a retirement pension.  Givi requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success.  His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Nowadays the family does not have a good source of income.  According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Givi requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business.  Givi has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo.  The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Givi will open a bakery.  He needs to finish building the bakery, which has already begun.  After all the materials are bought and the bakery is built, he will bake Georgian bread for selling.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a bakery

loans.name: Lida

texts.es: Lida, de 41 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, actualmente vive en la casa de madre junto a su hermana y su sobrina. Lida se dedica a la venta de golosinas para eso instaló una pequeña tienda en la casa de su madre donde ofrece a la venta diversas productos como caramelos, chocolates, galletas y otros, además vende bebidas. Se inició en la venta de golosinas gracias a un pequeño capital económico que pudo juntar por mucho tiempo, desde entonces ha podido multiplicar su inversión y sus ganancias son satisfactorias. Adquiere sus productos realizando compras cada dos días,lleva en está actividad un promedio de 8 años. Trabaja con la ayuda de su mamá o de su hermana quienes se encargan de la atención cuando ella esta fuera de casa. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder tener un ingreso económico que le ayude a solventar sus gastos personales y con los que puede apoyar en los gastos del hogar. Este es su cuarto crédito con Kiva, por ello se siente agradecida con las personas que le brindan el financiamiento que necesita para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de S/.2000 nuevos soles comprará golosinas al por mayor como chocolates, caramelos, galletas y chizitos.
texts.en:
Lida, 41, is single and has no children.  She currently lives in her mother’s house with her sister and niece.  Lida works selling snacks and to do so opened a store in her mother’s house where she sells various items like candy, chocolates, cookies and others; she also sells soft-drinks.  

She started out selling snacks thanks to a little capital she was able to save up over time.  Since then she’s been able to multiply her investment and her profits are satisfactory.  She acquires her products making purchases every two days.  She’s been in this line of work for about 8 years.  She works with her mother’s and her sister’s help; they take care of the store when she’s away from home.  What she likes about her activity is being able to earn income that helps cover her personal costs and also helps her cover household expenses.

This is her fourth Kiva loan and she’s grateful to the people who provide the financing she needs to make her plans reality.  On the other hand, she commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the requested 2,000 soles to buy snacks like chocolates, candy, cookies and corn puffs at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Marvel

texts.es:
Marvel, de 50 años de edad, está casada con Bernardo y tiene 4 hijos , juntos viven en su casa propia. Marvel se dedica a alquilar juegos de video, por está razón instaló en su hogar un pequeño local contando con todos  los permisos y licencias de ley, en donde solo se permite el ingreso de mayores de edad. Se inició hace 18 años con la compra de un par de televisores y solo 05 video juegos pero con el tiempo ha ido incrementando sus implementos y ahora tiene 10 televisores cada uno de ellos instalado al dispositivo que le permite iniciar con los juegos. Complementa esta actividad con la venta de bebidas y algunas golosinas. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el ingreso fluido de la clientela a quienes atiende con mucha amabilidad, en el futuro espera continuar trabajando y seguir generando sus ingresos económicos ya que tiene planeado establecer otro tipo de negocio. Este es su sexto crédito con Kiva y está muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 500 nuevos soles, comprará algunas piezas y repuestos para 3 de sus televisores.
texts.en:
Marvel, 50, is married to Bernardo and they have 4 children.  They live together in their own house.  Marvel works renting video games and to do so set up a small space at home that has all required permits and licenses required by law.  She only allows adults in.  

She started 18 years ago with the purchase of a pair of television sets and just five games but in time she’s been increasing her equipment and now has ten television sets; each one of them is equipped with the device that makes it possible to play games.  She complements this activity with the sale of soft-drinks and some snacks.  What she likes about her activity is that clientele moves through fluidly and she tends to them very kindly.  In future, she plans to continue working and continue generating income because she plans to open another type of business.

This is her 7th Kiva loan and she’s very grateful for the economic support she gets to continue forward which is why she commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the requested 500 new soles to buy some spare parts for three of her television sets.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her TV sets.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda is 31 years old and married to Eddie.  The couple are blessed with three children.  The family happily lives in a rural area where the primary source of income is corn farming.  Criselda and her spouse have planted and harvested corn for over five years now.  They gain approximately PHP 10,000 each harvest (twice a year).  Criselda is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides for use in farming.

With good fertilization of the crops, Criselda and her husband believe that they will achieve abundant harvest leading to business improvement someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for use in farming

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en:
Ishrat is a 32 year old hardworking and diligent woman.  She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along her husband and five children.  Her husband is running a business of gem stones for the past 4 years.  

Ishrat has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan.  With the loan amount her husband wants to purchase a new variety of rare gem stones. This would attract more customers and his sales would increase.  After getting the profit, Ishrat would pay the installments of the loan and save some money for the marriage of her children.

loans.use: to purchase rare gem stones

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga, de 30 años de edad , es madre soltera de una hija de 08 años a quien cría en su casa propia tratando de brindarle las mejores condiciones de vida y cubrir con todas sus necesidades. Olga se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y otros accesorios de uso cotidiano. Vende perfumes, talcos, cremas corporales además de aretes o diversas joyas , toda su mercadería es enviada en grandes paquetes desde otra ciudad , estos productos los ofrece de casa en casa vendiendo al contado o al crédito, la cobranza lo realiza en forma diaria, semanal o quincenal. Realiza este oficio desde hace 8 años y algunas veces recibe el apoyo de su mamá o de un mototaxista particular quien le ayuda a trasladar toda su mercadería. Se siente muy satisfecha por lo bien que le va en ésta etapa , ya que tiene buenas ventas y como resultado de ello obtiene buenas ganancias, ahora espera seguir creciendo y más adelante  conseguir un puesto de ventas para exhibir sus productos con mayor tranquilidad. Este es su octavo crédito con Kiva, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este financiamiento ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de S/. 3800 soles comprará mercadería conformada por diversos tipos de cosméticos y accesorios femeninos tales como perfumes, cremas, talcos, entre otros.
texts.en:
Olga, 30, is a single mother of an 8-year-old daughter who she raises in her own house providing the best living conditions and covering all her needs.  Olga sells cosmetics and other daily use accessories.  She sells perfume, talc, body cream as well as earrings and other jewelry.  All of her merchandise is shipped to her in large packages from another city.  She sells these goods at home both for cash and on credit; she collects daily, weekly or biweekly payments.  

She’s been in this occupation for 8 years and sometimes gets help from her mother or from a private mototaxi driver who helps her transport all her merchandise.  She feels very satisfied because of how well she’s doing at this stage because her sales are good and as a result so are her profits.  Now, she hopes to continue growing and later on get a sales stand to display her goods with more ease.

This is her 8th Kiva loan and she thanks those who make access to this financing possible because she’ll feel more confident about advancing in her work.  On the other hand, she commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the requested 3,800 soles to buy merchandise consisting in various types of cosmetics and female accessories like perfume, cream and talc, among others.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Elie

texts.fr: Elie est un homme de 42 ans, fiancé père de 2 enfants de 2 et 10 ans, il a aussi une autre personne à sa charge. Il est commerçant et a ouvert une petite alimentation qu'il gère lui m^me depuis 13 ans. C'est grace à elle qu'il subvient aux besoins de sa famille. grace à son acceuil chaleureux et ses relations de bon voisinage, il a conquis et fidelisé une clientèle qui s'accroit au fil du temps, et là, il nhe parvient plus à la satisfaire totale d'où la necessité de ce crédit dans son activité en ce momment parce qu'il lui permettra d'augmenter le stock des produits de première necessité. Ceci augmentera ses ventes et donc sa marge bénéficiaire. Bénéfice qui sera en partie réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Elie is a 42-year-old man, engaged and the father of two children, aged 2 and 10.  He also has an additional person under his care.  He is a shopkeeper and he has opened a small store which he has been managing by himself for the past 13 years.  Thanks to this small business, he is able to meet his family's needs.

Thanks to his warm welcome and to his good relationships with his neighbors, Elie has also managed to build and retain a customer base which has increased in size over time.   Precisely because his customer base has increased so much, he can no longer satisfy all the demand and he is therefore requesting a loan to develop his business.  This loan will allow him to increase his stock of staple foods, which will in turn increase his sales and consequently his profit margin.

Elie plans to reinvest part of his profits in his business in order to expand it, while the rest will be used to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to increase his stock of staple foods.

loans.name: Hisham

texts.en:
Hisham is a youth client, from Iraq. He is 24 years old, and he lives with his family of five members. Hisham, his father and one of his brothers, together, provide the family income.

Hisham owns a barber shop, which he established in 2009. When Hisham was around 14 years old, he started working at his neighbor's barber shop, in order to gain experience. When he had grown up and gained all the needed experience, Hisham established his own independent business. He now has a hired employee and has gained a good reputation in the neighborhood.

Hisham is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD to pay the annual rent of his barber shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so that he may provide himself a good and promising career.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his barber shop

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
San Jose es un grupo que se encuentra ubicado en un pequeño pueblo que se encuentra rodeado de sembradios de caña de azucar y a la orilla del pueblo pasa un pequeño arroyo que en tiempo de lluvias crece y es dificil el acceso a esta comunidad, la principal actividad economica es la siembra y cultivo de caña de azucar y la mayoria de sus habitantes trabaja como jornaleros.

Doña Susana es uno de los integrantes de este grupo, ella cuenta con 54 años, no tuvo oportunidad de estudiar solo aprendió un poco  a escribir y hacer cuentas, ella esta casada con Don Juan y actualmente solo viven ellos en su hogar ya que sus hijos están casados. Doña Susana platica que nunca había trabajado ya que solo se dedicaba a atender su casa pero hace mas de 5 años con el apoyo de su esposo abrieron una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su hogar con la intención de obtener un ingreso económico extra. Ella dice que lo que más le gusta de su actividad es que gana su propio dinero sin descuidar su hogar, además de que siempre está en contacto con la gente. 

Un crédito de VisionFund le ayudará a comprar leche, huevos, detergentes, refrescos, dulces, aceite, frijol, papel higiénico, servilletas, galletas, sopa, café y azúcar  para resurtir su negocio. 

Ella quiere que con esta inversión su negocio crezca más y tenga mayor variedad de productos para que sus clientes siempre encuentren lo que buscan.

Los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Guadalupe cria de cerdos 
Rutilo venta de tacos
Eva venta de refrescos
Irene cria de cerdos 
Guillermina cria de cerdos 
Pascuala venta de pollo 
Eutimio venta de tacos
texts.en:
San José Group is located in a small town surrounded by sugar cane fields.  At the edge of town there's a small arroyo that rises during the rainy season, so it's difficult to get to this community.  The main economic activity is growing sugar cane and the majority of the residents work as day laborers.

Susana, 54, is one of the members of this group.  She didn't have the opportunity to go to school; she only learned to write a little and to do sums.  She's married to Juan, and currently they live alone in their house because their children are married.

Susana says she had never worked because she only tended to her house.  More than five years ago, though, with the support of her husband she opened a small grocery store in her house to earn an additional income.  She says what she likes most about her job is earning her own money without neglecting her home.  Also, she's always in contact with people.

A loan from VisionFund will allow her to buy milk, eggs, detergent, refreshments, sweets, oil, beans, toilet paper, napkins, cookies, soup, coffee, and sugar to restock her business.

She wants her business to grow with this investment and have a greater variety of products so her customers always find what they're looking for.

These are the other members of the group: Guadalupe raises pigs; Rutilo sells tacos; Eva sells refreshments; Irene raises pigs; Guillermina raises pigs; Pascuala sells chicken; and Eutimio sells tacos.

loans.use: to restock her business

location.town: Buena Vista, San Miguel Soyaltepec,  Oaxaca

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Sabalibougou en commune V du district de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Sabalibougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de charbon, de produits cosmétiques (tubes de crème de peaux, boucle d’oreille,etc), d’habits d’enfants, de produits divers (sucre, thé,  savon,etc),des condiments et des jus locaux. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1iercycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Awa (la 1ere femme assise à l’extrême gauche) est une grande renommée dans la vente du bois et du charbon dans le quartier. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 40 sacs de charbon de bois. Elle se ravitaille dans les villages environnants  de Bamako. La revente se fait  au comptant  et à crédit au marché  à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Awa espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Tout comme les autres membres du groupe, elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Most of the women who make up the Benkadi group are married within monogamous households. On average, they are 35 years old and have four children each. They all live in Sabalibougou, a neighborhood located in the fifth commune of Bamako. They know each other through neighborhood and business ties as they are all involved in income-generating activities at the Sabalibougou market. The members of the group are involved in small retail businesses and sell charcoal, children's clothes, condiments, local juices, cosmetic products (skin care creams, earrings) and various other products (sugar, tea, soap etc.)

They have joined Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their businesses, and this is their first solidarity loan cycle.

Awa, sitting first from the left in the photo, is an important seller of firewood and charcoal in her neighborhood. She plans to use her loan to buy 40 bags of charcoal.  She stocks up in villages surrounding Bamako. She resells her goods at the market, for cash or on credit, to a customer base which mostly consists of women.

With this loan, Awa hopes to make an average monthly profit of 50,000 CFA francs which will be reinvested in her business and also used to take care of her family.  Like the other members of the group, her goal is to buy a plot of land to build a house.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana, de 35 años de edad , es madre soltera de 2 hijos, de 09 y 04 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en la casa de sus padres. Roxana, se dedica la venta de comidas regionales. De lunes a sábado atiende por las mañanas en un puesto que tiene ubicado cerca de un concurrido mercado mientras que por las noches vende en la vereda de su casa. Lleva ya 6 años en este negocio y trabaja sola. Desde que inició su negocio ha logrado mejorar sus condiciones de vida y es por eso que sigue desarrollando está actividad. Le gusta su trabajo porque gracias a ello sus hijos están estudiando y a pesar de su intensa actividad dedica una parte del tiempo a ayudar a sus pequeños en las tareas del colegio y estar a su lado cuando la necesitan, como toda mujer emprendedora tiene muchos planes a futuro y aunque ya avanzó mucho desea seguir progresando. Este es su quinto préstamo con Kiva y se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero recibido razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 3000 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos como arroz, carnes, condimentos y otros para continuar preparando sus comidas, además de sillas y muebles para su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Roxana, 35, is a single mother of two children aged 9 and 4 respectively that she lives with in her parents’ house.  Roxana works selling regional food.  She works Monday to Saturday mornings in a busy stand she has in the market and in the evenings she sells on the sidewalk at home.  She’s been in business six years and she works alone.

Since she started the business she’s succeeded in improving her living conditions which is why she continues with this activity.  She likes her work because thanks to it her children are attending school and despite her intense activity she has time to help her children with their homework and to be by their side when they need her.  Like all enterprising women, she has many future plans and although she’s already made progress she wants to continue doing so.

This is her 5th Kiva loan and she’s very grateful for the financial support received which is why she commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the requested 3,000 soles to buy ingredients like rice, meat, condiments and others to continue preparing her dishes and also to buy tables and chairs for her food stand.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, meat and vegetables and also to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Solei

texts.es: Solei, de 37 años de edad , es madre soletra de una hija de 16 años de edad respectivamente con quien vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Solei consiste en la compra y venta madera, para ello se dirige a las grandes madereras ubicadas en los alrededores de la ciudad para conseguir madera de buena calidad y a precios bajos los cuales transforma en listones y los vende muchos más comodo, tiene clientes que siempre solicitan su mercancía y cuando carece de ello no duda en acudir a otro lugar para conseguir lo que le pide su cliente. Lleva en este negocio 02 años y todo le esta marchando de maravilla. Su trabajo tiene muchas cosas positivas como el de poder disponer de su tiempo para hacer otras actividades y al mismo tiempo que genera ingresos para su familia. Este es su séptimo crédito con Kiva, es por que se siente agradecida con el apoyo financiero recibido para seguir adelante razón por la cual se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de S/. 3500 soles, comprará madera al por mayor para su negocio.
texts.en:
Solei, 37, is the single mother of a 16-year-old daughter who lives with her in her own house.

Solei's job is buying and selling wood.  She goes to the big timber merchants on the outskirts of the city to get good-quality wood at low prices.  She converts the wood into planks to sell it much more easily.  She has customers who always order merchandise from her.  When she doesn't have what they need, she doesn't hesitate to go elsewhere to get what her customer is requesting.

She has been in this business for two years and everything is going wonderfully.  There are many positive aspects of her job, such as being able to organize her time to do other activities at the same time she's generating an income for her family.

This is her seventh Kiva loan.  She's grateful for the financial support she has received so she can get ahead, and she promises to make her payments punctually.

With the requested amount of 3500 soles [PEN] she'll buy wood wholesale for her business.

loans.use: to buy wood wholesale

loans.name: Las Yaguas Group

texts.es:
Ana María es una mujer muy alegre de 36 años de edad. Solo estudio el bachillerato y esta casada con el señor Pablo que trabaja como jornalero. Ellos tiene 4 hijos, Diana, Dana, José y Juan que se encuentran estudiando.
Ana María siempre ha sido una mujer luchona que le gusta el trabajo y por mas de 15 años se ha dedicado al comercio porque en el ha encontrado una fuente de empleo y le gusta tratar con las personas y  hacer buenos lazos de amistad.
Ana María realiza diversas actividades ya que vende cosméticos, zapatos, pan todos ellos de manera ambulante, ella dijo “a mi me gusta ser movida hacer esto y el otro pero buscar la manera de traer el dinero a la casa porque no llega solo tengo 4 hijos estudiando y los gastos son fuertes, hay que sacarlos adelante”.
Ana María es una mujer muy conocida en su comunidad por sus ventas y sus ganas de sacar adelante a su familia.
La venta de pan la realiza todos los días por las tardes y aprovecha para mostrar sus catálogos de zapatos y cosméticos para levantar pedidos cuando ya tiene varios los surte y entrega.
Ella solicita este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de pan, variedad de calzado, esmaltes, sombras, labiales, perfumes, para continuar con sus ventas.
Ella quiere con esta inversión hacer mas clientes para aumentar sus ganancias y seguir dando a sus hijos educación y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Doña Ana María es integrante de un grupo llamado las Yaguas El cual esta integrado por 7 personas los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Mario-Venta de abarrotes
María Elena-Venta de antojitos
Leticia- Venta de Zapatos
Ignacia-Venta de Ropa
Gabriela-Venta de Tamales, pan y mole
Angela-Venta de Antojitos.
texts.en:
Ana María is a very cheerful, 36-year-old woman.  She only completed high school and is married to Pablo who works as a day laborer.  They have four children: Diana, Dana, José and Juan who are attending school.

Ana María has always been a hardworking woman; she likes her work and for more than 15 years has been a merchant because she’s found a source of employment in commerce and she likes dealing with people and forming good bonds of friendship.

Ana María carries out various activities: she sells cosmetics, shoes and bread from place to place.  She said: “I like to be very versatile; I like doing this and that to find ways to bring money home because it’s never enough.  I have four children attending school and costs are heavy; one has to move them forward.”

Ana María is very well-known in her community because of her sales and her drive to move her family ahead.  She sells bread every day in the afternoon and takes advantage of this to show her shoe and cosmetics catalogs to take orders.  When she has several, she fills them and makes the deliveries.

She’s asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of bread, assorted shoes, nail polish, eye shadow, lipstick and perfume to continue with her sales.  She’d like this investment to lead to new customers to increase profits and continue giving her children an education and to improve their quality of life.

Ana María is a member of the “Las Yaguas” group which has seven members.  The other group members are:

Mario-Grocery sales
María Elena-Fast food sales
Leticia- Shoe sales
Ignacia-Clothes sales
Gabriela-Tamales, bread and mole sales
Angela-Fast food sales

loans.use: to buy bread, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Armando

texts.en: Armando, 54 years old, is married with three children. He lives in Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. Armando earns his living by planting and harvesting rice to sell. He has been in this business for many years. Each month, he earns PHP 15,000. Aside from farming, he operates a service-based business providing motor transportation to the local community. He has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase tires and cover repair and maintenance costs. In 2004, Armando joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. In the future, Armando wants to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase tires and cover repair and maintenance costs.

loans.name: Tuchukuliane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mukobelwa est leader du groupe de crédit « Tuchukuliane » entrepreneur courageuse, expérimentée,   âgée de 38 ans et mère de 9 enfants, qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un buandier (il fait le pressing, laverie). La cliente est vendeuse des légumes. Elle commença cette activité avec le fonds reçu de son mari, il y a environ 12 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter  des légumes, etc. La sécheresse, les pertes diverses de pourritures sont des obstacles majeurs pour le développement de son activité. Dans le futur, elle souhaite agrandir son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir et vêtir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien en micro crédit aux femmes entrepreneurs.
texts.en: The borrower Mukobelwa is the leader of the lending group Tuchukuliane. She is a courageous and experienced entrepreneur, 38 years old and mother of nine children, who are all engaged in their studies. Her spouse works at a laundromat (he does dry cleaning and washing). The borrower is a vegetable seller. She started this business with funds from her husband, around 12 years ago. This new loan is going to be used to buy vegetables, etc. Drought and various losses from spoilage are the major obstacles in the development of her business. In the future, she wishes to grow her business and educate, feed, and clothe her children. She thus thanks Hekima for its support as a micro-lender to female entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie, aged 40, is a married woman and has three children.  All of the children are in school. Elvie is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. 

Elvie requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more items to sell, like shampoo, cream, coffee, laundry soap and sugar. She would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, at her general store

loans.name: Kazem

texts.en:
Kazem is an Iraqi client, who is 33 years old, married, and has four children. Kazem and one of his children, together, earn the family's living.

Kazem rents a small shop, where he engages in his own business, selling electrical supplies. He has been in this field since 2009. Kazem is well-experienced in this field. He is well-known in the surrounding area, with an excellent reputation. He is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to pay the annual rent of his shop. Kazem is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so that he may provide a good future and a better living standard for his children.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop

loans.name: Nargul

texts.ru:
Наргул 38 лет, имеет 2 детей. Наргул в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и выращиванием сельхозкультур, стартовав в 1997 году с суммы в (KGS) 2,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Наргул в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  1 корова с приплодом, 2 головы мелкого рогатого скота , 1 га поливной земли  с фасолью и свеклой.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Наргул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS)  на увеличение поголовья мелкого скота.  Доходы от кредита Наргул вложит в приумножение поголовья скота, и в ближайшем будущем проведет ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Nargul is 38 years old and has two children. As a source of income for her family, Nargul raises livestock and grows produce, having launched this business in 1997 with a starting capital of 2,000 KGS. Thanks to Nargul’s hard work, her farm now includes one cow with young, two heads of small cattle and one ha [2.5 acre] of arable land for growing beans and beets.

In order to develop her business further, Nargul turned to the Bai Tushum & Partners microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 35,000 intended to increase her small cattle headcount. Nargul plans to invest her revenues into a further expansion of her livestock, and to renovate her house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Anta's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 5 personnes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été créé le 20 février 2000.Il est composé de femmes qui habitent le même village. Elles vivent une parfaite harmonie.
Satou, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 57 ans. Elle est veuve et a en charge ses 5 enfants dont 2 filles. Elle fait comme activité le commerce de poisson et de légumes.
Le prêt reçu lui permet d'acheter du poisson et de légumes. A noter qu'elle travaille avec son fils qui détient un camion et qui transporte de l’aliment de bétail. Elle donne le reste de l'argent à son fils pour qu'il puisse mener aussi son activité.
Les bénéfices générés servent à renforcer ses épargnes et prendre en charge les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
This group of five people is part of the village lending group that was created on February 5, 2000. It is made up of women who live in the same village. They live in perfect harmony.
Satou, standing up at the right of the photo with her hand raised, is 57 years old. She is a widow and has five children, two of whom are girls. As a business, she sells fish and vegetables.
The loan will allow her to buy fish and vegetables. It should be noted that she works with her son who has a truck and who transports livestock feed. She will give the remaining money to her son so that he can run his business.
The profits generated will be used to reinforce her savings and take care of her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fish and vegetables

loans.name: Dramane

texts.fr:
Agé de plus de  36 ans, Monsieur  Dramane  est marié et père de 3 enfants. Il réside avec son épouse et leurs enfants  dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Wayerma I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur  Dramane  après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès,  s’est initié il y a environ quatre  année aux activités d’achat et de vente des bazins blancs, soude caustique, teintures, etc. Il mène son activité à Wayerma I où il dispose d’une  boutique. Monsieur Dramane est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  il y’a trois  années. Il est à son sixième prêt individuel et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
 Ce  nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter 35 paquets de soude caustique, 25 pièces de bazin, 15 sacs de potasse et 15 boîtes de teinture de couleurs différentes. Ses marchandises sont achetées à Bamako pour  ensuite les revendre à une clientèle composée généralement des femmes teinturières de Sikasso.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce présent prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Dramane, aged 36, is married and a father of three. He resides with his wife and their children in a large traditional family in Wayerma I, a working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run many businesses without success, Mr. Dramane became familiar with the buying and selling of white damask cloth, caustic soda, dyes, etc. about four years ago. He runs his business in Wayerma I, where he has a shop. He is much in demand by his customers for the quality of his products. 

Concerned about satisfying his burgeoning customer base, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. He is on his sixth individual loan, and the previous loans were all correctly repaid. 

This new loan will enable him to purchase 35 packets of caustic soda, 25 lengths of damask, 15 bags of potash, and 15 containers of dyes of different colors. His merchandise is purchased in Bamako and then resold to a customer base composed generally of women dye specialists in Sikasso. 

With the current loan, he envisions making a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used to help cover family expenses and to pay back the loan with interest. The rest will be invested in his business.

loans.use: to purchase white damask cloth, caustic soda, dyes, and potash to sell to artisans.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 45 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in Calabayan, Ozamis City. Arlene owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products, which she has been doing for many years. 

Arlene is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional goods to resell. She joined GDMPC in 2011.  In the future, Arlene wants to build a house and complete the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to resell at her store

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es:
Los Girasoles es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 8 personas emprendedoras y amables. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado a la orilla  de la presa Cerro de Oro, las principales actividades Económicas son la Venta de Mojarra y el comercio.
La señora María de Jesús es uno de los integrantes de este grupo, ella tiene la edad de 51 años, solo estudio la primaria  y se encuentra soltera.
Ella platica que siempre ha sido una mujer de trabajo desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron que la única manera de salir adelante es trabajando.
Doña María de Jesús se dedica a la venta de pollo en pluma y destazado desde hace mas de 30 años, cuando ella inicio con esta actividad fue con la intención de sacar adelante a sus hijos y gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo lo logro. Ella empezó realizando pequeñas ventas en su hogar y con el paso de los años su negocio no lo a ganado popularidad sino también se ha ampliado, actualmente  además de vender en su hogar sale a entregar pollo en algunos establecimientos.
Ella ha solicitado este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de pollos para continuar con sus ventas.
En un futuro le gustaría que su negocio continuara creciendo y tener mas lugares donde entregar su pollo así como mejorar  su calidad de vida.
El grupo Girasoles agradece la oportunidad de recibir su préstamo.

Los demás integrantes del Grupo son:  

Andrea venta de antojitos
Julia venta de pan
Aurora venta de comida
Maria Esther venta de antojitos 
Josefina venta de tacos 
Maria Elena venta de pollo 
Ariana venta de tacos
texts.en:
This group of 8 hardworking, kind entrepreneurs is called “Los Girasoles” (Sunflowers).  It’s located on the shores of the Cerro de Oro dam and the main economic activities are bream sales and commerce.

María de Jesús is one of the group members.  She’s 51-year-old and only attended elementary school; she’s single.

She relates that she’s always been a working woman.  Since she was little her parents taught her that work is the only way to get ahead.

María de Jesús works selling live and butchered chickens; she’s been doing this for more than 30 years.  When she started this activity her intention was to move her children forward and thanks to her work and effort she did so.  She started out making small sales at home and as years have gone by her business has become more popular and she’s expanded it.  Currently, in addition to selling at home she also delivers chicken to some establishments.

She has requested this loan to buy chickens to continue with her sales.  In future, she’d like her business to continue to grow and to have more places to deliver chickens to in order to improve her quality of life.

The Girasoles group is grateful for the opportunity of receiving their loan.  The other group members are:

Andrea - snacks sales
Julia - bread sales
Aurora - food sales
Maria Esther - fast food sales
Josefina - tacos sales
María Elena - chicken sales
Ariana - tacos sales

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Raheela's Group

texts.en:
Raheela is a 40-year-old housewife with many dreams to fulfill. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. Her husband is a welder. 

As a member of two-person borrower group, Raheela has requested a loan in the amount of PKR 35,000 from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She is taking the loan for her husband to buy welding materials, such as iron rods, welding rods, soldering rods, and iron sheets. 

Raheela is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her husband's business. She will use the profit for household expenses. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. Raheela is raising her hand in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase welding materials for her husband's business.

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn, of Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, is a young businesswoman who has already found a field from which she has a good income. She owns and operates a store selling a variety of goods. She's been doing this business for three years. Recently, she became a member of Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) where she gains access to microfinance services. 

She borrowed a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, and biscuits to sell. She plans to improve her business in order to help her parents and to be able to support her studies.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Yacine's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 3 femmes  fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 06 juillet 2006. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l'embouche. Les femmes qui composent le banc villageois entretiennent de bonnes relations.
Codou la représentante, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 25 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants (2 filles et 2 garçons) 
Elle envisage avec le prêt d'acheter un veau à 150 000f et 5 moutons à raison de 27 000f l'un. Pour leur engraissement, elle prévoit aussi d'acheter de l'aliment de bétail.La vente de sa production se fera à quelques semaines du remboursement. 
Les bénéfices lui serviront à satisfaire ses besoins personnels ou familiaux, à renforcer son activité un achetant des moutons.
texts.en:
This group of three women is part of the village lending group that was created on July 6, 2006. Their main businesses are trade and livestock fattening. The women who make up the village lending group have a good relationship.
Codou, the representative, standing up at the right of the photo and raising her hand, is 25 years old. She is married and the mother of four children (two girls and two boys). With the loan, she plans to buy a calf for 150,000XOF and five sheep for 27,000XOF each. To fatten them, she foresees buying livestock feed as well. 
The profits will be used to meet her personal and family needs, and to strengthen her business in buying more sheep.

loans.use: to buy a calf, five sheep, and livestock feed

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 47 years old, married, and has two children. She is from Mantik Tangub City. 

Salvacion used her last loan to invest in the expansion of her business. She is now requesting a new loan of PHP 15,000 from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC)  to purchase more items to increase her product offerings. 

She plans to expand her business and create additional income by having an outlet in their town and she hopes to save a portion of the income for the future of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more items to expand her product offerings.

loans.name: Williams Alexander

texts.es:
Williams es una persona de 23 años, esta acompaña. Es un joven que se dedica al comercio de cerdos; ya que su padre le enseño desde la edad de 15 años, trabajaba y estudiaba al mismo tiempo. Junto a su padre salían a comprar los cerdo en los lugares como el tiangue, en casa de personas que se dedican a la crianza de cerdos. Hoy en día se dedica al comercio; debido a que su padre no trabaja por una fractura  en el pie que le sucedió en un accidente y él se encarga hoy de su padre y de su esposa, con la comercialización de los cerdos. Williams,lleva el sustento a la casa y le compra medicina a su padre también. Los cerdos los compra en lugares retirados a su casa alrededor de 10 kilómetros, por ese motivo se le dificulta transportarlos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más cerdos, debido  a que el precio del cerdo esta bien para generar un buen margen de ganancias, ya que los que tiene ya están vendidos y el quiere comprar mas para vendérselos a los cliente que   tiene. Su negocio tiene gran movimiento y para no quedar mal con los clientes, necesita el dinero para comprar mas por que no le alcanza con el dinero que tiene . 

  con el crédito le mejorara la vida; ya que se dedica al trabajo de la comercialización de cerdos con el dinero que obtiene en la venta que son las ganancias; el incrementara la compra de cerdos y así aumentara el ingreso de dinero a su casa a la vez podrá comprarle las medicina a su padre y mejorar la condición de vida a su esposa.  

    En el futuro el piensa ampliar las instalaciones donde mantiene a los cerdos y construir su propia casa.
		|
texts.en:
Williams, 23, has a spouse.  He’s a young man who works selling pigs; his father taught him this at the age of 15.  He used to work and attend school at the same time.  He and his father would go out to buy pigs in places like El Tiangue at the houses of people who work raising pigs.  Today, he works selling them because his father no longer works due to a broken foot that happened in an accident and now he takes care of his father and his wife by means of the pig sales.  Williams supports his home and buys his father’s medicine too.  He buys the pigs in places far from his house at a distance of about 10 kilometers which makes transporting them difficult.

The loan he’s asking from Fundación Campo is to buy more pigs because the price of pigs is good now to generate a higher profit margin because the ones he has now are already sold and he wants to buy more to sell to sell to his customers.  His business has a large turnover and he does not want to disappoint his customers; he needs the money to buy more because the money he has is insufficient.
