The loan will improve his life because he works selling pigs and the money he earns from the sales, his profits, will be used to buy more pigs and his household income will increase at the same time so he can buy his father’s medicine and improve his wife’s living condition.  In future, he plans to improve the installations where he keeps his pigs and to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy more pigs.

loans.name: Zyonnie

texts.en:
Zyonnie is a 31-year-old, single woman. She lives in Mantic Tangub City. 

In order to help her family, Zyonnie owns and operates a general store in her town, where she sells a variety of products. She has been in this business for years. Aside from this, she also manages her carinderia, selling foods like viand, snacks, and other provisions to their local community. 

She borrowed an amount of PHP 15,000 from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) where she had joined years ago to purchase raw ingredients for her carinderia. She hopes to improve her business in order to have better living conditions for the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her carinderia business.

loans.name: Cheick Oumar

texts.fr:
Âgé de plus 27 ans, Monsieur Cheick Oumar  est célibataire  résidant chez son père dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Cheick Oumar  n’a pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école, il s’est très vite initié depuis des années à la vente des pièces détachées auto  auprès de son frère à Sikasso. Sa boutique se situe au nouveau marché de médine Sikasso et la plupart de sa clientèle est composée des hommes surtout les forains. Avec une telle expérience dans le domaine, il jouit d’une parfaite confiance des clients il achète des marchandises et  afin de les revendre Dans les souci de mieux satisfaire des commandes de plus en plus croissantes, il sollicite ainsi ce deuxième crédit auprès de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est en partenariat il y environ un an, le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé. 
Ce deuxième crédit lui permettra d’acheter 15 paire enjoliver 10 paires de coussin 30 jantes de qualité différentes, 5 extincteurs,  à Lomé (république de Togo). Sa clientèles est constituée de  garagistes et particuliers de Sikasso.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses personnelles, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son magasin.
texts.en:
Mr. Cheick Ouma, aged 27, is unmarried and lives at his father house in a large traditional family in Hamdallaye, a working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Mr. Cheick Ouma did not have the chance to go far in school. Along side his brother in Sikasso, he soon became familiar over the years with selling replacement parts for automobiles. His store is located at the new market Médine Sikasso. Most of his customers are men, especially fair-goers. With such experience in this domain, he enjoys the complete trust of his customers. He purchases his merchandise and then resells the goods to them. 

Concerned about satisfying the burgeoning orders, he is therefore requesting this second loan from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, where he has been in a partnership for about a year. The previous loan was correctly paid back. 

This second loan will enable him to purchase 15 pairs of hubcaps, 10 pairs of cushions, 30 wheel rims of different qualities, and 5 extinguishers in Lomé (Republic of Togo). His customer base is composed of garage operators and individuals in Sikasso.

With this loan, he envisions making a monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA. With the profits earned, he plans on resolving the most important of his personal expenses, help with family expenses, and pay back the loan with interest. The rest is for investing in his store.

loans.use: to purchase replacement parts for automobiles to resell

loans.name: Amah

texts.en: Amah is 22 years old, single, and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She has a cafeteria, where located in association. She sells tea, coffee and soft drinks, among other things. She likes this business, because she thinks it offers humanitarian assistance for the people. Amah doesn’t have enough money to buy products for her business. Therefore, she asked for a loan in the amount of YER 176,000, which she will use to buy products to sell, including tea, coffee and soft drinks. She hopes that this will attract more customers and help her to earn more money.

loans.use: to buy products to sell to her customers, including tea, coffee and soft drinks

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel es una persona de 63 años de edad, esta acompaño y tiene 11 hijos. Él es una persona que desde pequeño estudiaba y llego a noveno grado y con ese grado de educación sea defendido en su vida con diferentes trabajos. Se ha desempeñado como albañil, en construcción de casas, también en la agricultura y hoy en el comercio de ganado y especies menores como el cerdo esto lo aprendió con su padre y amigos de su padre en el comercio de animales tiene como 10 años, comenta que le va muy bien en ocasiones ya que cuando se enferma no puede salir a trabajar; ya que vive solo en su casa por que su esposa se encuentra fuera del país; todos los hijos que a tenido ya están casados pero una de las hijas esta siempre pendiente de él. 

Ademas de comprar y vender animales, tiene cultivo de caña y del producto que saca de la caña que es el dulce de atado lo vende en la plaza pues el a pesar de los años que tiene siempre, se encuentra activo trabajando para poder mantenerse.      

 Para comprar los cerdos, las vacas, su alimentación personal debe de viajar en camiones, en carro, o a pie cuando no hay transporte por que en la zona donde vive los fines de semana es muy difícil de encontrar transporte se vuelve escaso.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar mas cerdos y vacas; por que no a podido vender el atado de dulce que tiene almacenado en su bodega pequeña que esta ubicado en su casa, debido a que el precio del dulce esta muy bajo entonces para no estar sin hacer nada a pensado comprar animales con el dinero que solicitara para tener otra entrada de dinero para sus gastos.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 63-year-old person; he has a spouse and 11 children.  He’s a person who attended school when he was little and went up to 9th grade.  With that level of education he’s been able to fend for himself in life in various jobs.  He’s worked in construction building houses, in agriculture and now as a merchant selling cattle and minor livestock like pigs; he learned this from his father and friends of his father.  He’s been a livestock merchant for about 10 years and comments that he does very well.  Occasionally when he gets sick he’s unable to go out to work because he lives alone at home because his wife’s abroad.  All of the children he’s had are already married but one of his daughters is always watching over him.

In addition to buying and selling animals, he also grows sugarcane.  He makes a sweet from sugarcane called “atado de dulce” [unrefined whole cane sugar] that he sells in the square because despite his age he’s always active working to support himself.

To buy pigs, cows and his food he must travel by truck, car or on foot when transportation is unavailable because transportation on weekends is very difficult to come by in the zone he lives in; it becomes very scarce.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy more pigs and cows because he’s been unable to sell the atado de dulce he has stored in his small warehouse located at home because the sweet’s price is very low and in order not to be idle he’s thought of buying animals with the money he’s requested to have an additional source of income to cover his expenses.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and cows.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es: Juan Bautista es padre de familia , se dedica a labores de albañilería, repara casas , rotula locales comerciales y otros oficios de este tipoi. Juan no tiene el equipo y herramientas suficientes para hacer  todos estos trabajos. Necesita un crédito por un millón de colones para adquirirlo. , Juan manifiesta su agradecimiento por este apoyo financiero.
texts.en: Juan Bautista is a father head of household.  He works in construction, repairs houses, and makes commercial signs and other jobs of this type.  Juan does not have enough equipment or tools to do these jobs.  He needs a one-million colon loan to buy acquire them.  He states his gratitude for this financial support.

loans.use: to buy construction tools.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is 25 years old. She lives in the Khelvachauri District with husband Ucha and 5-year-old son Nikoloz. Irina requested loan from local financial institutions several times for her family business start-up without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time because of her low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 
Irina’s husband Ucha is an artisan. He works on house construction and renovations for private orders to earn a small monthly salary, which is the only source of the income for the family. 
Irina requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Irina has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit, Irina will open a shoe shop. She has already rented a commercial space in a very populous area and now wants to fill it up with shoes. Irina will work in the shop as a seller herself in order to decrease expenses and increase her income. She will reinvest part of the profit in the same field and purchase more varieties of shoes to satisfy client needs more. Another part of the profit will be used to improve the family's living conditions and insure a better life for her son.

loans.use: to open a shoe shop.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima, 59 years old, is married and blessed with three children. 

For almost 20 years, she's been selling vegetables in their village. She is glad that she can earn a daily income of PHP 300.  

Maxima wanted to make her business more progressive, so she is borrowing a loan of PHP15,000 to purchase more vegetables to sell. She is hoping that her business will grow and become profitable.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en: Zakia is 48 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three sons. She belongs to a very poor family. Her husband collects and sells waste materials to recycling factories as the only source of income for his family. He is a very hard-working person. Zakia's husband wants to open a shop for his work. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. Therefore, Zakia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to open a shop. Zakia is so thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To open a shop for her husband's work.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es: Julieta, de 22 años, está casada y tiene un hijo de 02 años con quien vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Julieta consiste en la venta de diversos cosméticos como talcos, cremas corporales, perfumes, lociones, polvos faciales, entre otros. Estos productos los distribuye entre sus amigas, vecinas y familiares quienes le solicitan con anterioridad cada artículo de su preferencia. Tiene en su casa una vitrina de exhibición en donde muestra los productos que tiene en stock. Lleva con éste trabajo 02 años y le va muy bien hasta ahora aunque cuando se inició en éste negocio estaba muy llena de dudas e inseguridades, pero sus ganas por seguir adelante se impusieron y poco a poco fue aprendiendo la manera adecuada de sacarle provecho a su actividad laboral.Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante con su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1800 soles comprará cosméticos tales como perfumes, talcos, cremas corporales, cremas faciales y otros.
texts.en:
Julieta is 22 years old, married, and has a child aged two that lives with her in the house she owns. Julieta's job is to sell various cosmetics such as talcs, body lotions, perfumes, lotions, face powders, etc. She distributes these products among her friends, neighbors, and family who order the products of their choice in advance. 

In her house she has a display case where she displays the products she has in stock. She has been running this business for two years and so far it is going very well. Although she was full of doubts and insecurity when she started, her will to carry on was stronger and she kept learning little by little how to make a profit out of her business. 

This is her fourth loan with Kiva and she feels grateful for the financial support that she receives in order to continue her business. She also pledges to make her repayments punctually. She will use the requested loan of 1800 PEN to buy cosmetics such as perfumes, talcs, body lotions, facial creams, and more.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as perfumes, talcs, body lotions, etc.

loans.name: Assetou

texts.fr:
Née en Novembre 1964 à Bamako, Madame  Assetou  est une femme mariée et mère de 5 enfants résidant avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une grande famille nucléaire à Hamdallaye  un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès elle s’est finalement initiée aux activités d’achat et de vente des articles divers tels la pâte d’arachide, les poissons fumés et séché, des savons de toilettes etc. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ six ans. Après cinq prêts individuel tous  correctement remboursé, elle est à son sixième.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
Ce sixième prêt lui permettra d’acheter 20 cartons de savons de toilettes, 10 seaux de pâte d’arachide, 4 cartons de poisons fumé, sur place à Sikasso qui seront vendus de façon ambulante.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 90.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born in November 1964 in Bamako, Ms. Assetou is a married woman and the mother of five children. She resides with her husband and their children in a large nuclear family in Hamdallaye, a working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run many businesses without success, she finally became familiar with buying and selling a variety of goods, such as peanut butter, smoked fish, dried fish, bath soaps, etc. 

Concerned about satisfying her burgeoning customer base further, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso about six years ago. After five individual loans, all correctly paid back, she is on her sixth loan, which will enable her to purchase 20 boxes of bath soaps, 10 pails of peanut butter, and 4 boxes of smoked fish, locally in Sikasso. These goods will be resold by going door to door.

With this loan, she envisions making a monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be used to help cover family expenses and to pay the loan interest. The rest is for reinvesting in her business.

loans.use: to purchase various goods, such as peanut butter, fish, and bath soaps to sell

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 34 years old, married, and has children. Maribel and her husband are helping one another in their farming business with activities such as planting and harvesting rice to sell. Maribel wants to improve their crop production but she has limited resources. With this loan, she would like to borrow  additional capital of PHP 40,000 to sustain the farming business. She plans to use the loan to buy fertilizers and insecticides for the crops. 

Maribel hopes to make her business grow and earn more profit for the benefit of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.es: José Daniel  es padre de tres niños y con esfuerzo propios ha logrado construir su casa aunque aún  necesita hacer  urgentemente una tapia (muro) para proteger su vivienda ya que el terreno donde vive es muy irregular ,para esto solicita un millón de colones (¢1.000.000 ) con este dinero comprará materiales de construcción como cemento, arena y piedra y otros.
texts.en: José Daniel is the father of three children.  With his own effort he’s managed to build his house but still urgently needs to erect a retaining wall to protect his dwelling since the lot he lives on is very irregular.  To do so, he’s requesting a one-million colon (¢1.000.000) loan.  He will use this money to buy building supplies like cement, sand, stone and others.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Rosalía

texts.es: Rosalía es una madre emprendedora y uno de sus mayores logros ha sido la construcción de su vivienda propia, aunque aún le faltan varios detalles , como pisos , techar cuarto de pilas,  construir las aceras,  etc,  necesita un crédito por un millón cuarenta mi colones  (¢1.040.000) con este dinero comprará materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, piedra block entre otros.
texts.en: Rosalía is an enterprising mother; one of her main achievements has been the construction of her own house even though it still needs a few details like floors, roofing the laundry room, building the walkways, etc.  She needs a one-million, forty-thousand colon loan (¢1.040.000) to buy building materials like cement, sand, stone and concrete blocks, etc.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester is a 51-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has five children, ages 16 to 25. Ester has been raising pigs for more than four years now. She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy feed for the pigs for them to grow healthy so that she could sell them on time. In the future, Ester would like to expand her pig-raising business to improve her livelihood status and also to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs

loans.name: Felomino

texts.en:
Felomino is a farmer, who lives in the village of Kapalaran, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, with his family. He's a farmer who plants and harvests rice, on a plot of land located in the village where he lives. He chose this line of work because it was his father's legacy, and also because with it he produces food for his family. Rice is the staple food in his community and earns him a profit, because he sells part of his harvest in the local market.

He's requesting a loan, which he will use to purchase fertilizer. This is needed, in order to adequately maintain his crop and have a good harvest. He dreams of using his profits to improve his home, so that he can provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, in order to adequately maintain his crop and have a good harvest

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en: Ermelinda's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting root crops for sale. She is a widowed 59 year old. She is from Kinuman Sur, Ozamiz City and has been farming for years. She also had a farm of corn for additional crops to be produced. Ermelinda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Bosco Augusto

texts.es:
El cliente Bosco vive en la ciudad de Portoviejo, es un hombre trabajador que comenzó su negocio vendiendo de casa en casa mercadería como carteras para mujeres, ollas etc. Poco a poco mejoro sus ingresos gracias a su desempeño de trabajar todos los dias. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde las 07:00am todos los días. Ahora también vende ropa para mujeres y hombres. Esta separado de su pareja pero tambien un hijo y tres nietos que actualmente estudian. 

Con el prestamo quiere comprar carteras, forros, ollas, utensilios para la cocina para asi tener los suficientes ingresos para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Bosco lives in the city of Portoviejo.  He is a hardworking man who started his business selling merchandise from his home, such as handbags for women, pots, etc.  Gradually, he increased his income, thanks to his hard work each day.

Now he works starting at 7am every day.  He now sells clothing for men and women.  Bosco is separated from his partner, but he has a son and 3 grandchildren who are now in school.

With this loan, he wants to buy handbags, kitchen appliance covers, pots, and kitchen utensils so that he can have enough income to keep working.

loans.use: to buy handbags, kitchen appliance covers, and pots

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is an Iraqi client who is 64 years old, married and has two children. Rashid is the only provider for his family.
He owns a bakery that provides his neighborhood with fresh bread. Rashid established his business in 2006 and has gained good experience in this field. Thanks to his affordable prices and the good quality of his offered goods, he has gained an excellent reputation in the area.
Rashid is requesting a loan of $1,800 USD. The aim of this loan is to buy a motor generator and to install signage for his bakery. Rashid is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may gain even more fame and pass on his business to his children.

loans.use: to buy a motor generator and to install signage for his bakery

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar is 47 years old and lives in Batumi district with his wife and two sons, Kakhaber, 25, and Luka, 13. Nodar requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 
The only source of income for the family is from Nodar’s elder son Khakhaber, who is working as a marine.
Nodar requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Nodar has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Nodar will open a car washing center. He has a space which needs some minor construction work. After that, Nodar will purchase all the needed equipment and start the new business. He wants to improve his family's living conditions and insure a better life for them. Also, he needs to provide for the education of his young son Luka, so Nodar will work as hard as he can to make his business successful and profitable.

loans.use: To open a car washing center

loans.name: Altef

texts.en: Altef is a 47-year-old woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along with  husband and one child. Her husband is running a small shop located at the corner of his street. Altef has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. As the summer season has arrived, Altef wants to fulfill the demands of customers that her husband keep some cold drinks in his shop. Her husband would purchase cold drinks with the loan. This would increase his sales and income.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks.

loans.name: Dúo El Resplandor De San Lorenzo Group

texts.es: Dúo El Resplandor de San Lorenzo está formado por el señor Luis Francisco de 27 años de edad quien tiene 3 hijos menor de edad, el se dedica a la elaboración  de lapidas para los que mueren y lo elabora en mármol y lo distribuye a sus clientes, el solicita su crédito para comprar más material y elaborar mas lapidas ya que él tiene una gran demanda y no puede satisfacer a sus clientes su meta es poder lograr ampliar mas su negocio y poder tener un local ya que es el único que contribuye con los gastos del hogar y poder darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Luis Francisco, 27, is a member of the “Resplandor de San Lorenzo” (San Lorenzo’s Splendor) Duo.  He has three minor children and he works making tombstones for deceased people; he makes them out of marble and sells them to his customers.  He’s requesting his loan to buy more materials to make more tombstones since demand is high and he can’t satisfy his customers.  His goal is to be able to expand the business more and to have a locale since he’s the only one that covers household expenses and to be able to give his children a better education.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make tombstones.

loans.name: Adorada

texts.en:
Adorada is 55 years old, married and blessed with nine children. She and her husband are engaged in the farming business, specifically planting and harvesting corn to sell. She also raises hogs to sell as an additional source of income. In the farming business, they usually earn about PHP 20,000 each harvest season. Due to their big family, their income is just enough to sustain their daily needs.  

She wants her business to improve and for that to become a reality, she is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizer and insecticides for farming.

Managing a business is not that easy, but Adorada believes that someday she will enjoy the fruits of her sacrifices and provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Mouhammad

texts.en: Mouhammad is a married Iraqi client; he is 43 years old and has five children. Mouhammad works hard to provide for his family with the profit he earns from his garage, where he specializes in fixing damaged car body parts. He has been in this field since 1994 and has gained excellent experience. Mouhammad has a good reputation in the neighborhood and has five employees. He is requesting a loan of US$3,000 to buy a specialized piece of equipment for his work. Mouhammad believes that this loan will improve the quality of his work and will increase his profits. With his increased profits, Mouhammad will be able to educate his children and give them a bright future.

loans.use: to buy a specialized piece of equipment to repair cars.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, age 44, owns a general store. He established his business in 2009 and has gained good experience in this field. When Ahmad decided to take this career path, he opened his shop in a strategic trading area in the market, which offered his business strong visibility. He soon developed an excellent reputation. 
 
Ahmad works very hard to provide for his wife and their two children.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000 USD, which he will use to pay the annual rent for his general store. 

Ahmad aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may continue to provide an education for his children. His goal is to give them the highest educational degree he can afford to offer them.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his general store

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 51 years old and married. She has three children, and she lives in Silanga, Tangub City. To earn a living, she owns and operates a piggery, rasing piglets for sale. She has been doing this for more than five years, earning 7,000 PHP a month.

She borrowed a loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. She will use the loan to buy piglets, which she will raise and will resell after a few months. She plans to renovate her livestock shelter, enlarging it to be used for a business expansion.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and resell

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Don Carlos tiene un proyecto ya avanzado , ya que ha adquirido un local para poner a funcionar una soda, tiene parte del equipo pero aún le falta algunos artefactos que comprar, su deseo es comenzar a trabajar en este mes , necesita un millón de colones (¢1.000.000) para adquirir el equipo que le falta, Nos comenta que con este financiamiento logrará mejorar su condición económica y por ende la calidad de vida de su familia y la suya propia.
texts.en: Carlos has an investment project that is already in an advanced stage.  He has acquired a shop that he wants to make into a soda fountain.  He has part of the equipment he needs, but he still lacks some appliances that he must purchase.  He wants to open this business this month.  He needs one million Costa Rican colones to purchase the equipment he needs.  He tells us that with this loan, he will be able to improve his economic situation, and as a result improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy equipment for his soda fountain

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is from Iraq. He is 65 years old, married, and has no children.
Mahdi owns a small grocery store where he sells dairy products, canned food, shampoos, and detergents. He established his business in 2007 and has gained good experience in this field. Mahdi earned a good reputation in the neighborhood and has gained the respect of his neighbors.
Mahdi is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to renovate his grocery store by installing new shelves on the walls. He will also use the loan to increase his sakes inventory. Mahdi is aiming to improve his business and increase his profits so that he may provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his grocery store by installing new shelves on the walls and to increase his sales inventory.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma, age 35, earns an income by buying and selling household wares such as blankets, mats, and kitchen utensils. She and her husband have seven children between the ages of six and 16 years old. The family lives in Talibon, Bohol.

Emma has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 in order to buy additional items to sell, such as chopping dishes, floor mats, and similar household wares. 

In the future, Emma would like to invest in another business to augment her income and eventually to be able to start up a sari-sari (variety) store. Her goal is to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional items to offer for sale, such as chopping dishes, floor mats, and similar household wares

loans.name: Surriya

texts.en: Surriya is a 59-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her spouse and three sons and two daughters. Since 2009, her husband has been running a small vegetable shop. Surriya has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for the expansion of her husband's shop. With the loan investment, her husband can buy a variety of fresh vegetables that will allow him to offer more variety to his clients and increase his sales and income. Her husband is a very hardworking and honest man and is confident about his family’s bright future.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables.

loans.name: Al-Srihy Group

texts.en:
This group of four hard-working women is called Al-Srihy. The members live in Sana'a, Yemen. They have applied for a loan in the amount of 150,000 YER from AMB.  
 
Ghalia is a 43-year-old married woman living in a poor area in Sana'a. She exhibits good moral values and is concerned for the well-being of her family, which is now living in a partially-finished house that needs essential construction work to be completed. She has therefore requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 YER from AMB, which she will use to buy construction materials like wood in order to finish building her house. 

She states that she feels happy and grateful to Kiva lenders for the support that she is being provided, because this way she will be able to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like wood in order to finish building the family house

loans.name: Tsira

texts.en:
Fifty-one-year-old Tsira lives in the Rustavi district with her 56-year-old husband. Tsira has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for her family business start-up, but she hasn't had any success. Her loan request was rejected every time because of her low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 
Tsira sells jewelry. She buys the products at the wholesale prices and re-sells them among her neighbors with the price marked up to earn a small monthly income. Her husband works for a small salary at the local factory. 
Tsira requested loan from Credo to start her family business. Tsira has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit, Tsira will start re-selling perfume. She will buy from the big market at the wholesale price and re-sell it with the jewelry among the neighbors with the price marked up. Tsira is already well known among the locals, and people like her products. She will have good success starting the perfume business too and will earn a good profit. She will re-invest part of the profit in her business to purchase more products and offer better choices to her clients. Tsira will use part of the profit for her family to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to start selling perfume.

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
Renalyn is 44 years old, married and has two school-age children. She and her husband aim to improve their livelihood in order to provide the daily needs of their family and support the education of their children.  

To earn a living, Renalyn is engaged in the charcoal business in the village. To grow her business, she borrowed a loan of PHP 5,000  to buy more charcoal to sell. She believes that the loan will enable her to improve the business and hopes that, someday, she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is a diligent woman. She is 43 years old, married, and has five children. She is engaged in selling different commodities in the community as her way of helping her husband.  

She aims to improve her business and make it profitable in order to help her husband finance the education of their children. Due to inadequate capital, she is requesting for a loan of PHP 8,000  to buy more stocks of cosmetics, food supplements, AVON products, and other accessories to sell. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted for her business and family.

loans.use: to buy different commodities for her retail business.

loans.name: Flor De Manzana Group

texts.es:
El señor Roberto es de estado civil casado, tiene 47 años de edad, no asisitio a la escuela ya que desde pequeño tuvo que trabajar, tiene 4 hijos y 2 de ellos estan estudiando, él se dedica a la seimbra de café, inició este negocio porque le comentaron que la siembra de café generaba atractiva ganancia y decidió comprar unas plantitas; hasta el momento lleva 8 años de dichosa experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de fertilizante para su plantación de café, ahora desea comprar más terreno para que en el futuro cultive mucho más de lo que cultiva ahora; los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a agricultura sembrando maíz, café, frijol y frutas.
texts.en:
Roberto, 47, is married.  He did not attend school because he's had to work since he was little.  He has four children and two of them are attending school.  He works growing coffee.  He started the business because he was told that coffee generates attractive profits so he decided to buy a few little plants and to date has been in this successful experience for 8 years.

He organized a group to request a loan that will be used to buy fertilizer for his coffee crop.  He wants to buy more land so that in future he can grow much more than he does now.  The other group members work in agriculture growing corn, coffee, beans and fruit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the coffee crop.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is 46 years old, married, and has three children. The couple has a retail store and a farming business. In the farming business, Danilo usually gains about PHP 20,000 per harvest season, which is twice a year. He budgets his income to provide a good education for his children and as rolling capital in their businesses.  

Danilo wants to keep developing his farming business in order to gain more profits, but he had insufficient capital. To pursue his plans for his business, he is borrowing a loan of PHP 50,000 which will be used to buy farm inputs for his crops, such as fertilizer, insecticides, and pesticides.  

Someday, Danilo hopes to become a successful rice grower and to have a good life with his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides, and pesticides for use in farming.

loans.name: Asociacion Barbarense Group

texts.es:
El señor Domingo es de estado civil casado, tiene 57 años de edad, curo la primaria completa, tiene 3 hijos y ellos no estudian, el es agricultor se dedica a la siembra y cosecha de café, inició este negocio con un pequeño capital que tenia ahorrado y con eso compro sus plantitas de café y hasta la fecha lleva 10 lindos años de experiencia.

Él dedice organizar un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de fertilizante para abonar sus cosechas, ya que en el futuro desea comprar mas terreno para poder plantar más café; los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a actividades agrícolas.
texts.en:
Domingo, 57, is married; he completed primary school.   He has three children that do not attend school.  He’s a farmer who plants and harvests coffee.  He started this business with a little capital he’d saved and used to buy his little coffee plants.   To date, he has 10 beautiful years’ experience.

He organized a group to request a loan he’ll use to buy fertilizer to fertilize his crops because in future he wants to buy more land to be able to plant more coffee.  The other group members work in agricultural activities.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the coffee crop.

loans.name: Anwar's Group

texts.en:
Anwar, age 27, is the dedicated and responsible mother of five children. She lives with her husband and children in Lahore, Pakistan, and is a member of the three-person lending group pictured here.

Anwar's husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For some time now, his rickshaw has not been in working condition, and therefore he is presently unable to generate any amount of income with which to support the family. He wants to repair the vehicle as soon as possible but, due to lack of finances, he is unable to cover the costs of the necessary repairs. 

For this reason, Anwar has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business operations and support the family. 

Anwar is deeply thankful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to cover the cost of essential rickshaw repairs

loans.name: Jartu

texts.en:
Jartu is 29 year old and lives and works in Buchanan, located by the sea and the capital city of Grand Bassa County. It is well-known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia.

Jartu lives with her husband and five children, who range in age from one to ten; only three of them are in school. Jartu, who has been selling red oil, charcoal, fufu, etc. for the past two years in the local market, is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil, charcoal, fufu, etc. for resale. She likes her business because it helps to support her home. She hopes to one day own a house.

Jartu wants to thank Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil, charcoal, fufu, etc. for her business

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
Rashida is a 58-year-old responsible mother of 3 children. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and children. Her husband is a janitor in a hospital but his salary is not enough to meet the household expenses. He wants to start his own work. 
Rashida has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. Her husband would purchase a rickshaw with the loan and he would drive the rickshaw at night along with his present job. In this way, his monthly income would be increased 
Rashida is very hopeful for this loan and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a rickshaw.

loans.name: Sakhib

texts.en:
Sakhib is 54 years old. He lives in Marneuli district, with his 48-year-old wife and 27-year-old son. Sakhib requested loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

Sakhib has a car, and he drives it as a taxi, transporting local people. His wife is a tailor, working on private orders. They both earn small monthly salaries, which is rarely enough to cover their food expenses.
 
Sakhib requested a loan from Credo to start-up family business. Sakhib has now been approved for a loan, within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits, with soft conditions, to rural poor people who do not have access to other credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With his credit Sakhib will start a business, trading in shoes. He will buy them at the wholesale price from the market, and resell among the people of his village with a price mark-up. Sakhib will earn a good profit and will be able to ensure a better life for his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up Loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To start a business, trading in shoes

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Mónica, de 41 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y muy alegre. Vive junto a su esposo Luís y su hijo de 03 años de edad en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Mónica es la venta de pescado, para esto cuenta con un pequeño puesto en el mercado de su ciudad, se levanta muy de temprano y se dirige al puerto de pescadores, donde compra  su producto y lo lleva a su puesto de venta. Lleva más de 06 años trabajando de esta manera y considera que su negocio es bastante rentable  ya que cuenta con buena clientela que. Lo que le gusta  de  su actividad es que  le permite tener un ingreso económico que le permite apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar. Este será su tercer crédito con kiva y se siente contenta por el apoyo financiero recibido para seguir adelante razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 300 nuevos soles comprará pescado al por mayor buscando para así tener mejores ganacias.
texts.en:
Mónica, 41, is a hardworking, very cheerful woman.  She lives with her husband, Luís, and her three-year-old son in her own house.  The activity Mónica carries out is selling fish.  To do so she has a small stand in her city’s market.  She rises very early and heads to the fishing port to buy fish and then take it to her sales stand.  She’s been working this way for more than six years and considers her business to be quite profitable because she has a good regular clientele.  What she likes about her activity is that it allows her to earn income she can use to help her husband with household expenses.

This will be her third Kiva loan and she’s happy with the financial support received to continue forward and the reason why she commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the requested 300 new soles to buy fish at wholesale seeking thus to earn better profits.

loans.use: to buy fish at wholesale.

loans.name: Fanta Mahine

texts.fr:
Fanta Mahine  est née en  Novembre 1979 à Bamako. Elle est célibataire et résidant chez son grand frère dans une  famille traditionnelle à Wayerma I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Fanta Mahine  mène il y a environ cinq  ans des activités d’achat et de vente des pagnes wax, draps, tissus brodés, etc. Elle mène son activité à son domicile et de façon ambulante dans la ville de Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant cinq ans. Après  plusieurs prêt solidaires dans une association des femmes de sa localité, elle est à son  cinquième prêt individuel avec lequel elle est compte acheter 25 pièces de pagne wax, 10 complets de tissus brodés et 20 paires de draps. Elle achète ses marchandises sur place et à Bobo Dioulasso (au Burkina Faso) avant de les revendre en détail de façon ambulante au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Fanta Mahine was born in November 1979 in Bamako. She is single, and lives with her older brother as part of a traditional family in Wayerma I, a popular neighborhood in the town of Sikasso (located in the third-largest administrative region of Mali). For about five years she has worked buying and selling high-grade pagnes [traditional wraparound cloth], sheets, embroidered fabrics, and similar items. She works from home and on the streets of Sikasso, where she is in great demand among her customers due to the quality of her products. 
 
To meet the needs of her ever-growing customer base, Fanta Mahine decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution five years ago. After several group loans as part of a local women's association, she is now on her fifth individual loan. She plans to use the loan to buy 25 lengths of pagne, 10 sets of embroidered fabric and 20 pairs of sheets. Fanta Mahine buys her merchandise locally and in Bobo Dioulasso (in Burkina Faso), before reselling her products on the street on a cash and credit basis. Her customers are mainly female. She has repaid her prior loans without incident.
 
With this loan Fanta Mahine hopes to make a monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA, which she will use to increase her working capital, contribute to covering the family expenses, and pay the interest on her loan.

loans.use: to buy high-grade pagnes [traditional cloth], sheets and embroidered fabrics

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 37 años, es casada, y vive en su casa propia acompañada de su esposo y sus hijos. Isabel es una mujer muy trabajadora y ahora se dedica a la venta de comidas en el local comunal del pueblo. Gracias al apoyo de su familia pudo abrir su local y tener un trabajo estable que le ayuda a mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia. Como una mujer emprendedora Isabel espera sacar adelante su pequeño negocio y hacerlo crecer de tal manera que pueda abastecer a sus clientes ofreciéndoles buenos platos de comida. Esta es su primer crédito con Kiva, y está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que se le presenta para obtener una línea de financiamiento el cual le será muy útil para su desempeño laboral. El monto de S/.1500 soles lo invertirá en la compra de carne y de los insumos para la preparación de las comidas.
texts.en:
Isabel, 37, is married living in her own house with her husband and children.  Isabel is a very hardworking woman who sells food now in her town’s communal space.  Thanks to family support she was able to open her locale and have stable work that helps her improve her entire family’s quality of life.

Like all enterprising women, Isabel hopes to move her small business forward and make it grow so it can meet customer needs by offering them good dishes of food.

This is her first Kiva loan and she’s very grateful for the opportunity that’s presented to have a line of credit which will be very useful for her work.  She will use the 1,500 soles to buy meat and other ingredients to prepare the dishes.

loans.use: to buy meat and other ingredients.

loans.name: Sigibekolasa Group

texts.fr:
SIGIBEKOLASA est un regroupement de 7 hommes mariés ayant en moyenne 33  ans, 4 enfants et vivant  dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Farala, un des villages de la commune urbaine de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Ils sont à leur quatrième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Ce groupe d’homme fait la culture de maïs depuis près de dix ans.
SOLOMANE,la deuxième personne debout  de la gauche vers la droite. Il  compte acheter avec son  prêt,  5 sacs d’urée,deux sacs de complexe céréale et 4 bidons d’herbicides. Elle s’approvisionne dans la ville de Bougouni  auprès des grossistes. 
A la récolte, il compte obtenir 6 tonnes maïs dont une partie 2 tonnes sera destinée à la consommation familiale et 4 tonnes sera vendue pour rembourser le prêt et soutenir les frais de scolarités des enfants.
texts.en:
Sigibekolasa is a group with seven members, all married men. They have an average age of 33, an average of four children each, and live in traditional families in Farala, a village in the urban area of Bougouni (Mali's third-largest administrative region). This is the fourth time that they have collaborated with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This group of men has worked growing corn for almost 10 years. 

Solomane is a member of the group, and is the second person standing from left to right in the photo. With his loan he plans to buy five sacks of urea, two sacks of complex fertilizer and four drums of herbicide. Solomane buys his supplies from wholesalers in the town of Bougouni. He gets six tons of corn from his harvest, two of which are for his family to eat, while the remaining four tons will be sold to repay his loan and support his children's education expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 29 years old from Ramallah.
He is married and has two children.
He has run a mechanic shop since 2008 which he rents, and he has two employees.
He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy goods, paint the shop and buy a machine for holding cars for his rented mechanic shop.
He hopes that this loan will help him increase his customer volume and thus improve his income and help him approach his dream of owning the shop and enlarging it.

loans.use: to buy goods, paint the shop, and buy a machine for holding cars for his rented mechanic shop.

loans.name: Nieleniton  I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe NIELENITON  I sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kolombada un des villages de la commune de Guégnaka,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide, du mil et du haricot. Elles sont à leur huitième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt,   MARAMOU  la première personne à gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 ha de mil et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice de 75 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Nieleniton I group are all married women with an average age of 39. They have an average of four children each. The majority of the group's members live in polygamous families in Kolombada, a village in the Guégnaka area. This area is located in the Dioïla prefecture in the Koulikoro region, the second-largest administrative region in Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so that they can better organize their businesses at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown by this group's members include peanuts, millet and beans. They are on their eighth loan with this institution. 
 
Maramou is a member of the group, and is the first person seated on the left in the photo. With her loan she plans to buy inputs and small pieces of equipment, as well as to pay the labor expenses involved in farming approximately one hectare of millet and peanuts. After harvest her produce is sold in the town of Fana, and her customers are both male and female. Each season Maramou hopes to make a profit of around 75,000 francs CFA.

loans.use: to pay for labor expenses and hoeing, and to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and small pieces of equipment.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the farming business for more than 12 years now. This is the source of her income.
Belinda is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides. With this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest. In the future, Belinda dreams of making her farm a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
Amada is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. Amada is a married woman and a mother of five children. She has been in the farming business with her husband for more than 10 years now. This is the source of their income. 
Amada is asking for a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer. With this, she will be able to grow healthy crops, thus augmenting her harvest and yield. In the future, Amada dreams of making her business a success and saving money for the schooling of her children. She also hopes this will help her to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and fertilizer

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert raises goats and sells their meat to earn an income. He supports his wife and their eight children, all of whom are enrolled in school. The family lives in a house that has piped water but no electricity. His greatest monthly expense is his children's school fees.

Robert has operated his business for the past six years, selling his products from his home to local customers. He faces the challenge of stiff competition in his business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his enterprise. With the Kshs 30,000 loan funds he has requested, Robert intends to purchase six goats.

loans.use: to purchase six goats

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James sells charcoal to earn an income. He supports his wife and their four children, all of whom attend school. The family lives in a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

James sells his charcoal from his home to his neighbors and to passers-by. His major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. With the loan he is requesting, he intends to purchase bags of charcoal to offer for sale.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal to offer for sale

loans.name: Luis Arturo

texts.es:
Luis de 60 años de edad es un microempresario, dedicado a la venta de productos de la canasta familiar. Con más de 20 años de experiencia en el sector,  don Luis es reconocido como un hombre generoso y honesto, valores que lo han hecho crecer dentro del sector. Gracias a su negocio ha podido brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Hoy sueña ampliar su negocio y obtener mejores ingresos, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de surtido. 
Desea poder ver a su familia unida y sin carencias de tipo económico.
texts.en:
Luis, 60 years old, is a microentrepreneurer. He makes a living selling household goods. With more than 20 years of experience in this business, Don Luis is recognized as a generous and honest man, values that have made him thrive in his area. Thanks to his business he has been able to provide a better quality of life for his family. 

Today he hopes to enlarge his business and make a better income, and is therefore requesting a loan to purchase a variety of items. He would like to see his family together and without economic concerns.

loans.use: to purchase household goods

loans.name: Zainb Group

texts.en: Zainb is a group that consists of five ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They are women who work hard in order to increase their income. Zainb is a 46-year-old married woman who lives with her seven children in poor conditions in Sana`a, Yemen. She is a housewife who intends to buy construction supplies to use for her house. She said the amount she had is not enough to buy what she needs. Therefore, she requested for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies for her house. She hopes to improve her living standards and to buy home appliances.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.name: Ishrat's Group

texts.en: Ishrat is a 33-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. She is a mother of 5 children and a responsible and hardworking housewife. Her husband owns a furniture shop in the market. This shop is the base of earning for his family. He works very hard to meet the household expenses but due to the insufficient income he is having problems meeting the needs of his family. Ishrat, as a member of a three-person borrower group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Ishrat's husband will purchase a variety of furniture to sell. By doing so he will increase his net income and savings for the future. Ishrat is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her husband's business. She wants to purchase a computer for her children with the profit. She wishes to provide computer education to her children in the future. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. She is raising her hand in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase furniture.

loans.name: Lily Group

texts.en:
"Shoot for the stars, and if you miss, at least you will end among the stars." "I am following this saying," giggled Nengjadim. She is one of the members with “Lily” Group. She is pictured with her hand raised, and she is the featured borrower member for the group. She is hardworking and determined in whatever she does. Both she and her husband earn for the family, and her husband is a daily wage-earner. 

The group members were all inspired through the teamwork and collaboration shown through "Nisopah Group". They are active members with WSDS, and the secretary of the group conveyed the benefits of the formation of Self-Help groups to "Lily Group". 

Nengjadim raises livestock like cows, sheep and buffaloes.  She generates income after selling the milk that the cow produces and also makes money by offering the buffaloes for farming purposes on a hiring basis during the ploughing seasons. She makes good money because modern farming machines are unaffordable for the village cultivators. She also raises sheep and sells them when they are fully grown. 

She makes a good income, but it is completely unreliable. The source of income for Nengjadim and her husband entirely depends on seasons because during off-seasons the income is tight. Managing the household expenses and running the family without a regular income is complicated for Nengjadim. Her main trade is selling sheep in the neighbouring villages. Buyers come to her house to purchase the sheep and she also takes them to the local market and sells them at a good price.

With the Kiva loan, she will construct a better and spacious barn for the sheep. She is raising more than twenty sheep at present.  She is glad that Kiva is supporting her for the barn construction, and she plans to own a minivan within ten years. The minivan will be used as a public transport between the village and the capital city. 

She will open a savings account and start saving to make her plans come true. She says even if she and her husband fail to purchase the minivan within ten years, she will purchase an auto rickshaw instead. She dreams high and believes in herself that she will fulfill it.

The rest of the group members are also engaged in poultry, piggery, weaving, and ginger-farming.

loans.use: to construct a larger barn for the sheep that she is raising.

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida, age 45 and a housewife, is a member of the four-person lending group shown here. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard to provide his wife and children with a good and respectable life. He owns a clothing business, which serves as the only source of income for the family. 

Zubaida has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase a variety of clothes to resell at a profitable price. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. 

Zubaida is confident that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothes to offer for resale at a profitable price

loans.name: Gulgaaky

texts.ru:
Гулгаакы 38 лет, имеет 3 детей. Гулгаакы в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и продажей молока, начав его 10 лет назад с покупки 2 телят и развив до количества в 15 голов мелкого рогатого скота, 1 коровы с приплодом, 0,40 га поливной земли  с фасолью и свеклой. А также, будучи активным человеком, Гулгаакы основала свой бизнес по пошиву национальных изделий и реставрации одежды, в котором ей помогает муж, обеспечивая сбыт изделий.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулгаакы обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку 2 бычков.  Доходы от кредита Гулгаакы вложит в приумножение поголовья скота, чтобы оплатить образование сына.
texts.en:
Gulgaaky is 38 years old, and has three children. As a source of income for her family, Gulgaaky works with livestock breeding and sale of milk, after having started this business 10 years ago with the purchase of two calves. She has developed this to 15 sheep and goats, one cow with offspring and 0.40 hectares of irrigated land with beans and beets. Further, being an active person, Gulgaaky founded a business of sewing national clothing and repairing clothes. Her husband helps her with marketing the products. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Gulgaaky turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of two bulls. Gulgaaky plans to invest the income from the loan in increasing the number of livestock, in order to pay for her son's education.

loans.use: to purchase bull-calves

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: A loan of 25,000 PKR would help Rukhsana to get a new sewing machine for her daughter, so that she could help Rukhsana in her work. Rukhsana has been doing this tailoring work for eight years, and she has developed excellent tailoring skills. With the help of her daughter, she would be able to stitch more dresses, resulting in an increase in her monthly income.

loans.use: to purchase an additional sewing machine, so her daughter can help her to make more dresses

loans.name: Unidas Podemos Group

texts.es:
Unidas Podemos esta trabajando y creciendo, sus integrantes son mujeres jefas de familia, que por medio de las capacitaciones y la ayuda de la fundacion quieren salir adelante. La Sra. Rosa es parte de este grupo, y se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene un pequeño Kiosko.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha por su familia, por darles y cubrir todas sus necesidades. Esta haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para ir creciendo y mejorando en su trabajo. Se esfuerza por mejorar y obtener mejores ingresos.
Solicita este crédito para la compra de bebidas, golosinas, galletitas, jugos y demás, para poder surtir su kiosko y dar a sus clientes todo lo que ellos piden.
texts.en:
Unidas Podemos [United We Can] is working and growing. Its members are female heads of household that, through the training and support of the foundation, want to get ahead. 

Señora Rosa is part of this group, and she makes a living in sales now that she has a small kiosk. She is a hard working person who fights for her family, to give and provide for all of their needs. She is completing the poverty elimination survey to continue growing and improve in her work. She strives to improve and make a better income.

She asks this loan for the purchase of drinks, candies, cookies, juices and more, to be able to supply her kiosk and give her customers all that they ask.

loans.use: to buy drinks, candies, cookies, juices, and more.

loans.name: Nieleniton Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe NIELENITON II sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les familles polygames à Kolombada un des villages de la commune de Guégnaka,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres  l’arachide, du mil et du haricot. Elles sont à leur huitième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt,   BALA MINATA la première personne à gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 ha de mil et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle réalise un bénéfice  de 85 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Nieleniton II group are all married women with an average age of 34. They have an average of three children each. The majority of the group's members live in polygamous families in Kolombada, a village in the Guégnaka area. This area is located in the Dioïla prefecture in the Koulikoro region, the second-largest administrative region in Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so that they can better organize their businesses at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown by this group's members include peanuts, millet and beans. They are on their eighth loan with this institution. 
 
Bala Minata is a member of the group, and is the first person seated on the left in the photo. With her loan she plans to buy inputs and small pieces of equipment, as well as to pay the labor expenses involved in farming approximately one hectare of millet and peanuts. After harvest her produce is sold in the town of Fana, and her customers are both male and female. Each season she hopes to make a profit of around 85,000 francs CFA.

loans.use: to pay for labor expenses and hoeing, and to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and small pieces of equipment.

loans.name: Akram

texts.en: Akram is a 30-year-old man from Jenin. He owns a shop in which he sells accessories, cosmetics, and perfumes. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to change the decorations in his shop and buy more goods to display. Akram hopes that this loan will help him to increase his sales and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to change the decorations in his shop and buy more goods to display.

loans.name: Nieleniton  Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe  NIELENITON  III sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kolombada un des villages de la commune de Guégnaka,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités  tés en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres  l’arachide, du mil et du haricot. Elles sont à leur huitième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt,  Nielen la première personne à gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 ha de mil et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 75 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Nieleniton III group are all married women with an average age of 35. They have an average of four children each. The majority of the group's members live in polygamous families in Kolombada, a village in the Guégnaka area. This area is located in the Dioïla prefecture in the Koulikoro region, the second-largest administrative region in Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so that they can better organize their businesses at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown by this group's members include peanuts, millet and beans. They are on their eighth loan with this institution. 
 
Nielen is a member of the group, and is the first person seated on the left in the photo. With her loan she plans to buy inputs and small pieces of equipment, as well as to pay the labor expenses involved in farming approximately one hectare of millet and peanuts. After harvest her produce is sold in the town of Fana, and her customers are both male and female. Each season she hopes to make a profit of around 75,000 francs CFA.

loans.use: to pay for labor expenses and hoeing, and to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and small pieces of equipment.

loans.name: Oscar Enrique

texts.es:
Oscar, de 35 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Boaco, es padre d e4 hijos, es de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de granos básicos, lleva 2 años con este negocio. El inicio comprando 2 quintales de frijoles para vender el salía a las carreteras en las afueras de la ciudad para ofrecer su producto a todos los que pasaban, también se movía en otras comunidades siempre en busca de clientes para distribuir su producto. Las ganancias obtenidas las ahorraba para compras más granos como maíz y trigo para ofrecer variedad. 
Actualmente está solicitando el crédito para comprar granos básicos como maíz, frijoles y maíz al por mayor. Pues desea expandir sus rutas de ventas y necesita producto para ofrecer. 

Dentro de sus planes futuros desea tener su propio local para vender granos básicos al por mayor y una camioneta para transportarse junto con sus productos fuera de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Oscar, 35, lives in the city of Boaco; he’s the father of four children. He’s a merchant selling basic grains and has been in business two years.  He started out buying two quintals of beans and to sell them he’d head out to the highways in the city’s outskirts to sell to everyone who passed by.   He’d also go to other communities seeking customers to sell his products to.  Profits earned he’d save to buy more grain like corn and wheat to offer variety.  

He’s currently asking for a loan to buy basic grains like corn and beans at wholesale because he wants to expand his sales routes and needs product to sell.  Among his future plans is the wish to have his own locale to sell basic grains at wholesale and a pick-up truck to transport himself and his products outside the city.

loans.use: to buy basic grains like corn and beans.

loans.name: Akylai

texts.ru:
Акылай 44 года, имеет 5 детей. Акылай в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и выращиванием сельхозкультур, стартовав в 1997 году с суммы в (KGS) 10,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Акылай в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 коровы с приплодом, 1,20 га поливной земли  с фасолью и свеклой.  Также, Акылай в течении последних лет занимается выращиванием клубники, приносящий хороший доход в сезон.
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Акылай обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS)  на приобретение удобрений.  Доходы от кредита Акылай намерена вложить в расширение сарая для скота.
texts.en:
Akylai is 44 years old and has five children. As a source of income for her family, Akylai works with livestock breeding and growing agricultural crops, after having started this business in 1997 with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to persistent work, Akylai's farm currently consists of two cows with offspring and 1.20 hectares of irrigated land with beans and beets. Further, over the past years, Akylai has been growing strawberries, which is bringing in a good income during its season. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Akylai turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan in the amount of 25,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of fertilizers. Akylai plans to invest the income from the loan in expanding the cattle barn.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Al-Kfah Group

texts.en: Al-Kfah is a group of four women from Sana`a, Yemen. They have applied for a loan of 150,000 YER to buy construction supplies. Amah is 46 years old, uneducated, and married with six children. She has a small house that she intends to expand. She did her best to accumulate money to start construction. She needs money to buy construction supplies, so she has asked for a loan of 40,000 YER. She hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.name: Apollo

texts.en: Apollo, a resident of Rutunguru, Ntungamo District, is married to Scovia Busingye and they have 2 children. Apollo buys matooke (green bananas) from local farmers and sells them at a nearby town for profit. He has applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 to expand his business and provide for his extended family. He wants to buy a motorcycle with the next loan which will bring him more income to adequately meet the needs of his family. He is hardworking and is grateful to the Kiva lenders for lending to his businesses through Ugafode Micro Finance, Ltd. This picture shows Apollo, his guarantor, and the Ugafode credit officer (right to left).

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Surik

texts.en:
Surik and his family live in the small city of Vedi. Surik graduated from Artashat Pedagogical University in the Department of Law, but unfortunately he has never worked in his specialty. Together with his parents, he became engaged in farming (a cow, ten chickens and two pigs) and agriculture. Surik is married and lives with his wife, son and retired parents. 

They have a large plot of private land and a lot of sweat and colorful apple trees. They gather the harvest and sell it in Vedi, and they also bring it to the Yerevan wholesale market and sell it to re-sellers. 

Surik requests a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams to organize autumn cultivating work around their fruit garden and buy fertilizer for the land. Surik thanks Kiva lenders beforehand and hopes for future cooperation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the land and to organize autumn cultivating work around the fruit garden.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for her daughter

loans.name: Santos J Group

texts.es:
El señor Santiago es de estado civil casado, de edad 41 años, curso 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 7 hijos y de ellos 5 están estudiando, él se dedica a cultivar la tierra, siembra ejote, inició este trabajo porque es la actividad principal de su familia y hasta hoy lleva ya 25 años de larga experiencia, también cuenta con todo el apoyo de su señora esposa.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo va utilizar para la compra de insumos para la siembra de ejote, en el futuro cercano desea incrementar su capital de trabajo y asi poder obtener más cosechas para poder satisfacer la demanda que tiene y poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos; los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la siembra de ejote.
texts.en:
Santiago, 41, es married.  He completed three years of primary school.  He has seven children five of which attend school.  He works tilling the soil growing green beans.  He started this work because it’s his family’s main activity.  To date he has 25 years’ experienced; his wife helps him.

He organizes a group and requests a loan to buy supplies for his green bean crop.  In the near future he’d like to increase his working capital to get more crops to meet current demand and to be able to improve his income.  The other group members work growing green beans.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard, age 58, earns an income from engaging in a combination of animal agriculture and farming. She owns a plot of land where she keeps her farm animals - specifically four cows, two bulls, two heifers, 10 sheep, and five lambs. She earns a small additional income by working as a cook at the kindergarten in Tsovagyugh, the local village. 

Like many other families in their village, Alvard’s husband is earning a small income abroad as a worker in the Russian Federation. By supplementing the farm income with his earnings, he tries to improve the family’s poor living conditions. One of their sons helps Alvard with the farming; he also manages to earn a little extra money by working during holiday seasons in the coastal area of beautiful lake Sevan.
 
Alvard is confident that she can manage any hard work, especially if there is the possibility of additional support and help. She has made the decision to request a loan from Kiva lenders in the amount of 600,000 Armenian drams in order to buy two cows and some sheep.
