This will be Alvard's second loan from Nor Horizon and she is considered a very responsible and trustworthy client.

loans.use: To buy two cows and some sheep

loans.name: Zona 3 Kiche Group

texts.es:
Las Señora Elizabeth de estado civil casada, tiene 44 años de edad, curso 5 años de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos y 2 de ellos estan estudiando, ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos por catálogo, inició este negocio con su madre vendiendo siempre productos por catálogo y a la fecha lleva 8 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para ampliar su negocio comprando mas productos para poder venderlos, en el futuro desea tener un local vendiendo productos de belleza; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la venta de frutas y verduras, tortillas y venta de productos por catalogo.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 44 years old and married. She had five years of primary school. She has three children, two of whom are studying. For a living, she sells cosmetics from a catalogue. She began the business with her mother, always selling products via catalogue and now she now has eight years of experience. 

She organized this group and is asking for a loan in order to expand her business by buying more products to sell. In the future, she wants to have a store where she can sell beauty products. The rest of the members of the group make their living selling fruits, vegetables, tortillas, and catalogue products.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a rice farmer. She lives in Amulung with her husband and children. Lina and her husband work together to farm and harvest rice crops. 

Lina hopes to increase her crop production for greater profit, allowing her to build up savings for the family's future use. To pursue her business plans, she is now asking for a loan in the amount of PhP 25,000. She will use her loan funds to pay labor fees as well as to buy fertilizers and insecticides for their farm.  

Her goal is someday to provide her family with a more comfortable standard of living.

loans.use: to pay labor fees as well as to purchase fertilizers and insecticides for the family rice farm

loans.name: Celsa

texts.es:
Celsa es una mujer joven de 29 años de edad y madre de 3 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian en primaria en diferentes grados de educación y un menor. Ella tiene un grado de educación primario cursado hasta el 5 grado y agradece a sus padres por el apoyo para que ella pudiese estudiar. Junto a su pareja trabaja la agricultura hace más de 9 años y a prendieron a trabajar gracias a sus familias que fueron quienes les inculcaron a realizar esta actividad desde muy jóvenes. Ellos se especializan en la siembra y cultivo de café y también son comerciantes de la venta de plátano y banano. La tierra que trabajan es propia gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres lo cual ha permitido que ellos obtuviesen ingresos por parte de la agricultura y no solo del comercio. 

Celsa solicita ayuda para la compra de insumos como fertilizantes, abono, fungicidas y otros que mantienen sus cultivos sanos y alejados de plagas que deterioren el mismo.

Como madre de familia sus planes son los de seguir trabajando fuerte para que sus hijos no se queden sin estudiar y se conviertan en profesionales. Como esposa seguir apoyando a su pareja para que juntos sigan formando un patrimonio para sus hijos, para que el día de mañana sepa que tienen un respaldo para poder enfrentar los problemas económicos entre otros.
texts.en:
Celsa, 29, is the mother of three children two of which attend different grades in primary school; one is younger.  She completed fifth grade of primary education and thanks her parents for the support they gave her so she could go to school.  She and her spouse have worked in agriculture for more than nine years since they learned to work thanks to their families who taught them how to work in this activity while they were still very young.  They specialize in growing coffee but also sell bananas and plantain.  The land they work is their own thanks to an inheritance from their parents that have allowed them to earn income by means of agriculture and not just through commerce.

Celsa is asking for help to buy supplies like fertilizer, manure, fungicide and others that help keep the crops healthy and safe from infestations that weaken them over time.

Like a mother, her plans are to continue working hard so that her children won’t be without schooling and can become professionals.  As a wife, to continue to support her spouse so that together they can continue building an estate for their children so that in future they’ll know that they have backup to face economic problems among others.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: Safina is a 28-year-old, hardworking, married woman who lives in a remote area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and 3 sons. For the past 4 years she and her husband have been running a crockery shop. Her husband also works in a clinic, and her elder son is also running a crockery shop in a market. Safina has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase crockery items like glasses, plates, spoons, forks, etc. for her crockery shop, so that she can offer a greater variety of goods to her clients, and as a result increase her net income in the future. She dreams of opening a new shop for her other two sons. She is hopeful that her business will grow more in the future. She wants to thank all the BRAC staff for being so cooperative.

loans.use: To purchase crockery items for sale

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her community in San Miguel, Bohol. Elvira has been in the business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income. Her husband works as a carpenter.
Elvira is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap, and toiletries. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business and make it a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap, and toiletries.

loans.name: La Promesse Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nicole est leader du groupe de crédit « La promesse » jeune entrepreneur courageuse, expérimentée,   âgée de 36 ans et mère de 5 enfants, qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un Technicien en génie civil. La cliente est vendeuse des boissons. Elle commença cette activité avec le fonds reçu de son mari, il y a environ 8 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter  des 3 casiers de Primus, 3 casiers de Turbo King, 2 casiers de Mutzig, 5 casiers de Fanta. La crise économique généralisée, les pertes de change (de Franc congolais contre le dollar), la vente en crédit  sont des obstacles majeurs pour le développement de son activité. Dans le futur, elle souhaite agrandir son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir et vêtir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien en micro crédit aux femmes entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Our client Nicole is the leader of the La promesse [“The promise”] borrowers’ group.
She is a young entrepreneur, courageous and experienced. She is 36 years old and has five children, all of whom is in school. Her husband is a civil engineering technician. Nicole sells beverage. She launched this business with funds received from her husband about eight years ago. This new loan will allow her to buy three cases of Primus [beer], three cases of Turbo King [beer], two cases of Mutzig [beer] and five cases of Fanta. Given the overall economic crisis and currency exchange losses (Congolese francs into [US] dollars), selling on credit is a main challenge she faces  in her business. In the future she would like to expand her business and provide for schooling, nourishment and clothing for her children. Finally, she thanks Hekima for its support in providing microloans to female entrepreneurs.

loans.use: o buy three cases of Primus [beer], three cases of Turbo King [beer], two cases of Mutzig [beer] and five cases of Fanta.

loans.name: Sana

texts.en: Sana is a 31-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly, which has left him unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the family's lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Sana has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Sana is so thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cooking oil, maize flour, beans and sugar.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
La cliente Rosa vive en al ciudad de Playas. Es una mujer trabajadora porque comenzó hace 10 años atrás (en el 2003) con su negocio ya que ella trabaja en una empresa y la liquidaron. Fue entonces que ella comenzó con su negocio de venta de cosméticos.   

Actualmente trabaja desde 08:30 am vendiendo cosméticos, perfumes, ropa, relojes etc. Esta casada y tiene dos hijos uno de 15 años y otro de 7 años de edad que aun estudian. 

Ella tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere el préstamo para poder comprar perfumes, ropa, relojes etc. Y asi mejorar los ingresos de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in the city of Playas.  He’s a hardworking woman stared ten years ago (in 2003) with her own business since she was employed by a firm but was laid off.  It was then that she started with her business selling cosmetics.

She currently works from 8:30am selling cosmetics, perfume, clothes, watches, etc.  She’s married and has two children, a fifteen-year-old and a seven-year-old who are still in school.

She has many hopes for her business and this is why she wants to loan to be able to buy perfume, clothes, watches, etc. and improve her family income.

loans.use: to buy perfume, clothes and watches.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in Likoni, where she runs a small retail business. She is married and blessed with three school-going children. She also has a transport business, and she has employed someone to help her run it. She knew about Milango through her friends at a time when she needed credit to add stock to her business. 

Elizabeth now seeks a loan of 31,450 Kenya shillings to buy plastic items, such as basins, plates and cups for resale. The challenges that she is facing right now are price instability and clients not honouring their promises. 

The loan will improve her living standards and also enable her to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy plastic items, such as basins, plates and cups.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina, aged 36 years, is married and has been blessed with two children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a tailoring business, making school uniforms and suits for both men and women. Her challenge is the seasonal nature of the business. She dreams of establishing a big tailoring shop in the future.

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase cloth material, sewing thread, and needles for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth material, sewing thread, and needles for her business.

loans.name: Abdultif Group

texts.en: Abdultif is a group consisting of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB. Hadia is a 48-year-old married woman who has 4 children. She works hard and does her best to provide her family with food and clothing. She is a housewife and dreams of raising her children well. She lives with her family in bad conditions, and she would like to buy construction supplies to use in her small house, but she suffers from a lack of money, so she is applying for a loan of 40,000 YER. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use in her small house.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Eng is a rural villager in Pursat province, Cambodia. She is 50 years old and has four children. She grows rice and raises pigs as the main sources of her family’s income. Having been in this business for 11 years, she can earn about 15,000 KHR per day.
Eng has been with VisionFund for three cycles and she has repaid the past loans successfully. The past loans have helped her to support her family better. Now she is applying for 2,000,000 KHR loan to buy more pigs to raise. She will also use a portion of the loan to buy pig feed. She hopes to fatten her pigs so she can sell them for a good price and use the money to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise.

loans.name: Atswei's Group

texts.en:
Atswei's Group consists of two ladies, Astwei and Setina, who are neighbours. Atswei, age 42, is the leader of the group. She is shown holding the beverage bottles in the photo. 

Astwei runs a beverage bar in her neighborhood, a business she learned from her mother. Astwei is a single mother with two children, both of whom attend school. She engages in her trade in order to take care of her children and to cover the household expenses, which she handles alone. To meet the family's various expenses, Astwei has been selling drinks like Coca-Cola, Malta Guinness, Sprite, and Fanta in her bar for the past four years. She buys her stock from a distribution depot in Accra. 

In order to satisfy the demands of her growing customers and to make more profit, Astwei joins Setina in requesting their fifth loan, totaling GHS 1,700. Their previous loans have all been repaid in a timely and prompt fashion. 

This loan will allow both entrepreneurs to serve their customers better. They are counting on Kiva support and are grateful for the help they receive from their lenders.

loans.use: to buy beverages such as Coca-Cola, Sprite, Malta Guinness, and Fanta to offer for sale

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen, age 35, is a housewife. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is a scrap dealer. This business is the only source of income for the family. 

Nasreen is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase scrap iron, aluminum, and plastic bottles for his business. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to invest in household needs. 

Nasreen hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase scrap iron, aluminum, and plastic bottles.

loans.name: Baram

texts.en: Balam is a repeat borrower who pays his loans well. He hails from rural Rugarama in Ntungamo District. He is married to Marion. They have two children. Balam is a motorcycle rider in the rural area.  Since there is no easy means of transport, he has many people hiring him to bring them to different areas. He supplements the income he earns motorcycle transport with income from agricultural (banana) sales. He has applied for a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to improve the status of his banana plantation by purchasing and spreading manure, which will in turn increase the yield. He is hardworking and honest. In the photograph are the credit officer and Balam (right to left).

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
This is Ruth from Liberia. She resides in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County. The county is located by the sea and is known for its beaches and fish. Many logging companies are also located in the city. People in Buchanan are known in the country for their love of fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. 
Ruth is 38 and married with six children. Her children are between the ages of 20 and 4. Only three are currently living at home and only two are in school.  
Ruth owns her own small local shop business selling rice, cube, soap, oil, salt, etc., for the past 12 years. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more rice, cube, soap, oil, salt, etc., for her business.  
On average, she works 10 hours at her business from Monday to Saturday. She started her business with a small amount of money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by shared taxi. She cites rainy season as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is controlling her own money. In the future, she would like to build a modern shop.  
She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more rice, cube, soap, oil, salt, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
Louise is 34 years old and lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County. The city is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. Louise lives with her husband and three children between the ages of 13 and 9. All three of them are in school. Louise has been selling fish for the past 10 years in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. She likes her business because the profits help to support her home. She hopes to  own a house one day.  
She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
This is Cecelia from Liberia. She resides in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County. The county is located by the sea and is known for its beaches and fish. Many logging companies are also located in the city. People in Buchanan are known in the country for their love of fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Cecelia is 47 and married with three children. Her children are between the ages of 19 and 11. Only one is currently living at home and two are in school.  
Cecelia has owned her own table business selling beans, peanuts, pepper, flour, etc. for the past two years.  She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more beans, peanuts, pepper, flour, etc. for her business.  
On average, she works 11 hours at her business from Monday to Saturday. She started her business with a small amount of money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by shared taxi. She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is controlling her own money. In the future, she would like to build a modern shop.  
She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more beans, peanuts, pepper, flour, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 71 años de edad, vive con su familia que esta conformada por su esposo y una nieta. Trabajan en la siembra de maíz es una familia muy unida. Ella es una persona muy conocida en la zona, muy amable y respetuosa con las personas que viven alrededor. Se dedica la comercio de productos lácteos que obtiene de sus vacas y de la siembra de maíz obtiene la cosecha para vender en la plaza. Esto lo aprendió desde que tenia 20 años de edad; ya que sus padres se dedicaban a la venta de lácteo. Ellos llegaban al pueblo y se dividían en parte la zona  para poder abarcar todas las casas ofreciendo el queso, leche y crema; fue así como ella se inicio en la venta de leche y con el cultivo de maíz lo aprendió de su esposo cultivando maíz y el frijol. Hoy en día tiene personas que le ayuden por su edad. 

 Compra los insumo en el pueblo mas cercano que esta a unos 3 kilometros de su casa. Para poder comprar los insumos y alimentos para su casa, a demás de eso junto con su esposo compran animales para engordarlos pero algunas veces ella no lo puede hacer por la distancia que aveces son muy retiradas las zonas donde compra y vende sus productos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para iniciar con la siembra de 17,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y el mantenimiento de los animales para venderlos.
En estos momentos, no le alcanza el dinero para comenzar la siembra; ya que se acerca la época de siembra. Espera que le vaya bien obteniendo una buena cantidad de maíz y tener un mayor ingreso para su familia y del rastrojo que quede para alimentar al ganado que tiene y que le dan un producto que es la leche.
texts.en:
Lidia is 71-years-old living with her family consisting of her husband and a granddaughter.  They work growing corn and are a very united family.  She’s a very well-known person in her zone; she’s very kind and respectful to people living thereabouts.  She works selling dairy products she gets from her cows and she sells her corn crop in the local square.  She learned at the age of 20 because her parents sold dairy products too.  They’d come to town and divide it up by zones in order to cover all the houses selling cheese, milk and cream.  This is how she stared out selling milk and she learned to grow corn and beans from her husband.  Today, she has people who help her because of her age.

She buys supplies in the nearest town which is about 3 kilometers from home to be able to buy the supplies and food for her house.  In addition, she and her husband buy animals to fatten up but sometimes she doesn’t do it because of the distance which sometimes is quite far from the places where she buys and sells her products.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to start planting 17,000 square meters of corn and to care for her animals in order to sell them.

At the moment, she does not have enough money to start planting and the planting season is approaching.  She hopes to do well and to have a good crop yield of corn to earn higher family income and what’s left over use as cattle feed wince they produce a product: milk.

loans.use: to plant corn and care for her animals.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando, de 48 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador  y empeñoso, está casado con Neria y tiene 02 hijos de 17 y 19 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en su casa propia. Orlando se dedica a dar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, lleva en está actividad un promedio de 12 años pero en el transcurso del tiempo a ido cambiandose de vehículo ya que se deterioraban con el paso de los años. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual poder solventar sus gastos familiares, iniciándose por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico, ya que no podía conseguir un empleo fijo, ahora se siente con mayor seguridad pues puede manejar su propio tiempo, además de ser su propio jefe. Por lo contrario comenta que no le gusta cuando su mototaxi se malogra muy seguido pues le ocasiona muchos gastos, pero aun así logra ver buenas resultados, por eso tiene planes de crecer y poder comprarse un vehiculo de transporte de carga pesada. Este será su octavo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo para poder alcanzar sus objetivos, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. El monto solicitado de 300 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la reparación de su vehiculo de transporte, para poder trabajar con tranquilidad.
texts.en: Orlando, age 48, is a hard-working and diligent man. He is married to Neria, and they have two children ages 17 and 19. They live together in their own home. Orlando provides a passenger transportation service with his mototaxi. He has been doing this for about 12 years, but over time he has changed his vehicle as it was deteriorating. He enjoys his business because it allows him to have an income with which to cover his family's costs. He started his business because he needed an income, since he could not find a steady job. He now feels that he has greater security because he can manage his own time and be his own boss. However, he tells us that he doesn't like it when his mototaxi runs down quickly because it can get very expensive; butt he still gets good results. He plans to expand his business and buy a heavy transport vehicle. This will be his eighth loan with Kiva, and he is grateful for the finical support that he is receiving on the way to his goals. He promises to pay his quotas punctually. He will invest these 300 nuevos soles in the repair of his vehicle in order to work with greater security.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima sells cooked food from home to the general public. In addition, she sells khangas (women’s wrap clothing). She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

Here again, she comes to you for another loan of Kshs 50,000 to purchase foodstuff of maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar for her business. 

Tima decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuff of maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar for her business

loans.name: Loretta

texts.en:
Loretta is 34 years old and lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea. The county is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia, Loretta lives with her husband and three children, who are between the ages of 10 and 6. All three of them are in school. Loretta has been selling red oil, pepper, salt, etc. for the past 2 years in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil, pepper, salt, etc. for her business. She likes her business because it helps her support her home. She hopes to own a house one day.  
She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil, pepper, salt, etc. for her business,

loans.name: Jwahr Group

texts.en: This group is called Jwahr. It consists of five ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Najod is a 29-year-old married woman who has 3 children. She is applying for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase a fridge. She aspires to buy a house to live in with her family. She is aiming to have a business store to earn more profit and buy a car so she has the opportunity to provide a better life for her whole family.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge for her house.

loans.name: Deh-Nien

texts.en:
This is Deh-nien from Liberia. She resides in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County. The county is located by the sea and is known for its beaches and fish. Many logging companies are also located in the city. People in Buchanan are known in the country for their love of fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. 
Deh-nien is 36 and unmarried with two children. She completed 7th grade. Her children are ages 11 and 9. They are currently living at home and are in school.  
Deh-nien has owned her own small local shop business selling rubber dishes such as plates, cups, bowls, etc. for the past 17 years.  She will use the loan to purchase more rubber dishes such as plates, cups, bowls, etc. for her business.  
On average, she works 12 hours at her business from Monday to Saturday. She started her business with a small amount of money from her fiance. She transports her merchandise by shared taxi. She cites rainy season as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is controlling her own money. In the future, she would like to build a modern shop.  
She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes such as plates, cups, bowls, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Jamolidin

texts.ru: Чамолидин вдовец и отец четверых детей. У него две дочери в возрасте 18 и 14 лет, двое сыновей в возрасте 20 и 8 лет. Старший сын служит в армии, а старшая дочь домохозяйка, двое младших детей еще учатся в школе. Три года тому назад жена Чамолидина скончалась и он один воспитывает своих детей. Чамолидин 42-летний мужчина с высшим образованием. Он в течение 15 лет работает врачом. Одновременно он занимался и животноводством, однако после смерти жены приостановил эту деятельность. Сейчас Чамолидин хотел бы снова начать свой бизнес в области купли и продажи крупнорогатого скота. Он запрашивает кредит для закупа 8 голов крупнорогатого скота и их корма. Прибыль с деятельности он будет откладывать на будущее детей.
texts.en:
Jamolidin is a widower and the father of four children. He has two daughters of the ages of 18 and 14 years, and two sons of the ages of 20 and 8 years. His eldest son is in the army, and the eldest daughter is a housewife. The two younger children are still in school. Jamolidin's wife died three years ago, and he raises his children by himself. 

Jamolidin is a 42 years old man with higher education. He has worked as a medical doctor for 15 years. At the same time he also worked with livestock breeding, however after the death of his wife he stopped this activity. Currently Jamolidin would like to start his business of cattle sales again. He requests a loan for the purchase of eight heads of cattle and their fodder. He will save the money from this business for the future of his children.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for reselling

loans.name: Sobiya

texts.en:
Sobiya is a 31-year-old married woman. Her husband is working in a crockery factory, but his income is not enough to bear the expenses of the family members alone. That is why Sobiya has been running her general store to support her husband financially for a period of about seven years. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts for years. 

Sobiya is a mother of seven children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy a stock of rice, flour and sugar. It will help her to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a 44-year-old business woman from Liberia. She is single and has three children between 30 and 24. She had completed grade six before starting her business.  She describes herself as a hardworking woman.

She lives and works in Buchanan, which is located by the sea and is the capital city of Grand Bassa County. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Theresa has had a shop business which sells clothes for the past three years.  She works from 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. each day at her business.  Her greatest challenge in business is less income. 

She intends to use the loan to buy more blouses, T-shirts, jeans, trousers, etc. She started her business by selling for her mother. She likes her business because it helps to support her home.  She hopes to one day own a house.  

She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy more blouses, T-shirts, jeans, trousers, etc.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилорому 34 года. Она разведенная женщина с одним ребенком. Дилором живет вместе с сыном в городе Куляб. У нее высшее образование. Она очень хорошая мать и трудолюбивый человек. Дилором имеет опыт работы в швейном деле и теперь хочет начать собственный бизнес в этой области, так как это прибыльное дело. Она обратилась в организацию, чтобы получить поддержку в осуществлении своей мечты. Дилором запрашивает кредит для приобретения швейной машинки и ткани. Она планирует у себя на дому шить платья для продажи и за счет прибыли продвигать быт и одновременно развивать бизнес.
texts.en: Dilorom is 34 years old. She is a divorcee with one child. Dilorom lives with her son in the city of Kulob. She has a university degree. She is a very good mother and a hard worker. Dilorom has experience working in the garment business and now wants to start a business in this area, as it is a profitable endeavor. She applied to the organization, so that she could get support to pursue her dreams. Dilorom is requesting a loan to buy sewing machines and fabric. She plans to sew dresses herself at home to sell, and by profiting, improve her life and at the same time develop her business.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines and fabric to sew.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Frederick lives outside of Mabokoni, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.  

Frederick is married and has one child. His wife takes care of their home, while he farms and runs a small hardware business. He is currently growing a tree plantation on his land. He likes Honey Care because they give efficient service, and he is looking forward to becoming a beekeeper so he can have honey “for medicinal uses.”

This is Frederick’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to expand his hardware business. In the future, Frederick hopes to educate his child to a high level.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Dior's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 02/09/2008. Il est composé de 3 femmes qui font toutes du commerce.Il est à son 10éme prêt. Dior est la représentante du groupe ,elle est âgée de 45, marié et mère de 6 enfants dont 2 garçons de 27 et 24 ans et 4 filles de 30,23,20,17 ans. Elle fait du commerce de cosmétique et d'alimentation générale. Avec son prêt elle compte acheter  200000f de produit de beauté et de vaisselle ,10 seaux de 20kg de  patte d'arachide à 220000f ;10 bouteilles de 20 litres d'huile à 100000f .Elle achète en gros et approvisionne les petits commerçants du marché. Avec ses bénéfices elle paie la scolarité de sa fille,elle renforce aussi ses épargnes dans le banc villageois et aide aussi son marie dans le payement du loyer de leur maison conjugale.
texts.en:
This group is part of the Banc Villageois that was created on 02/09/2008. It is made up of three women who are all merchants. They are on their tenth loan cycle. 

Dior is the representative of the group. She is 45, married, and the mother of six children, two boys aged 27 and 24 years, and four girls aged 30, 23, 20, and 17 years. She is a merchant of cosmetics and general food supplies. With this loan she plans to buy 200,000 Francs worth of cosmetics and crockery, ten 20 kg buckets of peanuts at 220,000 Francs, and ten 20-liter bottles of oil at 100,000 Francs. She buys her merchandise at wholesale and supplies the merchants at the village market.

With the income she earns, Dior will pay for her daughter's school fees. She also plans to increase her savings in the Banc Villageois and help her husband with the rent payments for their marital home.

loans.use: to buy 200,000 Francs worth of cosmetics and crockery, ten 20-kg buckets of peanuts at 220,000 Francs, and ten 20-liter bottles of oil at 100,000 Francs.

loans.name: Particia

texts.en:
Particia is a 46-year-old businesswoman from Liberia.  She is single and has three children between the ages of 5 and 19.  Only four are currently attending school and they all live at home. Particia did not go to school. She describes herself as a hard-working businesswoman.
She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 
Particia has operated a table business which sells dry and fresh fish for the past three years. She works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day at her business.  Her greatest challenge in business is earning enough income. She intends to use the loan to buy more fish. She started her business by selling for her mother. She likes her business because it helps to support her home. She hopes to one day own a house. She wants to thank Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Doris Suyapa

texts.es:
Doris es una mujer de 39 años con un grado de educación cursado hasta el tercer grado de primaria en compañía de su esposo se dedica al cultivo de café y de su hogar y matrimonio tienen 2 hijos, el primero está en la escuela y el otro aun no estudia porque aún es muy pequeño. En su casa de habitación solo viven ella, sus 2 hijos y su esposo los cuales son los únicos que se involucran en el cultivo de café el cual lo realizan hace más de 15 años ya fueron sus padres los que les enseñaron a trabajar la tierra. La agricultura (el cultivo de café) ha sido la única actividad económica que ellos han tenido durante muchos años. Las tierras que trabajan son propias las cuales las han adquirido por herencia por parte de los papas de su pareja la cual está ubicada a un kilómetro de su casa de habitación a la cual se traslada a pie en compañía de su pareja. 

Ella solicita a COMIXMUL un financiamiento para invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes y abono para sus cultivos de café los cuales son necesarios para que se mantengan sanos y la producción sea aprovechada al 100%.

Sus planes a futuro son los de poder ampliar sus cultivos para generar mayores ingresos para su familia y hogar y así poder cumplir su sueño como madre, el de ver a sus hijos en una mejor posición económica, con un mejor estilo de vida y con una excelente educación.
texts.en:
Doris is a 39-year-old woman who finished grade three. She and her husband cultivate coffee. They have two children; the eldest is in school and the youngest is too young for school. In their home it is just the four of them: Doris, her two children, and her husband. They are the only people who work their land. They have been cultivating coffee for over 15 years. Their parents taught them to work the land. Agriculture (coffee cultivation) has been their only source of income for many years. The land they work is their own, an inheritance from her husband's parents. It is located one kilometre from their home, and they travel to it on foot together.
Doris is requesting a loan from COMIXMUL for the purchase of fertilizers and manure for her coffee crops. This is necessary to keep the plants healthy and to get the most out of the production.
Her plans for the future are to be able to expand her crops in order to generate more income for her household, and thus to be able to reach her dream as a mother: to see her children in a better economic position, with a better lifestyle and with an excellent education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and manure to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is a young, beautiful, clever and highly skilled dentist. She graduated from Yerevan State Medical University's Dental Department. She has had her own dental clinic for 18 years and a lot of loyal clients fully trust their dental health to Naira. Naira is married and she has three daughters. She lives in Kapan with her husband, children and parents-in-law, who are retired. 
In her clinic, over the years Naira has bought all needed modern equipment for her work. Now, Naira wants to renew all of it. With the help of her first Kiva loan, she seeks to buy an autoclave for medical tools sterilization. She could not find a better partner than Kiva to support her in business.

loans.use: to buy an autoclave for medical tools sterilization

loans.name: Simón

texts.es: Simón vive con su esposa y sus 8 hijos, que tienen edades entre 2 y 19 años. Se dedica a la agricultura en su pequeña finca, donde cultiva café y banano. Uno de sus objetivos es que sus hijos se eduquen y aprendan a leer y escribir. El café es el principal rubro que le permite obtener ingresos para su familia, por lo que ha decidido solicitar este crédito para comprar fertilizantes y otros insumos que le garanticen el mantenimiento de su cafetal en este año y contar con buenos rendimientos durante la próxima cosecha, para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Simón lives with his wife and 8 children whose ages range between 2 and 19 years.   He works in agriculture on his small farm where he grows coffee and bananas.  One of his goals is that his children become educated and that they learn how to read and write.  Coffee is the main crop that allows him to earn family income which is why he’s decided to request this loan to buy fertilizer and other supplies that will guarantee coffee crop maintenance this year to produce good crop yields in the next harvest in order to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other supplies for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en: Asma is a 33-year-old vigorous lady who has been stitching clothes for many years. She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. However, due to lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. To help her continue operation of her business, she requested a loan of Rs.30000/- to buy threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Please meet 46-year-old Martha from Buchanan. Buchanan is the capital city of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 
Martha did not go to school. She is married. She describes herself as hardworking woman. She has nine children between 20 and 10. Her children are in school and live at home. 
Martha has a table which sells goods such as pepper, bitter ball (a tropical vegetable with a bitter taste), and okra.  She has been in business for 25 years and works every day, 10 hours each day. With this loan, she will buy goods such as pepper, bitter ball (a tropical vegetable with a bitter taste), and okra. One of the greatest challenges that she faces is increasing her sales. She transports her goods by taxi. She started her business with money from her husband. She is proud of her business because of the profit she makes. Her future plan is to build a house. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy goods such as pepper, bitter ball (a tropical vegetable with a bitter taste), and okra.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Please meet 36-year-old Esther from Buchanan. Buchanan is the capital city of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are speakers of Bassa, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 
Esther is a married college student. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. Her husband is a driver. She has three children between 11 and 6. They are in school and live at home. 
Esther has a shop which sells blouses, slippers, body cream, powder and earrings. She has been in business for 11 years and works every day, spending ten hours each day. With this loan, she will buy blouses, slippers, body cream, powder, and earrings. One of the greatest challenges that she faces is increasing her sales. She transports her goods by taxi. She started her business with money from her husband. She is proud of her business because of the profit she makes. Her future plan is to buy a car. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy blouses, slippers, body cream, powder, and earrings.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 29 years old. She lives in Kapan with her mother, who is unemployed, and her brother. Anna has studied at the Kapan Economical College in the Financial-Economic department and for several years she has worked as an accountant. Besides that work, Anna and her mother are engaged in business activities. They have built a nice and colorful vegetable greenhouse where they cultivate beans, cucumber, parsley, radishes, onions and greens. They sell the harvest in Kapan's wholesale market.
Now Anna needs a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams to buy plastic sheeting, fertilizer, soil, pipes, and seedlings. Anna is sure that they will manage to enlarge their business in the future and build a bigger greenhouse near their house.

loans.use: to buy plastic sheeting, fertilizer, soil, pipes, and seedlings.

loans.name: Govi

texts.en:
Govi sells farming products from home to the general public. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business.

With the 25,000 KES loan, he wants to purchase more seed and fertilizer for farming to facilitate his activities and sales.
He decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance to improve his business and he appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds and fertilizer for farming to facilitate his activities and sales.

loans.name: Shamsa

texts.en: Shamsa has expertise in doing machine embroidery and is has used her skill to provide for her family for over five years now. During the initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today she is proud to be famous in her community as the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. Three years ago, when she borrowed from Kashf for the first time, she purchased spools of thread with some packs of beads and pearls. Now, she has requested another loan worth Rs. 40000 to purchase a new machine with more packs of threads and sequins in different colors. She says that the females in her community have become demanding over time and satisfying them is a challenge that Shamsa has taken up. She has four children, two in school. She wishes to provide them quality education for prosperous futures.

loans.use: to purchase a new machine with more packs of threads and sequins in different colors.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan es un pequeño productor de café integrado a las plataformas de negocios promovidas por la Asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC), y por tanto al proceso de certificación Comercio Justo que promueve esta asociación entre el grupo de productores que apoya con servicios financieros y de desarrollo empresarial. En su finca, Dn. Juan cultiva café, cacao y malanga coco, estas actividades las realiza con el apoyo de su esposa y sus 5 hijos. Además, genera en promedio 2 empleos en su comunidad.
El cuenta que una de las actividades que más le gusta hacer es cortar el café porque siente que está cosechando el trabajo que realiza en este cultivo. Para este ciclo, él necesita contar con recursos para garantizar el mantenimiento de su plantación de café, por lo tanto ha decidido solicitar este crédito para comprar parte de los insumos del mantenimiento de su cafetal. Su meta es incrementar el rendimiento y calidad de sus plantaciones y en un mediano plazo aumentar su área de café.
texts.en:
Juan is a small coffee grower who is part of the business platforms promoted by Asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC) and part of the Fair Commerce certification process as well that this association promotes among producers that it supports with financial services and business development.  Juan grows coffee, cocoa beans and malanga coco [tuber similar to a yam in appearance and a potato in flavor] on his farm; he does these activities with help from his wife and five children.  He also generates two job opportunities in his community on average.

He relates that one of the activities he likes best is cutting the coffee because he feels that he’s harvesting the fruits of his labor.  For this cycle, he needs to have resources available to guarantee the care of his coffee plants.  Because of this, he’s decided to request this loan to buy part of the supplies he needs to provide coffee crop maintenance.  His goal is to increase crop yields and quality of his plants and in the medium run increase the area planted with coffee.

loans.use: to buy supplies to apply to his coffee crop.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia lives in a small town outside of Maphombe, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees. 

Julia is married and has five children. Both she and her husband farm and are currently growing mangoes and passion fruit on their land. She is excited to start beekeeping because her bees will pollinate her crops, thus increasing her income. 

This is Julia’s first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to increase her passion fruit stands. In the future, her hope is to expand her apiary “to a commercial level.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гулсара молодая незамужняя девушка. Ей 29 лет. Она живет вместе с матерью, братьями и младшей сестрой в городе Куляб. Её братья находятся в России на заработках. Гулсара окончила школу и у нее среднее образование. Она предприимчивая и трудолюбивая девушка. Гулсара хочет начать бизнес в области торговли. Она накопила деньги и построила магазин рядом с домом. Гулсара берет кредит для закупа товаров, чтобы  заполнить витрины магазина продуктами питания. Она впервые занимается бизнесом, и в этом деле ей будет помогать младшая сестра.
texts.en: Gulsara is a young single woman.  She is 29 years old.  She lives together with her mother, brothers and a younger sister in the city of Kulob.  Her brothers are working in Russia.  Gulsara finished school and has a secondary education.  She is an entrepreneurial and hardworking young woman.  Gulsara wants to start a business in the retail field.  She saved money and built a store near her home.  Gulsara is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise in order to fill the store displays with food products.  This is her first time getting involved in business and her younger sister will be helping her with it.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Lionel

texts.es: Lionel tiene 26 años, es soltero y vive en la casa de sus tíos. Lionel se dedica la compra y venta de ganado. Su amigo fue quien le enseño está actividad, pero cuando gano experiencia emprendió su propio negocio. Con sus ahorros pudo  comprarse un vehículo, y de ahí mejorar su negocio. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación pudo salir adelante y ahora tiene un negocio estable que le ayuda a mejorar su calidad de vida y apoyar a sus padres económicamente. Como un hombre emprendedor espera seguir creciendo y sacar adelante su actividad, aumentando su productividad y mejorando su trabajo. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva por lo que agradece el apoyo económico recibido y promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto de S/.1500.00 Lionel comprara ganado y elevará sus ventas.
texts.en:
Lionel, 26, lives in his aunt’s and uncle’s house.  He works buying and selling livestock.  His friend taught him this activity but when he got experience he started his own business.  He was able to buy a vehicle with his savings and thus improve his business.  Thanks to his effort and dedication he was able to get ahead and now has a stable business that helps him improve his quality of life and help his parents economically.

Like all enterprising men he hopes to continue growing and moving his activity forward increasing productivity and improving his work.  This is his first Kiva loan and he’s grateful for the economic support received; he promises to be punctual with his payments.  Lionel will use the requested 1,500 soles to buy livestock and he will increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Herder

texts.es: Herder tiene 26 años, es soltero y vive en la casa de sus padres junto a su familia. Herder se dedica a la agricultura con su padre. Trabaja en los terrenos de cultivo pero también vende sus productos en la ciudad. Como una actividad complementaria, Herder también es trabajador de la Municipalidad, y trabaja de peón buscando incrementar sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Aunque algunos años han sido difíciles ya que no había mucha productividad en sus terrenos pero  gracias al apoyo de su familia a seguido adelante. También tiene un  negocio en donde se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, ahora con los ingresos extras de sus actividades espera seguir creciendo y sacar adelante a toda su familia. Para Herder este es el primer crédito con Kiva, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico recibido y promete ser puntual con sus pagos, para más adelante solicitar otro préstamo. El dinero solicitado de S/.800.00 lo invertirá en la compra de abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Herder, 26, is single living with his family in his parents’ house.  Herder works in agriculture with his father.  He works on farmland but also sells his products in the city.  As a complementary activity, Herder also works for the city and works as a day laborer seeking to increase income to improve his family’s quality of life.  Although some years have been difficult because his land wasn’t very productive, thanks to family support he’s continued forward/.  He also has a business buying and selling livestock and hopes to use extra income from his activities to continue growing and moving his entire family forward.

This is Herder’s first Kiva loan and he’s grateful for the economic support provided and he promises to be punctual with his payments so that he can request another loan later on.  He will use the requested 800 soles to buy organic manure for his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure for his crops.

loans.name: Bakht

texts.ru: Бахт является стоматологом. Ему 40 лет. Он женат, имеет троих дочерей и двоих сыновей, и проживает со своей большой семьей в городе Вахдат. У него высшее медицинское образование. В течение 15 лет Бахт работает в стоматологической клинике. Он занимается протезированием зубов и делает это на качественном уровне. У него всегда много пациентов, так как он опытный дантист. Бахт сейчас запрашивает кредит для расширения деятельности. На сумму кредита он хочет закупить золото и изготовить золотые коронки своим пациентам.
texts.en: Bakht is a dentist.  He is 40 years old, married and has three daughters and two sons.  He lives with his large family in the city of Vahdat.  He has a higher medical education.  Bakht has been working in a dental clinic for 15 years.  He is involved in making teeth prosthetics and does so with high quality.  He always has many patients because he is an experienced dentist.  Bakht is requesting this loan to expand his business.  He wants to use this loan to purchase gold and make gold crowns for his patients.

loans.use: to purchase gold for making gold crowns

loans.name: Nelson Antonio

texts.es:
Nelson, de 27 años de edad, habitante de la comarca El Potrillo, soltero, de oficio agricultor. El trabaja desde su niñez junto con su mama y su hermano en las labores del campo, sembrando granos básicos y criando ganado. Actividades que hasta el día de hoy le ha permitido sobrevivir junto con su familia, en ocasiones viaja a Costa Rica a cortar café para conseguir ingresos para invertirlo en el ganado y producción de leche y cuajada.

El está solicitando el crédito para comprar alambres y pagar mano de obra para reparar las cercas de los potreros donde tiene a sus animales. Él se ha propuesto mejorar las condiciones de sus animales y aumentar la producción  de leche para vender.
texts.en:
Nelson, 27, lives in the district of El Potrillo.  He’s single and works in agriculture.  He’s worked since childhood alongside his mother and brother doing field chores, planting basic grains and raising cattle.  These activities have allowed him to this day to survive alongside his family.  He occasionally travels to Costa Rica to work cutting coffee to earn income to invest in cattle and mild and cheese production.

He’s asking for the loan to buy wire and pay labor costs to repair the fences in his pasture land where he keeps his animals.  He’s proposed to improve his animals’ conditions to increase the production of milk to sell.

loans.use: to buy wire and to pay labor costs to repair fences.

loans.name: Abigaël Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mbombo est leader du groupe de crédit « Abigaël » doyenne, entrepreneur courageuse, expérimentée,   âgée de 57 ans et mère de 4 enfants, parmi les quels certains ont déjà leurs propres foyers. Son conjoint est un chauffeur. La cliente est vendeuse des Chikwange (pattes), un repas purement congolais. Elle commença cette activité avec le fonds reçu de son mari, il y a environ 18 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter  des maniocs (intrant de fabrication de chikwange). La vente en crédit  est un obstacle majeur pour le développement de son activité. Dans le futur, elle souhaite agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses petits fils. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien en micro crédit aux femmes entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
The client Mbombo is the representative for the Abigaël Group credit association. She is a senior member, a courageous entrepreneur, experienced, 57 years of age, and the mother of four children, some of whom have already founded their own homes. Her husband is a driver.

The client is selling the chikwange (fermented cassava), a purely Congolese meal. She started her business with funds she received from her husband about 18 years ago. This new loan will be used to buy cassava (the essential ingredient for manufacturing chikwange). Selling on credit is a major obstacle to the development of her business. In the future, Mbombo wants to expand her business and educate her grandchildren. She is thankful to Hekima for their micro loan support of women entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy cassava (the essential ingredient for manufacturing chikwange)

loans.name: Claudia Milagros

texts.es: Claudia tiene 30 años , es casada, y vive en su casa propia con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Claudia se dedica a la agricultura junto a su esposo cuida a sus animales y sus sembríos de maíz, plátano, etc. Como una actividad complementaria y para tener más ingresos, Claudia tiene sembríos de fréjol en la huerta de su casa. Ambos negocios ayudan a mejorar su calidad de vida y el de su familia. Gracias a la experiencia que tienen en el rubro pudieron salir adelante, y conseguir una mejor producción. Lo que ahora espera es que le vaya muy bien con su cosecha de maíz, y que pueda vender todo su producto y obtenga buenos ingresos para que inicie una nueva campaña. Este es el primer préstamo con Kiva, agradece de antemano el apoyo económico recibido y promete ser puntual con sus pagos. El monto de S/.700.00, lo invertirá en la compra de abono orgánico para mejorar su producción de maíz.
texts.en: Claudia, 30, is married living in her own house with her husband and two children.  Claudia works in agriculture alongside her husband; she cares for her animals and her corn and banana crops.  As a complementary activity and to earn higher income, Claudia grows broad beans in the yard at home.  Both businesses help her improve her and her family’s quality of life.  Thanks to the experience they have in the line of work, they were able to get ahead and acquire improved production.  What she hopes for now is that she’ll do well in her corn harvest so that she can sell the entire crop and earn good income to start a new growing cycle.  This is her first Kiva loan and she thanks in advance for the economic support received; she promises to be punctual with her payments.  She will use the 700 soles to buy organic manure to improve corn production.

loans.use: to buy organic manure for her corn crop.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 29 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser alegre y amable.  Vive en compañía de su esposo Jhon con quien tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad respectivamente, juntos están instalados en la casa de su suegra. Rosa se dedica a la venta de comidas, actividad que realiza de lunes a viernes desde hace 02 años. Su actividad económica lo realiza en un mercado de la ciudad y le gusta su negocio pues que le va muy bien ya que recibe buenos ingresos de está actividad. Por el contrario no le gusta el cansancio físico que le ocaciona levantarse muy de temprano para preparar las comidas, sin embargo esto no la desanima y continúa en su negocio ya que desea ser mejor cada dia. Este será su segundo préstamo con Kiva y agradece el apoyo financiero recibido para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles comprará ingredientes al por mayor tales como arroz, sacos de papa, verduras , entre otros.
texts.en:
Rosa, 29, is a hardworking, dedicated woman in addition to being cheerful and kind.  She lives with her husband, Jhon, with whom she has a four-year-old son.  They live together in her mother-in-law’s house.  

Rosa works selling food, an activity she’s carried out from Monday through Friday for the last two years.  She carries out her economic activity in a market in the city and she likes her business because she does very well since she earns good income from this activity.  On the other hand, however, she does not like the physical exhaustion caused by having to rise so very early to prepare the meals.  However, this does not discourage her and she continues in business because she wants to be better every day.

This will be her second Kiva loan and she’s grateful for the financial support she’ll get to continue moving forward.  In addition, she commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the 1,200 new soles to buy ingredients like rice, sacks of potatoes, vegetables, etc. at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. For many years she has been successfully running a general store in her community. She offers various goods for daily use and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She has good communication skills and counts a good client list. 

For the improvement of her business she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages. This will help her to meet the demand of her customers on time. She is in her 7th loan cycle with good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Edward

texts.es: Edward tiene 41 años, es casado, y vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos. Edward se dedica a la venta de leña y a la agricultura. Anteriormente trabajaba de peón en las chacras de otras personas, hasta que pudo adquirir un pequeño terreno para sus cultivos. Ahora con esos ahorros a podido comprar un mototaxi con el que puede transportar toda su mercadería. Ahora con los ingresos que obtiene de la venda de leña, espera abrir un nuevo negocio dedicado a la mecánica con su hijo. Este es el primer crédito con Kiva, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico recibido, el cual le ayudará a mejorar su negocio y a dinamizar sus ventas. Edward promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Edward, invertirá los S/. 1000 en la compra de materiales tales como desarmadores, pernos , entre otros,  para así iniciar su nuevo negocio dedicado a la mecánica junto a su hijo.
texts.en:
Edward, 41, is married and lives in his own home with his wife and 3 children. Edward works selling wood and also in farming.

Previously he worked as a day labourer on other people's farms, until he could acquire a small amount of land for his crops. Now, with his savings he has been able to buy a motorcycle taxi, with which he can transport all of his merchandise. Now with the income that he gains from selling firewood, he hopes to open a new mechanic business with his son. 

This is his first Kiva loan and he is very grateful for the economic support he has received, which will help him to improve his business and invigorate his sales. Edward promises to be punctual with his payments. Edward will invest the 1000 PEN by buying materials, such as screwdrivers, bolts and others, so he can start his new mechanic business with his son.

loans.use: to buy materials for his new mechanic business

loans.name: Dúo Marcelina Group

texts.es:
Dúo MARCELINA
este grupo lo integra la señora Rafaila quien se dedica a la confección de blusas de tela, se ve en la necesidad de comprar la tela por libra ya que gastaría menos y le quedaría más ganancia.  Son varios colores los que a ella le hacen falta y pide un crédito para poder comprar la tela que le hace falta y así no quedarles mal sus clientes, ya que tiene varios pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes, espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
MARCELINA DUO

Rafaila is part of this group.  She works making cloth blouses.  She needs to buy fabric by the pound because she’d spend less and earn higher profits.  She needs several colors and is asking for a loan to be able to buy the fabric she needs so that she won’t disappoint her customers since she already has pending orders.  She hopes that she’ll be able to get help with the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make blouses to sell.

location.town: Cantón San Francisco, Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Ped

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith, de 48 años de edad, es divorciada y vive junto a sus dos hijos en su casa propia. Edith se dedica a la venta de ropas de segunda mano para damas, caballeros y niños , los cuales son de diversos modelos y presentaciones, toda la ropa es enviada de otra ciudad buscando lo ultimo de la moda, las ventas las realiza de forma ambulatoria por otras zonas de la ciudad, dejando muchas veces su ventas al crédito, logrando hacerse conocida, lleva 10 años en está actividad. Le gusta su negocio pues se siente independiente contando con un ingreso propio para apoyar a  sus hijos en sus estudios. Este será su primer préstamo con Kiva, por lo tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos y además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 500 nuevos soles comprará ropa para damas, caballeros y niños.
texts.en:
Edith, 48, is divorced living with her two children in her own house.  Edith works selling second-hand clothes for women, men and children.  They are of assorted styles and presentations.  All of the clothes are shipped to her from another city.  She always seeks the latest styles and she sells from place to place in other parts of the city.  She often sells on credit and has become well-known; she has ten years’ experience.  She likes the business because she feels independent and has income of her own she can rely on to support her children’s schooling.  

This will be her first Kiva loan and she’s hoping for your support to continue towards her objectives; she commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the 500 soles requested to buy women’s, men’s and children’s clothes.

loans.use: to buy women's, men's and children's clothes.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José , es un humilde agricultor , que vive en  la comunidad El Bálsamo en las afueras de Boaco, fue beneficiado con su primer crédito Kiva el cual utilizo para darle una mejor asistencia a sus cosechas la cual vendió a precio justo, se siente agradecido por apoyarlo en el momento que más lo necesitaba. 
Hoy está necesitando el crédito para comprar abono y fertilizante para sembrar granos básicos pues desea sacar una producción de calidad que le permita conseguir ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José is a humble farmer living in the community of El Bálsamo in the outskirts of Boaco.  He was benefited with his first Kiva loan which he used to provide better crop care; he sold his harvest at a fair price and is grateful for the support he got when he most needed it.

Today, he’s asking for a loan to buy manure and fertilizer to plant basic grains because he wants to produce a good crop yield that will lead to income to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 29-year-old, married woman and a mother of six children. She has been running a business of clothing sales. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. 

She requested a loan of Rs. 35,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She is in her fourth loan cycle and hopes to have a good experience with this loan. 

Abida dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is 47 years old, a married lady, and is running a small general store in her community.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family.

 To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she will be able to deal with more customers time after time. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 28-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady and, for the past two years, she has been running a business of clothing sales. She buys clothes of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

She is requesting a loan of Rs. 25,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of clothes for the summer season in different colors and designs to attract more customers. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good repayment history. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes for the summer season in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Carla

texts.es: Carla, de 39 años de edad, es una mujer muy alegre, dinámica y emprendedora, está casada con Julio quien es mototaxista. Vive en compañía de su esposo y sus 05 hijos en la casa de su madre. El trabajo que realiza Carla es la venta de golosinas, actividad que realiza en la puerta de un Jardín de niños ubicado cerca a su domicilio, la cual  viene funcionando desde hace 06 años, para realizar está actividad cuenta con la ayuda de uno de sus hijos. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le permite tener un ingreso económico que le permite pagar los gastos de la casa,  y le da tiempo de ver a sus hijos. Este será su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante. Con el préstamo de S/.1000 nuevos soles, comprará golosinas en general tales como galletas, caramelos, chocolates, entre otros.
texts.en: Carla, age 39, is a very happy, dynamic, and enterprising woman. She is married to Julio, who drives a mototaxi. She and Julio live together with their five children in Carla's mother's home. Carla sells candy outside of a daycare centre located near her home. She has been doing this for six years, and one of her children helps her with the business. She likes that her job allows her to have an income to cover the household costs and gives her time to see her children. This will be her third loan with Kiva, and she is very grateful for the financial support that she is receiving to move forward with her business. With this loan of 1000 nuevos soles, she will purchase candies such as cookies, caramels, and chocolates.

loans.use: to buy cookies, caramels, chocolates, and other items.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives outside of Magodi, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, and is the southernmost Kenyan county. Though some of the towns along the beach see benefits from tourism, the majority of people living inland are farmers, and the region's inconsistent rains can make agricultural yields unpredictable. Beekeeping is a relatively new activity in the area, but many farmers here are enthusiastic at the prospect of owning their own hives.

Joseph is married and has eight children. His wife is retired, and he farms their plot. He is currently growing oranges and other crops on their land. Joseph is excited to start beekeeping because his bees will pollinate his oranges, leading to higher yields. 

This is Joseph’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to build a water reservoir on his land. In the future, Joseph hopes to build upon this reservoir, eventually growing it into a large-scale irrigation project.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of eight children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands including food, health, clothing, and education. She has been doing carpet manufacturing for the last five years. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and designs. By this time, she has become famous in providing good quality carpets in her area. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Currently she applied for a  loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase more raw materials such as good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. It’s her 3rd year with Kashf Foundation and she has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials such as good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers.

loans.name: Sulma Virginia

texts.es:
Sulma tiene 22 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña. Ella es consejera de venta de productos cosméticos, donde prácticamente lleva desempeñando el servicio 1 año. Pero antes se dedicaba a la venta de productos cosméticos con diferentes marcas donde trabajo 2 años.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para cubrir algunos gastos del hogar como comprar la leche de su pequeña hija de dos años. El préstamo le ayudara a comprar lo necesario a su hija para que tenga buenas condiciones; ya que su hija apenas tiene 2 años y se requiere de un cuido especial para evitar la desnutrición  y comprarle vitaminas y alimentos para el consumo diario.

Ella desea, seguir trabajando duro para darle lo necesario; ya que ella es una joven soltera y quiere que su hija tenga lo necesario y los cuidados que se merecen los niños.
texts.en:
Sulma is 22 years old; she is a single mother of one daughter. She is a makeup sales consultant, where she has worked for practically one year. But before, she sold cosmetic products from different brands where she worked for two years.

The loan that she is requesting from Kiva partner Fundacion Campo is to cover some household expenses such as buying milk for her little two-year-old daughter. The loan will help her buy what's necessary for her daughter to have good living conditions because her daughter is barely two years old and she need special care to avoid malnutrition, and Sulma buys her vitamins and foods for her daily consumption.

She wants to continue working to give her daughter all that is necessary because she is a single young woman and she wants her daughter to have all she needs and the care that children deserve.

loans.use: cover some household expenses, such as purchasing milk for her small two-year-old daughter.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto es un joven de 28 años, que vive en una comunidad rural de Nicaragua, en una pequeña finca cuya principal actividad económica es el café. Junto a su esposa, con quien tiene un hijo de 7 años que está en Primaria, ha venido mejorando su finca y diversificando con otras actividades como la compra de venta de ganado. El es un joven que logró obtener el bachillerato pero optó por dedicarse a la agricultura desde hace 10 años aproximadamente, lo cual es algo que conoce desde muy pequeño.

Su pequeña finca, está dentro del grupo de fincas de afiliados a PAC (Asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria) que han sido certificadas por Comercio Justo, como productores de café. Para continuar mejorando los procesos de su finca y contar con capital para las actividades de mantenimiento de su cafetal en este ciclo de cosecha 2013-2014, este joven está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos que contribuyan a los rendimientos y calidad del café que produce.

Su visión por la mejora continua de los procesos que implementa en su finca y su empeño en el trabajo, confía en que le permitirán continuar creciendo y mejorando su pequeña propiedad y su plantación de café.
texts.en:
Gilberto is a young man who is 28 years of age. He lives in a rural community in Nicaragua where he has a small farm. His main business activity is growing coffee. He and his wife have a seven-year-old son who is in primary school. Gilberto has been able to improve his farm and diversify into other activities, such as buying and selling livestock.
