He was able to earn a high school diploma, but he chose to dedicate himself to agriculture, a line of work that he has been in for approximately 10 years. He has gained knowledge in this trade from a very young age.

Gilberto’s small farm is affiliated with PAC (Association for People in Community Action), which includes certified Fair Trade coffee producers. In order to continue improving the processes on his farm, he needs capital to maintain his production activities for the 2013-2014 crop cycle. Therefore, Gilberto is requesting a loan so that he can invest in the purchase of supplies that will contribute to the quantity and quality of coffee that he produces.

His vision is to continue the processes on his farm through his effort and work. He is confident that he can continue growing and improving his small piece of property and his coffee farm.

loans.use: to buy supplies for maintaining his coffee farm.

loans.name: Dúo Señoras De Los Ajvix Group

texts.es:
DÚO SEÑORAS DE LOS AJVIX
Este dúo lo conforma doña María Pilar quien vive en la aldea de Cerro Alto, y tiene 40 años de edad, tiene 7 hijos y 3 de ellos están estudiando y los otros cuatro trabajan, está casada,  tiene una tienda desde hace 4 años donde vende productos comestibles de consumo diario  su negocio está ubicado en su casa, y nos cuenta que está solicitando este crédito para invertirlo en su tienda  ya que quiere empezar a vender algunas verduras porque su tienda está ubicada en el sector en donde hay una escuela y gracias a Dios hay mucha demanda de sus clientes esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles de consumo diario como golosinas,  aguas , y algunas frutas además artículos de consumo diario, espera que se le pueda ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
DÚO SEÑORAS DE LOS AJVIX
This group of two includes María Pilar, who lives in the small town of Cerro Alto. She is 40 and has seven children, three of whom are in school; the other four work. She is married and has had a store in her home for four years where she sells basic staples. She tells us that she is requesting this loan so that she can invest in her store. She wants to start selling some vegetables because her store is located in an area where there is a school, and thanks to God there is a lot of demand. She will use this loan to buy basic everyday staples such as candies, water, fruit, and other items. She hopes that you will be able to help her with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase basic staples.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru: Наталья замужем. Ей 38 лет. Она живет и работает в районе Хуросон. У нее одна дочь в возрасте 15 лет. Наталья отзывчивая и добрая женщина. Она имеет среднее медицинское образование. Её муж таксист, он развозит пассажиров  по нужному маршруту своего района. Наталья имеет аптеку и там она занимается продажей медикаментов. Она фармацевт с богатым опытом. Наталья уже 18 лет работает в этой области. Ей в продвижении деятельности помогает муж и сестра. Наталья берет кредит для закупа медикаментов на продажу с целью увеличения товарооборота. Ее план на будущее - расширение деятельности и открытие еще одной аптеки.
texts.en: Natalya is married.  She is 38 years old.  She lives and works in the Khuroson district.  She has one 15 year-old daughter.  Natalya is a responsive and kind woman.  She has a secondary medical education.  Her husband is a taxi driver, who transports passengers along a necessary route in his district.  Natalya has a pharmacy, where she is involved in selling medicine.  She is a pharmacist with a rich experience.  Natalya has been working in this field for 18 years.  Her husband and sister help her with running this business.  Natalya is requesting this loan to purchase medicine for sale in order to increase goods turnover.  Her plan for the future is an expansion of the business and opening another pharmacy.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for sale in order to increase goods turnover

loans.name: Baraka Alanine Group

texts.fr: La cliente Munguiko est conseillère du groupe d’affaire Baraka alanine,  jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 31 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un cambiste. La cliente est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires (arachides et chikwange). Elle installe ses produits au marché. Elle fut initiée par dans cette activité par sa mère, il y environ 15 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 3 sacs d’arachides, 2 sacs de maniocs, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser ses enfants et construire. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
This client, Munguiko, is the advisor of the business group "Baraka alanine". A young and experienced entrepreneur, she is 31 years old, married, and the mother of eight children, all students. Her husband is a currency exchange agent. This client sells foodstuff, such as peanuts and 'chikwange' (a kind of cassava pasta or dumpling). She sets up her products at the market. She was introduced to this business by her mother about fifteen years ago. She sets up her products at the market. She was introduced to this business by her mother about fifteen years ago. 

This new loan is going to be used to purchase 3 sacks of peanuts, 2 sacks of cassava, etc. Thus, she would like to increase her capital, provide schooling for her children, and build [a house]. So, she thanks Hekima very much for its micro-credit support of small-scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts, cassava, etc.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is 39 years old and a married woman. She has been  providing beauty parlor services to the people of her community for many years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as make-up, hair styling and facials.  Over the time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to attract more customers time after time and for this, she requires hair care products and skin products as well as some packs of hair rollers so she applied for a loan of Rs. 10,000 through Kashf Foundation. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy hair care products and skin products and some packs of hair rollers.

loans.name: Zarqa

texts.en:
Zarqa is a 26-year-old married lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. 

For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors, with packs of laces, zippers and buttons, to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good repayment history. She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her four children.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors as well as packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Maria Aracely

texts.es:
María Aracely tiene una edad de 26 años de edad y es madre soltera de una pequeña niña la cual es menor de edad. Ella cuenta con un grado de educación primaria completa el cual pudo cursar gracias al apoyo de sus padres. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron desde muy joven la actividad de la agricultura en lo que es la siembra y cultivo de papa y brócoli entre otros el cual es vendido a intermediarios que llegan a la zona en busca de un buen producto y en el mercado local. En esta actividad ella obtiene apoyo familiar involucrándose el hermano mayor y su padre trasladándose a pie diariamente hasta la tierra que trabajan la cual está ubicada a 200 metros de su casa de habitación. 

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a COMIXMUL para poder comprar semilla de papa certificada, abono, fertilizantes que pueda mostrar y dar una cosecha positiva y provechosa.

Sus planes como madre es brindarle a su hija todo el apoyo necesario posible para que ella pueda estudiar y prepararse a nivel universitario. Sus metas son las de cumplir con su compromiso y con las ganancias ahorrar una parte y reinvertir en sus cultivos para poder seguir trabajando y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
María Aracely is 26 years old a single mother of a small girl who is a minor. She has a primary-school education, which she was able to complete thanks to support from her parents. It was them who taught her when she was very young to do farming, such as planting and cultivating potatoes and broccoli, among other crops, which are sold through middle-men who come to the area in search of a good product at the local market. For this work, she has gained family support from her older brother and her father, who go by foot every day to the land where they work, which is 200 meters from their house.

She has requested a loan from Kiva partner COMIXMUL to be able to purchase certified potato seeds, compost, and fertilizer that prove to yield a good and plentiful harvest.

Her plan as a mother is to give her daughter all the necessary support possible so that she can study and prepare herself for university-level education. Her goal is to pay her loan, as promised, and with the revenues, save part and reinvest it in her farming to be able to continue working and progressing.

loans.use: purchase certified potato seeds, compost, and fertilizer for planting.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.pt:
Cristina de 37 anos de idade, é casada e tem 2 filhos com idade escolar. Ela é assistente administrativa há mais de 5 anos. O esposo é motorista há 4 anos e ambos tem o mesmo horário de trabalho das 07:00h as 15:30h. Sustentam também uma sobrinha que vive com eles. 

O empréstimo será aplicado na compra de areia, cimento, varões e blocos para concluir a sua casa. 

A Cristina tem como esperança dar continuidade aos seus estudos, fazendo o ensino médio e mais tarde ingressando no ensino superior. O seu principal desafio é concluir a sua casa para melhor confortar a sua família e dar acompanhamento aos estudos dos seus filhos.
texts.en:
Cristina, 37 years old, is married and has two school-aged children. She has been an administrative assistant for more than five years. Her husband has been a driver for four years, and they have the same work schedule: from 7 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. They also support a niece who lives with them.
This loan will used to buy sand, cement, rebar, and cinder blocks to finish her house.
Cristina hopes to continue her studying, completing secondary school and later entering university. Her main challenges are to finish her house so she can offer her family greater comfort and to accompany her two children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, rebar, and cinder blocks to finish construction on her house.

loans.name: Dúo Luz En Mi Camino Group

texts.es:
DÚO LUZ EN MI CAMINO
A cargo de este grupo está la señora María Martina quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, y como actividad secundaria se dedica a la elaboración de refacciones como los tamales.  Ella tiene varios pedidos de cosméticos pero el dinero que tiene no le alcanza y no quiere quedarles mal a sus clientes que le han hecho esos pedidos.  Por  tal razón ella se ve en la necesidad de pedir un nuevo crédito para poder comprar el producto que le hace falta y darles a sus clientes lo que les hace falta, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de cosméticos para la venta.
texts.en:
DÚO LUZ EN MI CAMINO

In charge of this group is Maria Martina who sells cosmetics, and as a secondary business, makes snacks such as tamales. She has several cosmetics orders, but the money that she has is not enough, and she doesn't want to upset her customers who made the orders. Because of this, she sees the need to ask for a new loan to be able to purchase products that she doesn't have and give them to her customers who don't have them yet. She is requesting this loan to purchase cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: purchase cosmetics to sell.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Esperança

texts.pt:
Esperança tem 1 filho, é viúva, vive com uma sobrinha e ajuda a sua mãe que vive em Chimoio, enviando-lhe dinheiro mensalmente. É técnica de contabilidade afecta na cidade de Maputo e trabalha das 07:30 até 15:30 horas.
	Além do seu trabalho, ela tem também um negócio de revenda de produtos alimentares através de entregas na casa dos seus clientes e cobrança no final do mês. O dinheiro do empréstimo será aplicado na compra de produtos para o seu negócio como feijão, arroz e peixe.
	A Esperança diz que sonha em ter um estabelecimento comercial como forma de garantir o crescimento do seu negócio e para isso irá pedir mais empréstimos. O principal desafio é manter o seu negócio.
texts.en: Esperança has one son. She is a widow and lives with a niece; she also supports her mother, who lives in Chimoio, sending her money every month. She is an accountant in Maputo and works from 7:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. In addition to her work, she also has a business selling groceries. She makes home deliveries to her customers and charges them at the end of the month. The loan will be used to buy products for her business such as beans, rice, and fish. Esperança says that she dreams of having a commercial establishment as a way to expand her business, which is why she is requesting loans. Her main challenge is to keep her business going.

loans.use: to buy products for her business such as beans, rice, and fish.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.pt:
Lidia de 45 anos de idade, é viuva e tem 1 filho com 19 anos de idade que está a estudar. Ela é empregada domestica há mais de 6 anos. O seu horário de trabalho é das 08:00h as 17:00h. Sustenta também uma sobrinha que vive com eles. 


A Lídia tem também um negócio de compra e venda de frangos. O empréstimo será aplicado na compra de frangos para vender numa banca fixa e assim reforçar o seu negocio.

A Lidia tem como esperança ver o seu filho concluindo o ensino superior e entrar no mercado de emprego. O seu principal desejo e de construir umas casas anexas à sua casa para dar de aluguer e assim aumentar o seu rendimento.
texts.en:
Lidia, 45 years old, is a widow and has one 19-year-old son who is studying. She has been a domestic employee for more than six years. She works from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. She also supports a niece who lives with her.
Lidia also has a business buying and selling chickens. She will use this loan to buy chickens to sell at a fixed price and thus strengthen her business.
Lidia hopes to see her son finish university and enter the job market. Her main desire is to build some other houses adjacent to her own to rent out and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.pt:
Aurora é separada, estudou até à oitava classe e vive na casa própria. Tem 7 filhos, dois dos quais frequentam o nível superior; dois frequentam a sétima e décima classes respectivamente e os outros filhos já pararam com os estudos.
	Aurora tem um negócio de venda de produtos alimentares. Alguns produtos vende num estabelecimento em sua casa e os mais populares, como milho, vai entregar directamente a casa dos seus clientes e cobra os valores no final do mês. O dinheiro do empréstimo será aplicado na compra de produtos alimentares como: peixe, farinha, arroz e caldo.
	Futuramente diz que pretende comprar uma camioneta para transporte de mercadorias visto que paga valores altos para transportar os seus produtos desde o local onde os compra e por consequência tem tido baixos lucros. Isto permitiria ampliar o seu negócio para isso irá pedir mais empréstimos na Hluvuku.
texts.en: Aurora is divorced. She finished the eighth grade and lives in her own home. She has seven children, two of whom are in university and two of whom are in high school; the rest of them have already completed their studies. Aurora has a business selling groceries. She sells some out of her home, and the most popular products, such as corn, she delivers directly to her clients' houses and collects the payments at the end of the month. She will use this loan to buy food products such as fish, flour, rice, and stock. In the future she would like to buy a truck to transport merchandise, since she pays a lot of money to transport products from the place where she buys them and therefore makes low profits. This would allow her to expand her business and request further loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy food products such as fish, flour, rice, and stock to sell in her home business.

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.fr: Marie Claire est une femme de 55ans divorcée mère d'un enfant agé de 29 ans qui va toujours à l'école. Elle a cinq autres personnes à sa charge (petits fils et neuveux). Elle vend des fruits et vivres frais ( piments, plantains, maïs...etc) depuis 21 ans à un marché de la place. Elle achète en petite quantité pour revendre et aimerai avec ce crédit augmenter le stock de de ses marchandises.  Ce qui lui permettre de vendre plus de d'augmenter de bénéfice, profit qu'elle économisera  pour la scolarisation de ses petits fils et agrandir son activité dans le temps.
texts.en: Marie Claire is a 55-year-old woman who is divorced and the mother of a 29-year-old child, who is still in school. Marie Claire has five other persons to support (grandchildren and nephews). She has been selling fruit and fresh staple foods (chili peppers, plantains, corn, etc…) for 21 years at a local market. She makes her purchases in small amounts and then resells the goods. She would like to use this loan to increase her inventory of goods. This will enable her to sell more and increase her profit, which she will save to provide schooling to her grandchildren and to expand her business over time.

loans.use: to buy fruit and staple foods wholesale

loans.name: Edgar Eulogio

texts.es:
Edgar es un hombre de 38 años, aprendió a trabajar desde que era niño, pues los recursos de su familia eran limitados y él no pudo continuar sus estudios después de la primaria. Hace algunos años decidió unirse con su pareja Gloria que tiene 33 años y es ayudante de cocina en un restaurant, con esta mujer Edgar ha formado un hogar con cuatro hijos preciosos quienes estudian en la escuela pública y Edgar espera darles la oportunidad que él no tuvo de culminar sus estudios hasta que sean profesionales. Edgar vive con su familia en la Parroquia de Río Verde de Santo Domingo, la capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, una provincia de Ecuador que en los últimos años ha tenido un alto crecimiento sostenido. Su capital  es una ciudad en donde lo más atractivo y llamativo son sus deliciosas frutas, y la gastronomía que ofrecen en el lugar. También cuenta con un comercio considerable  ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio comercial entre las regiones Sierra y Costa del país. Además cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos que acompañados de su clima cálido son muy concurridos por turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Es por esto que la mayoría de sus habitantes han emprendido con alguna actividad comercial o de servicios para habitantes y turistas.
Edgar trabaja independientemente desde hace 4 años en la crianza de cerdos para su posterior comercialización, empezó a trabajar en esta labor para conseguir ingresos adicionales a su trabajo, ahora se dedica más tiempo, sin embargo, es un negocio que está saturado ya que muchos habitantes de la zona se dedican a la venta de animales, pero Edgar tiene clientes que le buscan por el buen cuidado que le da a los animales y los precios justos a los que vende. En una anterior ocasión Edgar formó parte de un grupo con el que obtuvieron un crédito en Fundación Alternativa, en esta ocasión solicita un préstamo de forma independiente que lo invertirá en la compra de cerdos y también pollos para así incrementar su negocio y obtener mejores utilidades que le permitan brindar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida. Edgar afirma que la primera vez que trabajó con Fundación Alternativa sintió mucha seguridad y se sintió respaldado por la institución a través de la asesoría de su ejecutivo de cuenta que le ha ayudado mucho con consejos de cómo administrar su negocio.
texts.en:
Edgar, 38, learned to work when he was a child as his family had limited resources and he could not continue his education after primary school. A few years ago he decided to marry his partner Gloria, a 33 year old kitchen assistant. With this woman, Edgar has created a home with four children who are all studying at the public school and Edgar hopes to give them the opportunities that he never had to study until they are professionals. 

Edgar and his family live in the Río Verde de Santo Domingo parish, the capital of the Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas province. A province of Ecuador that in recent years has sustained a high level of growth. Its capital is a city that names delicious fruits and gastronomy as its most attractive and appealing offerings. It also counts on a considerable commerce as it has become a gateway of commercial exchange between the desert and coastal regions of the country. It also counts on various tourist attractions that along with the warn climate mean it is often frequented by domestic and foreign tourists. It is for this reason that the majority of its residents have set up some kind of commercial activity or service for residents and tourists.

Edgar has been working independently for 4 years, growing pigs and later selling them. He started working in this trade to earn supplementary income for his work. Now he dedicates more time to it, however, it is a business that is saturated as many residents in the area sell animals for a living. Edgar has customers who look for him as he gives good care to the animals and sells them for a fair price.

Previously, Edgar was part of a group that obtained a loan from Fundación Alternativa, on this occasion he is requesting a loan independently to buy pigs and chickens so that he can grow his business and earn better profits to allow him to give his family a better quality of life. Edgar asserts that the first time he worked with Fundación Alternativa, he felt much safer and felt supported and by the institution through the consultant in charge of their account who gave him lots of advice on how to run his business.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Decontee

texts.en:
Decontee is a 38-year-old businesswoman from Liberia.  She is married and has three children, between 12 and 3.  They are currently attending school and live at home.  She was unfortunate and did not attend school so decided to run a business.  She describes herself as a hard-working woman.

She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating 'fufu', a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Decontee has a table business where she has been selling peppers, rice, Vita, salt, onions, etc for the past three years.  She works from 7am to 6pm every day at her business.  Her greatest challenge in business is too little income. She intends to use the loan to buy more peppers, rice, Vita, salt, onions, etc for her business. She started her business by selling for her mother.  She likes her business because it helps to support her home.  She hopes to one day to own a house.  

She wants to thank Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy more peppers, rice, Vita, salt, onions, etc for her business.

loans.name: Orlieta

texts.pt:
Orlieta tem 30 anos e vive na casa própria com o marido e 3 filhos (2 deles vão à escola e a outra não tem ainda idade escolar).
	A Orlieta e o seu marido têm um estabelecimento de venda de produtos alimentares de primeira necessidade em sua casa, onde trabalham quase todo o dia. O dinheiro do empréstimo será aplicado no seu negócio comprando produtos como farinha de milho, açúcar e bolachas para revenda.
	Orlieta sempre teve sonho de aumentar o volume do seu negócio e procurar um espaço para construir uma moradia para os seus filhos. O desafio principal é continuar com o seu negócio e concluir a ampliação da sua casa.
texts.en: Orlieta is 30 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and three childre (two of whom are in school and one of whom is still too young to study). Orlieta and her husband have a business selling staple groceries in their home, where they work most of the day. They will use this loan to buy products for their business such as corn flour, sugar, and crackers. Orlieta has always dreamed of expanding their business and finding a space to build a house for their children. Her greatest challenges are to keep her business going and finish expanding her house.

loans.use: to buy products for her business such as corn flour, sugar, and crackers.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.pt:
A D. Lúcia de 46 anos de idade, é viúva e tem 4 (quatro) filhos, dos quais 3 (três) são maiores de idade e uma é menor de idade estando a frequentar o ensino primário.
Ela è negociante e vende refeições e bebidas na sua própria casa. O presente empréstimo será aplicado na compra de mercadoria (frangos, peixe, arroz, cerveja e refrigerantes) para reforçar o volume do seu negócio. A D. Lúcia já faz esta actividade há muito tempo e a maioria dos seus clientes são camionistas que viajam frequentemente desde a África do Sul e fazem encomendas das suas refeições.
Tem como esperança aumentar o volume do seu negócio e melhorar as condições da vida.
texts.en:
46-year-old Lúcia is a widow and has four children. Three of children are adults and the other one is an underage daughter who attends elementary school.
She's a merchant who sells meals and beverages from her own home. The current loan will be used to purchase merchandise (chickens, fish, rice, beer and sof drinks) in order to boost her business. Lúcia has been in this line of work for a long time. Most of her customers are truck drivers who travel from South Africa on a regular basis and order her meals.
She hopes to boost her business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (chickens, fish, rice, beer and soft drinks) in order to boost her business.

loans.name: Buena Vista Group

texts.es:
Las señora Margarita es madre soltera, tiene 43 años de edad, cursó 2 años de educación primaria tiene 6 hijos y 2 de ellos estan estudiando, ella se dedica a tejer guipiles y cortes típicos, inició este negocio por la enseñanza de su madre y hasta la fecha lleva 30 años de experiencia en ese ramo.

Ella decide organizar un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de hilos para tejer guipiles y cortes, en el futuro desea tener más capital para poder producir más y poder vender en otros lugares; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a tejer guiplies y cortes típicos. En la fotografia aparecen 7 integrantes pero, solo se les concedió el préstamo a 5 de ellas.
texts.en:
Margarita is a single mother, 43 years old, completed two years of primary school, and has six children, two of of whom are in school. She weaves guipiles (regional clothing of the indigenous people) and traditional clothing. She started this business that her mother taught her, and to date, has 30 years of experience in this field.

She decided to organize a group and request a loan that she will use to purchase threads for weaving the guipiles and traditional clothes. In the future she wants to have more capital to be able to produce more and be able to sell in other places. The other group members weave guipiles and traditional clothes. In the photo, there are seven members, but only five of them took the loan.

loans.use: purchase threads for weaving.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has four children, and has been doing this work for seven years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs and tea.

He stated that selling tea is the most enjoyable thing about farming, and that his biggest challenge is the drought season.  Animals on the farm have been given the name "Kaplelach."

Robert was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, "Good interest rates."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session.  'It gives loans," he said.

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Robert replied, "It will increase income.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Robert owns a cow, poultry and a bicycle, but does not own a pig, a pump, a motorcycle or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a TV or a DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Inzan

texts.fr:
Né en Décembre 1972 à Kolondièba (Préfecture  de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali), INZAN réside à Kolondièba ville avec ses 8 enfants et ses femmes dans une famille traditionnelle.
 Monsieur INZAN s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de carburant et des pièces détachées (auto- moto) depuis  maintenant 6 ans. Il est très apprécié et sollicité au marché et surtout les jours de foire. 
INZAN collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  quatrième prêt, après avoir correctement remboursé les précédents. 
INZAN compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 fûts  de carburant. Il s’approvisionne à Koumantou. Il effectue ses ventes au comptant et en détail dans ses points de vente à une clientèle  composée d’hommes et de femmes.
INZAN espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 95.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born in December 1972 in Kolondièba (prefecture of the third administrative region of Mali), Inzan lives in Kolondièba town with his eight children and his wives in a traditional family unit. 

 Monsieur INZAN became interested early on in income-earning activities, notably, the sale of fuel and spare parts (for cars and motorcycles) which he has been doing for six years now. He has a good reputation and is sought after at the market and especially on fair days. 

Inzan has been working together with Soro Yiriwaso to increase his working capital so that he can satisfy his ever-growing clientele. He is on his fourth loan after having correctly reimbursed the preceding ones. 

Inzan intends to use his loan to buy five barrels of fuel. He buys his stock in  Koumantou. He makes his sales for cash, retail, at his various sales locations to a clientele composed of men and women. 

Inzan hopes to make a monthly profit of 95,000 F CFA which will be used to cover family expenses, reimburse the loan, and invest in his businesses.

loans.use: to buy fuel

loans.name: Uaminifu Rénové Group

texts.fr: La cliente Vambesa est leader du groupe de crédit « Uaminifu Rénové » entrepreneur  talentueuse,  âgée de 46 ans et mère de 6 enfants, qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire de l’administration publiquetiers. La cliente exerce des petits métiers d’artisanat (broderie). Elle commença cette activité avec le fonds reçu de son mari, il y a environ 13 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter  des matériels de broderie. Dans le futur, elle souhaite agrandir son entreprise en ouvrant un atelier dans le centre ville, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien en micro crédit aux femmes entrepreneurs.Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
This client, Vambesa, is the leader of the loan group "Uaminifu Rénové". A talented entrepreneur, she is 46 years old and the mother of six children, all students. Her husband is a civil servant. This client works in the small artisanal trades (embroidery). She started this business with funds from her husband about thirteen years ago. This new loan will be used to purchase some supplies and equipment for embroidery. 

For the future, she would like to expand her enterprise by opening a workshop downtown and  to provide schooling and food for her children. So, she thanks Hekima for its micro-credit support of women entrepreneurs. It should be noted that certain clients in the photo are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for embroidery

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: Bernadette est une femme de 58 ans veuve, mère de 07 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 6 et 24 ans, quatre vont encore à l'école. Elle est commerçante depuis 11 ans dans une gare ou elle vend du bois. Ayant contacté un crédit il ya un an, son activité a un peu progressé. Elle voudrait bien contracter un nouveau qui puisse l'aider dans la même logique. En fait, elle aimerait résoudre un problème de rupture de stock auquel elle est confrontée Ceci l'aidera à péréniser son activité et à nourrir sa famille de même que économiser pour les rentrées scolaires.
texts.en: Bernadette is a 58-year-old woman, a widow, and the mother of seven children, from 6 to 24 years old, of whom four are still in school. Bernadette has been a merchant for eleven years at a station where she sells lumber. Having had a loan a year ago, her business has progressed a little. She would like to have a new loan that may help her in the same way. In fact, she would like to resolve an inventory shortage she is faced with. This loan will help make her business sustainable and feed her family, as well as save money for the back-to-school season.

loans.use: to diversify her merchandise

loans.name: Carlos  Alfredo

texts.es: Carlos de 43 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su esposa, es empleado trabaja de administrador en una empresa que está cerca de su lugar de residencia  tiene varios años de trabajar en esa actividad con el pago que recibe logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, carlos esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de una turbo cocina ecológica ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder comprarla.
texts.en:
Carlos, 43, lives in a relative’s house with his wife. He is employed as an administrator at a company that is close to his place of residence. He has worked at that job for many years. With the pay he receives, he manages to cover some household expenses.

Carlos is requesting a loan for the purchase of an environmentally-friendly turbo-cooker because he can’t afford to buy it with what he earns.

loans.use: to buy an environmentally-friendly turbo-cooker.

loans.name: María Ruth

texts.es: Sandra de 31 años de edad es una mujer que desde su adolescencia se apasionó por los negocios, cuenta que cuando estudiaba en el colegio era la vendedora de dulces de la clase. Siempre soñó con tener su propio negocio pero no contaba con los recursos para su proyecto, por lo cual al terminar sus estudios de bachillerato se empleó en el sector de confección, allí laboró por varios años y luego renunció cansada de la explotación que recibía por parte de sus superiores. Con la liquidación comenzó vendiendo ropa a sus familiares y vecinos y luego con la rentabilidad del negocio decidió colocar un local. En la actualidad ofrece servicio de papelería, helados y venta de ropa. Su mayor deseo es acreditar su negocio, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el que comprará artículos escolares para la temporada de principio de año.
texts.en: Sandra, 31 years old, is a woman who, since adolescence, has been passionate for business. She says that when she was in college, she sold sweets to the class. She always dreamed of having her own business, but she didn't have the resources for her project. Because of this, when she finished her bachelor's degree, she started working in the confectionery sector. She worked there for several years and later quit, tired of being exploited by her superiors. With the settlement, she started selling clothes to her family members and neighbors, and later, because of the profitability of the business, decided to open a shop. Now she offers stationery services, ice cream, and clothing sales. Her biggest wish is to solidify her business, which is why she is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase school supplies for the start of the year.

loans.use: purchase ingredients for preparing meals.

loans.name: Bineta's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 6 femmes qui habitent le même village et font toutes le commerce. Il est a son 10éme prêt. Bineta est la représentante du groupe,elle est âgé de 43 ans ,mariée et mère de 3 filles de (16,12,9 ans) et 5 garçons de (21,18,15,11,et 4 ans). Elle  fait du commerce de Crustacés. elle attend sur le quai l'arrivé des pirogues qui revient de pèche et achète tout leur arrivage et après elle vend en séchant une partie et l'autre au frais.Avec son prêt elle compte acheter 5 pirogues de 100kg de Crustacés a 100000f chacun .Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires , sanitaires et scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en: This group is composed of six women who live in the same village. They all work in commerce. They are on their tenth loan. Bineta is the group's representative. She is 43 years old, married, and the mother of three girls (16, 12, and 9 years old) and five boys (21, 18, 15, 11, and 4 years old). She does commerce in shellfish. She waits at the wharf for the boats to arrive back from fishing, and she purchases their entire load. Later, she sells some of the goods dried and some of them fresh. With her loan, she intends to purchase 5 boats of 100 kg of shellfish at 100,000 francs each. The profits generated enable her to provide for her children in terms of food, healthcare, and schooling.

loans.use: to purchase shellfish to sell

loans.name: Dolores Santos

texts.es:
Dolores tiene 40 años de edad, esta casado y tiene tres hijos. Se dedica a la prestación de sus servicios en la alcaldía municipal como albañil. Oficio que aprendió hace 25 años; es decir desde que tenia 15 años de edad, conocimiento que adquirió a través de su padre;  ya que su padre es albañil y lo guío a aprender el oficio comenzando como ayudante de albañil y ahorra es un experto en la actividad.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 1 corta frío para cortar hierro,1 pulidora para cortar hierro, 1 pulidora para cortar madera, 1 torno, 1 juego de brocas, 1 trasformador para soldadura, .2 cucharas , 2 mordazas, 1 tenaza, 1 martillo de hule, etc., todas aquellas herramientas necesarias para realizar su trabajo. De esta manera, poseerá las herramientas necesarias y en buen estado para desempeñar mejor su trabajo; ya que no dispone de todas las herramientas para realizar las actividades como albañil, pero que con el apoyo del crédito tendrá mejores ingresos al no tener atrasos en su trabajo. Se le presentaran mayores oportunidades de trabajo ya que contara con lo básico para desempeñar su trabajo.

Planea seguir trabajando como albañil; ya sea por cuenta propia o por contrato como lo esta realizando en estos momentos lo cual a sido su principal fuente de ingresos para  sacar a su familia adelante y darle la oportunidad de estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dolores, 40, is married and has three children. He offers his services as a bricklayer through the municipal council. He learnt this trade 25 years ago, when he was 15 years old. He learnt the trade from his father, as his father is a bricklayer and guided him to start the job beginning as an apprentice and now he is an expert in the trade.

He is asking Fundación Campo for the loan so he can buy a cold cutter to cut iron, a metal sander, a wood sander, a lathe, a set of drill bits, a transformer for the soldering iron, 2 knives, 2 clamps, a set of pliers, a rubber hammer, etc., all of which are tools he needs for his job. This will allow him to have all the tools he needs and will be in a better position to do his job. Currently, he does not have all the tools he needs to work as a bricklayer, but with the support of the loan he will have better income and will not have delays in his work. Better work opportunities will be available to him as he will be able to rely on the basic tools he needs to carry out his work.

He plans to keep working as a bricklayer, be it as a freelancer or on contract as he is working at the moment and which has been his primary source of income to help his family to succeed and provide his children with the opportunity to be educated.

loans.use: to buy a cold cutter to cut iron, a metal sander, a wood sander, a lathe, a set of drill bits, a transformer for the soldering iron, 2 knives, 2 clamps, a set of pliers, a rubber hammer, etc., all of which are tools he needs for his job.

loans.name: Simiao

texts.pt:
O Sr Simiao de 57 anos de idade, casado, vive na sua própria casa e tem 6 filhos, todos maiores de idade e independentes. Ele è operário agrícola.
O Presente empréstimo sera aplicado na compra de material de construção (cimento, ferro, porta, barrotes e pagamento de mão-de-obra) para dar continuidade a construção da sua casa.
O Sr Simiao alem de ser operário agrícola è Agricultor na sua própria machamba, na qual produz feijão para trazer um rendimento extra para a sua família.
texts.en:
Simiao is 57 years old and married. He lives in a house that he owns and he has six children, all of whom are adults and independent. He's a farm worker.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (cement, iron, a door and beams) and to pay for labor in order to continue building his house.
Aside from being a farm worker, Simiao is also a farmer on his own land. There he grows beans so that he can bring extra income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, iron, a door and beams) and to pay for labor in order to continue building his house.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.pt:
A D. Teresa de 33 anos de idade, casada, vive na sua própria casa e tem 04 ( quatro ) filhos dos quais 3 (tres ) frequentam a escola no ensino primário e outro filho não tem idade de frequentar a escola.
Ela è negociante de roupa e tem um estabelecimento localizado no Mercado. O presente empréstimo será aplicado na compra de mercadoria (Calcas, Camisas e chinelos) para aumentar o volume de mercadoria para venda.
A D.Teresa pretende adquirir um congelador para armazenar refrigerantes e outras bebidas para revenda e para assim ampliar o volume do seu negócio e poder sustentar a sua família.
texts.en:
33-year-old Teresa is married and lives in a house that she owns. She has four children, three of whom attend elementary school and the other son is too young to attend school.
She sells clothing and owns a store located in the market. The current loan will be used to purchase products (trousers, shirts and flip-flops) in order to stock up on merchandise for selling.
Teresa intends to acquire a freezer so she can store soft drinks and other beverages for re-selling. That way she'll expand her business and she'll be able to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase products (trousers, shirts and flip-flops) in order to stock up on merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Celeste

texts.pt:
Celeste tem 39 anos de idade, é casada e tem 4 filhos com idade escolar. O seu esposo é reporter de um jornal nacional e o seu horario de trabalho é das 07:00h as 15:30h. Eles sustentam também uma sobrinha que perdeu os seus pais e vive com eles.
Celeste é negociante e vende no quintal da sua casa. O emprestimo sera aplicado na compra de um fardo de roupas, cerveja, carne, ovos, refrescos e arroz, para reforcar o seu negocio.
  Celeste tem como esperanca fazer crescer o seu negocio e dar acompanhamento nos estudos dos seus filhos ate ao ensino superior. O seu maior desafio e de construir uma mercearia maior no quintal da sua casa, e tambem concluir a sua casa uma vez que ainda esta em obras para melhor confortar a sua familia.
texts.en:
Celeste is 39 years old. She's married and has four school-aged children. Her husband is a reporter for a national newspaper and works from 7 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. They also support a niece who has lost her parents and lives with them.
Celeste is a merchant and makes her sales on the yard of her house. The loan will be used to purchase a bundle of clothing, beer, meat, eggs, refreshments and rice in order to boost her business.
Celeste's hope is to make her business grow and to oversee her children's studies until they go to college. Her biggest challenge is building a larger grocery store on her yard, and also finishing her house which is still under construction so her family will be more comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of clothing, beer, meat, eggs, refreshments and rice in order to boost her business.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto tiene 18 años de edad, esta soltero. Aprendió el oficio de agricultor desde que era un niño su papá fue quien le enseño, ya que él nunca fue a la escuela siempre se dedico a la agricultura, porque es su única fuente de ingresos para subsistir. Él siembra 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz en una de las laderas muy empinadas lo cual hace que sus labores en el cultivo sean mas difíciles, ya que es muy duro el trabajo que se realiza a diario para  mantener el cultivo en muy buenas condiciones y así tener una mayor cosecha, sus fertilizantes los llevan en el lomo hasta donde se encuentra su milpa, ya que en vehículo no se puede llegar.

Para comprar los insumos aborda un autobús en su comunidad, en el cual viaja durante 20 minutos hasta la ciudad mas cercana. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar 8 sacos de abono  para sembrar 14,000 metros cuadrados maíz y 14,000 metros cuadrados de maicillo de verano, entre otros insumos para su cultivo. A él se le dificulta mucho salir a la ciudad a comprar sus insumos por poquitos, por lo que si se le aprueba el crédito comprara todo de un solo viaje, lo que le ahorrara tiempo y dinero. Al  tener todos sus insumos en casa,  podrá dar un manejo a tiempo a su milpa, lo que vendrá a incrementar su producción y sus ingresos, para pagar su crédito y alimentar a su familia.


 Planea trabajar duro y ahorrar dinero para comprar un despacito de tierra y hacer una casa para vivir con su familia, ya que actualmente viven en una casa de bahareque.
texts.en:
Rigoberto, 18, is single.  He learned to work in agriculture since he was a boy; his father taught him.  He never went to school and has always worked in agriculture because that’s his only source of income to subsist.  He plants 14,000 square meters of corn on very steep hillsides which makes his work very much more difficult because the work he does daily to care for his crops to keep them in good condition and yield higher harvests is very hard.  He carries his fertilizer on his back all the way to his corn fields because they are inaccessible by vehicle.  To buy supplies he takes a bus from his community to the nearest city, a 20 minute trip.

The loan he’s asking for is to buy 8 sacks of manure among other farm supplies to plant 14,000 square meters of corn and 14,000 square meters of summer sorghum.  It’s very difficult for him to go to the city to buy small amounts of supplies so if the loan is approved he will be able to buy everything in one trip which will save time and money.  By having all the supplies at home, he will be able to provide his corn field with care in a timely fashion which will lead to increased production and income to repay his loan and to feed his family.  He plans to work hard and to save money to buy a small lot to build a house to live in with his family since they currently live in a house made of mud and twigs.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Ordoñez Jf Group

texts.es:
El señor Nicolas esta unido de hecho, tiene 31 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela, tiene 2 hijos y no estan estudiando, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, inició este trabajo con su padre ayudandolo a cultivar sus tierras y hasta la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia, también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa.

Decide organizar un grupo y solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de fertilizante para hecharle a sus cosechas y asi cultivar mejor, en el futuro desea tener más terreno para poder cultivar en cantidad y asi obtener mejores ganancias; los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a cultivar la tierra.
texts.en:
Nicolás is in a common law relationship and is 31-years-old.  He never went to school.  He has two children who are not attending school.  He works growing corn and beans having started this work helping his father to till his soil and to date has ten years’ experience; his wife helps him.

He decides to organize a group to request a loan he’ll use to buy fertilizer to spread among his crops so they’ll grow better.  In future he wants to have more land to grow large amounts and earn higher profits.  The other group members work the land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Sandra Emperatríz

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 40 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos. Es una persona que tiene varios años de dedicarse a la agricultura y a la sastrería actividades que ha desarrollado durante varios años; las que fueron aprendidas de sus  padres. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a sus hijos para prepararse para irse a la parcela que alquila donde pasa parte de la mañana, luego sus hijos se dirigen a la escuela y ella se dedica a la sastrería durante el resto del día

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar tres novillas que le vende un vecino a un precio bastante accesible. Con la compra de las novillas podrá repastar los animales y obtener un buen ingreso para el sustento de su familia,  en un futuro desea darles una educación universitaria a sus hijos y que lleguen hacer profesionales.
texts.en:
Sandra, 40, is the mother of three children.  She’s a person who has been working in agriculture and tailoring, activities she’s developed for several years and that she learned from her parents.  She rises at 5am together with her children to get ready to head for the farmland she leases and where she spends the morning.  Then her children head to school and she spends the rest of the day tailoring.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy three heifers a neighbor is selling her at a very affordable price.  With the purchase of the heifers she will be able to put the animals to pasture and earn good income to support her family.  In future, she’d like to provide her children with university education so they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy three heifers.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Ines, de 55 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser alegre y sociable, es viuda y vive en compañía de sus dos hijos de 22 y 28 años de edad respectivamente en la casa de su hijo mayor. Ines se dedica a la venta de pescado, el cual su hijo pesca en los lagos de la localidad. Esta venta lo realiza de manera ambulatoria a los comerciantes del mercado de su localidad , lleva en está actividad un promedio de 15 años. Comenta que  su negocio es rentable  porque le ha generado muchas satisfacciones tanto personales  como económicas ya que con los ingresos ha podido solventar los gastos de su hogar, así como comprarse enseres del hogar entre otros gustos, además comenta que con las buenas ganancias que le deja sobre todo en tiempos de escasez, tiene planeado ampliar su negocio y hacerlo crecer para así tener más ingresos. Este será su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo para avanzar con su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1300 nuevos soles planea comprar de materiales para pescar como redes y anzuelos.
texts.en:
Inés, 55, is a hardworking, dedicated woman in addition to being cheerful and sociable.  She’s a widow living with her two children who are 22 and 28 years of age respectively in her oldest son’s house.  

Inés works selling fish he son fishes in local lakes.  She sells from place to place to merchants in her local market.  She’s been in this occupation for about 15 years.  She comments that it’s profitable because it’s given her many personal and economic satisfactions because income has allowed her to cover household expenses as well as to buy home appliances among other things.  She also comments that the good profits she earns have made it possible for her to survive times of scarcity.  She plans to expand the business and make it grow to earn higher income.

This will be her third Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she’s been getting to advance in business.  She also commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the 1,300 soles to buy fishing supplies like nets and hooks.

loans.use: to buy fishing supplies like nets and hooks.

loans.name: Maria Hilda

texts.es: MARIA HILDA ES ORIGINARIA DE SAN MARTIN JILOTEPEQUE TIENE 34 AÑOS Y DESDE HACE APENAS 3 AÑOS QUE DECIDIO INICIAR UN NEGOCIO EN SU CASA DE HABITACION Y ANALIZANDO QUE EN SU ALDEA NO HABIA UNA TIENDA DE CONSUMO. DECIDIO ABRIR UNA TIENDA DE CONSUMO Y A DIOS GRACIAS LE HA IDO MUY BIEN, ELLA JUNTO A SU ESPOSO HAN SALIDOS ADELANTE CON SU HIJOS LOS CUALES ESTAN ESTUDIANDO Y ELLA TIENE EL DESEO DE QUE SUS HIJOS SIGAN ESTUDIANDO Y POR ESO APOYA A SU ESPOSO EN EL NEGOCIO. DOÑA HILDA ESCUCHO DE FAPE Y KIVA POR MEDIO DE UN AMIGO QUE LE COMENTO, YA QUE ELLA ESTA BUSCANDO QUIEN LA PUEDE AYUDAR A SURTIR MAS SU NEGOCIO, DOÑA HILDA NO TIENE CREDITOS EN NINGUNA INSTITUCION Y ESO LA AYUDARA ASER RESPONSABLE, SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA AGUAS GASEOSAS, JUGOS, AZUCAR, CONCENTRADO Y ARTICULOS DE PRIMERA NECECIDAD.
texts.en:
María Hilda is from San Martin Jilotepeque.  She’s 34-years-old and just three years ago decided to start a home-based business having noted that her village had no grocery store.  She decided to open a grocery store and thanks to God has done very well.  She and her husband are getting ahead with their children who are attending school.  She hopes they will continue in school and this is why she helps her husband with the business.

Hilda heard of Fape and Kiva from a friend who commented to her since she’s looking for help to better stock her store.  Hilda has no loans with any other institution and that helps her to be responsible.  She requests the loan to buy soft-drinks, juices, sugar, concentrate and basic staple items.

loans.use: to buy food items for her store.

loans.name: Lassina

texts.fr:
Né vers 1966 à Koloni/Foulala- Kolondièba (Préfecture de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali), LASSINA réside à Kolondièba ville avec ses 4 enfants et sa femme dans une famille traditionnelle.
 Monsieur LASSINA s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des  produits divers (tapis, parfums, des chaises etc.) depuis plus de vingt ans.  Il est très apprécié et sollicité au marché et surtout le jour de foire. 
Lassina pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir, il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso  et est à son  deuxième prêt, après avoir correctement remboursé le précédent. 
LASSINA compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 tapis, 5 cartons d’eau minérales, des cartons de différentes sortes de parfums et une dizaine de chaises. Il s’approvisionne chez les grossistes à Kolondièba ville. Il effectue ses ventes au comptant en détail et quelques fois à crédit dans boutique à une clientèle  composée d’hommes et de femmes.
LASSINA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born around 1966 in Koloni/Foulala-Kolondièba (town in the 3rd administrative region of Mali), LASSINA lives in the city of Kolondièba with his wife and four children in a traditional family. 

Monsieur LASSINA quickly became interested in revenue-generating activities, and has been buying and selling various products (rugs, perfumes, chairs, etc.) for 20 years. He is well-liked and sought after in the market and especially on market day. 

In order to grow his business and satisfy his ever-growing clientele, LASSINA is working with Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his second loan after having reimbursed his previous loan.

LASSINA wants to use his loan to buy two rugs, five boxes of water bottles, boxes of various types of perfumes, and a dozen chairs. He buys his supplies from the wholesalers in the city of Kolondièba. He sells for cash, at retail, and occasionally on credit to a clientele of both men and women. 

LASSINA would like to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA, which he'll use to meet the needs of his family, reimburse his loan, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy various items.

loans.name: Milton

texts.es: Milton, de 22 años de edad, es un joven trabajador y empeñoso, está casado con Xiomi quien trabaja como cajera en una tienda, vive en compañía de su familia en la casa de su abuelita. Milton desea abrir su puesto de comidas en el frontis de la casa de su abuelita para eso cuenta con una mesa y utensilios necesarios para atender muy bien a sus clientes, ya que viendo que  su zona es transitada considera que tiene demanda y notando la necesidad económica que tiene en su hogar ha decidido abrir este negocio, en el futuro espera tener un restaurante y contar con personas necesarias para este negocio. Este será su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida con el apoyo financiero que recibe para salir adelante , además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 500 nuevos soles comprará tablas de madera para empezar a construir un espacio para su negocio.
texts.en:
Milton, 22, is a young, enterprising man.  He’s married to Xiomi who works as a cashier in a store.  He lives with his family in his grandmother’s house.  Milton wants to open a food stand in front of his grandmother’s house.  To do so he has a table and utensils needed to provide very good customer service.  Noticing that his zone has many passersby he believes demand will be there and noticing the economic need at home he decided to open this business.  In future, he hopes to have a restaurant and to hire the necessary people for this business.

This will be his second Kiva loan and he feels grateful for the financial support he gets to move forward.  Also, he commits to make his payments punctually.  He will use the requested 500 new soles to buy wood boards to start building his food stand.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Cardona Group

texts.es:
El señor Isidro esta unido de hecho con su señora esposa, cuenta con 31 años de edad, curso 4 años de educación primaria, por el momento solo tiene 1 hijo, él se dedica a actividades agrícolas, específicamente siembra maíz y frijol, obtuvo la experiencia ayundando a su padre que desde siempre se ha dedicado a cuiltivar la tierra, y hasta el momento lleva 10 años trabajando independiente.

El decide formar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de fertilizante e incecticidas para su cosecha de maíz y frijol, en el futuro tiene la esperanza de sembrar mas cuerdas de maíz y frijol y esto lo logrará si le conceden el préstamo; los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a cultivar la tierra.
texts.en:
Isidro is in a common law relationship with his wife.  He’s 31-years-old and completed four years of primary education.  At the moment he only has one son.  He works in agriculture, specifically growing corn and beans.  He acquired the experience helping his father who has always worked the land.  To date, he has been working independently for ten years.

He decides to form a group to request a loan to buy fertilizer and insecticide for his corn and bean crops.  In future, he hopes to plant more cord of corn and beans and he’ll do so if the loan is granted.  The other group members work the land too.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Sonia Maria

texts.es:
Sonia es una  señora que vive en la ciudad de Estelí desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica al negocio de pulpería y la venta de cosméticos ella desde que recibió el primer crédito su vida mejoro en gran manera pudo invertir en la pulpería y la venta  de cosméticos este nuevo préstamo  lo está solicitando para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, gaseosas y cosméticos sus hijas que ya están grandes la apoyan en la distribución de sus productos tiene buenos clientes fieles. Ella dice que sus clientes no la cambian ya que da buenos precios vende lo mejor.
 Sus planes futuros son tener un negocio grande que impacte en su sector,  sus metas próximas son aumentar su inventario y tener los productos que sus clientes le están solicitando .
texts.en: Sonia’s a lady living in the city of Estelí for a long time; she works as a grocer and selling cosmetics.  Since she got her first loan her life improved quite a bit; she was able to invest in her grocery store and in selling cosmetics.  She’s asking for this new loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, soft-drinks and cosmetics.  Now that her daughters are older they help her distribute her goods and she has good regular customers.  She says that her customers don’t change because her prices are good and she sells the best.  Her future plan is to have a bigger business that impacts her sector and her near-term goals are to increase inventory and to have the products her customers are asking for.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, soft-drinks and cosmetics.

loans.name: Cynthia Consuelo

texts.es:
Cynthia es una mujer de 22 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tiene de trabajar, Cynthia no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que desea, en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando música y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Cynthia trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella realiza labores de sembrado, riego, cosecha y otros, Cynthia trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Cynthia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un carrito sanguchero, el cual utilizará para poder vender frituras como hamburguesas, salchipapas, pollo broaster y otros, de esta manera Cynthia podrá contar con un poco mas de ingresos, los cuales ahorrará para poder lograr su gran sueño de tener una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Cynthia, 22, is single living in the city of Ica, Parcona District, with her parents and siblings.  She’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person with a strong drive towards self-improvement.  Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources and the need to start work, Cynthia hasn’t been able to study Business Administration like she’d like to.  In her free time she enjoys relaxing listening to music and on occasion cooks a delicious pork stew with noodles to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Cynthia works as a field hand on a large agricultural estate in her city; she does planting, irrigation, harvesting and other chores.  She works every day for about 10 hours and thinks she does well because of the good way she works and the kind way she treats others.

Cynthia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will be able to buy a fast-food cart that she’ll use to sell fast-food like hamburgers, ‘salchipapas’ [fried sausages with fried potatoes], Broaster-style chicken and others in order to have a bit more income to rely on that she’ll save up to reach her dream of owning a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy  food cart.

loans.name: El Milagro De Santa Ana Group

texts.en:
The women of this group call themselves "Milagro de Sta. Ana". Most of the women live in Santa Ana, a very small village on the outskirts of Antigua Guatemala. All of their businesses have been verified by business advisors, who believe that each woman stands to benefit from the support offered by Fundacion Namaste Guatemaya.  In addition to a loan, Namaste provides coaching from business advisors who develop a detailed understanding of the borrowers business (see below an example of how much detail they have on their clients).  

Each of the women in this group are hard-working entrepreneurial ladies that dream of growing and bettering their businesses. Most of them are involved in the production and selling of food. For example, one of them promotes her business on Facebook and provides updates on the new products she will sell in the near future. There is also a woman who sells corn meal (the only one in the area) and another who sells products by catalog. 

Carmen Lucrecia (2nd from left to right) is a 48 year-old single mom who went to school through 9th grade. She has two daughters, one that is already married who contributes Q400 ($53)  per month to the household income and a younger daughter that still lives with her. Her younger daughter also has a daughter and Carmen Lucrecia pays for her school. Carmen Lucrecia has been selling food at the park of Santa Ana for the last 12 years and has become famous for her garlic bread, a product she introduced long ago to differentiate herself from the competition. She calls her big delicious bread “Neco” and this is the main attraction for her customers. She will share this business with her daughters so they have a place to work and support their families as well. 

Her dream is to learn how to manage her income, separate her profit from her personal expenses and be able to save enough money to open a new place to sell food in the village of Jocotenango. Currently she has a profit of Q986 (US$130) and works 240 hours (US$0.54/hour) per month. Her plan for the next 9 months is to increase her profit to Q1,665 (US$220). She knows that with the support of Namaste she will learn how to calculate and better manage her profit so she can open an additional location to sell her food.

loans.use: to save money to open a new location

loans.name: Mujeres Productivas Group

texts.en:
The Mujeres Productivas group is located in Canton Siglo II of municipality Santa Cruz Mulua, in the department of Retalhuleu, Guatemala. 

The group is composed of six hard working women who have know each other for many years. They all are involved in the buying/selling or production/selling of food. In the early educational sessions provided by Fundacion Namaste Guatemaya prior to getting a loan, the group has demonstrated that they are motivated and very interested in learning how to keep control of their expenses and sales. The group also mentioned that previously nobody has taught them how to improve their business. Therefore they are eager to receive Namaste's Business Adviser monthly visit to quantify their business metrics and help improve their profits. 

Lilian is 40 years old, a widow and is raising two kids who are under 15 years-old and are going to school (in the picture, you can see her 4th from left). Lilian does not know how to read and write and is living far away from her family. While she was living with her husband and raising their family, he suddenly fell ill and ultimately passed from an unknown illness.  They exhausted their savings on medical bills and were forced to sell all of their appliances to pay doctors and hospital bills. Widowed and broke with two kids to raise, Lilian moved to a place where she pays no rent and gets electricity from the owner. She started selling tortillas [corn flatbread] door to door and now she has a place to make them and sell them too. Until now, she has been producing the tortillas for lunch and dinner. 

Her dream is to be able to have enough money to buy wood and corn in bulk because it is cheaper and now with the rainy season, dry wood is very difficult to find. With these supplies, she will be able to start producing tortillas for breakfast to meet her clients requests. She wants to learn how to manage her money and separate and save it in a way that she can start purchasing all of the appliances she was forced to sell when her husband got sick. 

Her actual monthly profit is Q1,740 (US$228) and she works 170 hours per month (US$1.35 profit per hour). Her business plan is to increase her profit by 40% by adding an additional selling time and by purchasing dry wood and corn in bulk.

loans.use: buy corn buy bulk and dry wood to improve her production/selling hours

location.town: Canton El Siglo II, Santa Cruz Mulua, Retalhuleu

loans.name: María Alba

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 49 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 17 y 14 años de edad, la menor  estudia en el colegio y el mayor esta por ingresar a la universidad. Su esposo es comerciante.

Doña María además de ser una  gran madre y ama de casa se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo en especial la ropa de niños. Ella también le da parte del crédito a su marido para que este lo utilice en su negocio, él es comerciante de frutas y legumbres en Portoviejo, ciudad que recorre en un triciclo de cuatro a cinco días a la semana. Ella mientras tanto también recorre su localidad ofreciendo sus prendas.  Lleva más de 6 años dedicada a esta actividad mientras que su esposo desde muy joven.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, frutas y legumbres. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.
 
Sus metas son tener buena salud y que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The “Con Amor y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo” (With Love and Faith Towards Development) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city noted for its cultural riches and its crafts like the straw hats that are known both inside and outside the country.

Maria, 49, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has two children who are 17 and 14 years of age.  The younger attends high school and the older is about to start university.   Her husband is a merchant.

Aside from being a great mother and housewife, María is a merchant.  She sells all types of clothes, especially children’s clothes.  She also will give part of the loan to her husband so he can use in his business; he sells fruit and vegetables in Portoviejo, a city he travels around on a tricycle four to five days a week while she also goes around her location selling her clothes.  She’s been in this activity for more than six years while her husband has been in his since he was very young.

She will use this loan to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, fruit and vegetables.  She’s a founding member of the communal bank and likes it because of the help the loans provide.  Her goals are to be in good health and that her children become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy clothes, fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en:
Nickson lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has 3 children and has been doing this work for 6 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and tea.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: General farming and business. His biggest challenge is poor weather. One of the animals on the farm has been named Chelel.

With this loan, Nickson will construct a zero grazing unit (Zero grazing is an approach to animal management in which families contain livestock in an enclosed, shaded area and carry fodder and water to them instead of letting them wander in the open where they are more likely to catch diseases or damage the environment).

Nickson was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, "the low interest rate."  Nickson was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, to which he replied, "It (Juhudi Kilimo) processes loans faster."

His highest monthly expense is school fees for his children. Nickson believes that this loans will positively impact his family by increasing the family's income.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Nickson owns the following: a cow, poultry, and a motorcycle, but does not own a pig, a water pump, a bicycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has mosquito netting in the household but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a TV,  or a DVD player.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has no children and has been working with dairy cattle for 7 years. His primary income sources are milk and tea.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming is selling farm produce. His biggest challenge is the drought season. Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Hillary was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, " The low interest rate." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session,  "It helps farmers."

His highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked how would this loan benefit his family, Hillary replied, "Increased income for family."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Hillary owns the following: cow and motorcycle but does not own a pig, poultry, pump, bicycle, or automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Tungamiai Justine

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe!  This is 31 year old Justine from Bulawayo.  He is married and has two children.  The eldest child is attending primary school. 

Tungamirai Justine runs a retail business selling electrical goods.  The business has been in operation for over 8 years.  He says the main challenges faced are high import duty costs and competition form larger retailers who offer credit facilities over longer repayment periods.  Justine has requested a loan of $500 to stock and fulfill his outstanding orders.  He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to supplement their household income, as well as other expenses and boost business capacity.  In the future Tungamirai Justine plans to have his own electrical gadgets shop selling a variety of goods within the CBD.  He also intends to diversify into the clothing business.

loans.use: to order stocks of radios, TVs, cable connectors, irons, satelite dish kits, speakers, invertors for resale. The goods are bought in neighbouring countries and are sold at a profit back home, prices range from $50 to $300, and profit margins are as much as up to 100%

loans.name: Marjorie Katherine

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Marjorie, tiene 19 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 3 años y el menor de 8 meses de edad. Su esposo es chofer.

Doña Marjorie es una muy buena esposa que  para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta,  ella también trabaja a base de pedidos que le realizan  sus clientes. Trabaja tres días de la semana en las mañanas ya que a estas horas aprovecha que su mamá les cuida a sus hijos. Ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada fin de semana. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita, lleva dos años dedicada al comercio y le ha ido bien con sus ventas.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas entre otras prendas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 ciclos  y le gusta porque es muy fácil conseguir los créditos. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Con Amor y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo” (With Love and Faith Towards Development) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city noted for its cultural riches and its crafts like the straw hats that are known both inside and outside the country.

Marjorie, 19, lives here.  She’s married and has two children; one is three-years-old and the younger one is 8-months-old.  Her husband’s a driver.

Marjorie is a very good wife who in order to help her husband cover household expenses works selling all types of clothes.  She sells door to door and also based on orders placed by her customers.  She works three days a week in the morning because her mother can care for her children at this time.  She sells on credit and collects every weekend.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil whenever she needs to and has been in business two years; her sales have been very good.

This loan is to buy pants, blouses and t-shirts, among other articles of clothing.  She’s been in the communal bank for four cycles and likes it because it’s easy to get loans.  Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Liliana Annabel

texts.es:
